loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia A. is from the village of Benhaan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old and is married with two adult children. Alicia owns and operates a furniture-making business, primarily making and selling bedroom furniture to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora P. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 46 years old. Leonora is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Leonora sells vegetables such as corn in the market and in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Leonora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Leonora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Miatta Group

texts.en:
Miatta S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Miatta Group. She is 41 years old, married, and has nine children who are between the ages of 10 and 25 years. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For 13 years, she has been selling cutlasses, knives, nails, shovels, hammers, hinges, door locks and more in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 15,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 66,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cutlasses, knives, nails, shovels, hammers, hinges, door locks, etc. 

She describes herself as a determined woman whose goals are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cutlasses, knives, nails, shovels, hammers, hinges, door locks, etc.

loans.name: La Rutina Group

texts.es:
El grupo rutina está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas Elizabeth del Carmen M. G. inicio vendiendo hielo, helados, chocobananos, etc. Ella junto con su compañero de vida trabaja arduamente para proporcionarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son Tania de los Ángeles Díaz es una joven trabajadora quien se dedica hacer tolrtillas bastimento por excelencia de los nicaragüenses ella con el préstamo piensa aumentar la producción y Jairo Ramon G. vende de todo un poco desde ropa, zapatos, prenda etc.
texts.en:
The group "Rutina" is made up of 3 hardworking women.  One of these is Elizabeth del Carmen M. G., who started a business selling ice, ice cream, frozen chocolate bananas, etc.  She and her life partner work arduously to provide their children with a better quality of life.  

There are 2 other members of the group.  Tania de los Ángeles Díaz is a hardworking youth who makes tortillas, a Nicaraguan staple.  With the loan, she plans to increase her production.  Jairo Ramon G. sells a little of everything: clothing, shoes, accessories, etc.

loans.use: to buy staple grains and snacks

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chamroeun M., 47, and her husband, Mr. Nao Sok, 50, (pictured together) live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh city. They have been married since 1979 and have six children – three sons and three daughters. Two of them have full-time employment, one is in school and the others are assisting their parents.
Chamroeun and her husband are farmers: they grow papaya, tomatoes and corn. The couple is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 34-year-old businessman. He is married to Monicah, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for the past two years. His monthly income is Kshs. 15,000. With the loan he has applied for, he intends to repair his current motorcycle, and invest in dairy farming by buying a dairy cow. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he intends to start a small business for his wife and invest more in dairy farming. He is applying for his second loan with KADET, after repaying the first loan successfully. His hopes and dreams are to own a taxi, to improve the living standards for his family and to see his children realize their dreams through education.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle and invest in dairy farming

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Ra Y. has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has six children, all of whom are single and living with her. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, and he also helps her to farm. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. Ra Y. is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Unfortunately, her cow is getting old and can no longer support her during the plowing process. Ra Y. is looking for a loan to purchase a new cow to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase new cow to replace the old one.

loans.name: Maria Vita

texts.en:
Maria Vita B. is a single mother who lives in Luyong Baybay, Brgy. Tacup, San Remegio, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating two business ventures: food vending and general store businesses.  She has five children who are 6 to 17 years old.  Maria Vita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maria Vita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  

Her previous loan of PHP 14,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,600, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 which she intends to use to purchase raw materials so that she can continue to save up for the future and the education of her children.  Maria Vita B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Mónica Stefania

texts.es:
Mónica Stefania M. G. tiene 20 años de edad. Vive en  Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con la hija,  vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 1 hija.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE se encuentra ubicada En el recinto Cachel y Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul., esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.
  
Mónica Stefania se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Agro Karlyta y vende su producto en la comercial Olivo.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprar un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Mónica Stefania M. G. is 20 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and their daughter.  They live in the canton of Ventanas in Ríos province.

The members of the "Nuevo Horizonte" ["New Horizon"] Communal Bank are based in the Cachel y Grande precinct, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas. They have a lot of collective experience in this type of work.
  
Mónica Stefania works in agriculture. She grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. She buys products at Agro Karlyta and sells what she produces at the Olivo market.

She is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas. The economic support provided by this loan will help her to meet her needs. She faces challenges like insect plagues and plant illnesses, as well as variations in the climate. Her dream is to be able to buy a piece of land.

She likes sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Sergia

texts.es:
Sergia tiene 28 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Ismael, de 28 años, y sus 6 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

Trabajando arduamente, Sergia ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos. Todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus plantaciones de café y plátano, los cuales, posteriormente, venderá en la ciudad, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para plantar mucho más café.

Este es el primer préstamo de Sergia con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida.
Con los trescientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Sergia is 28 years old.  She is a very humble and happy woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 28 year-old Ismael, and her 6 beloved children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Through her hard work, Sergia has managed to get ahead with her crops.  Every morning she gets up very early to water and care for her coffee and banana plantations.  She will later sell her crops in the city since that is where she obtains the best prices for her products.

What Sergia most likes about her work is that she can enjoy the freedom of working in her fields.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to work her land.  Over time, she hopes to be able to prepare her land so that she can plant a lot more coffee.

This is Sergia's first loan with MFP.  She knows that this loan will help her in making progress and developing her business.  For this reason, she is prepared to make her loan repayments on time.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank, for which reason she is very well liked.  Sergia plans to use the 300 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more manure and fertilizers in order to improve the quality of her land.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith T. is a rice farmer from the town of Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She is 33 years old, married and has two young children. 

Judith has been planting and harvesting rice crops for five years now. She usually sells her harvest to rice traders. Aside from rice farming, she also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market.

Judith joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Judith is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase pig feed and farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and farm inputs

loans.name: 02-Dong Hai Group

texts.en:
Tuynh D. T. (227) is a 59- year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Tuynh is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02-Dong Hai (16-05-02-Dong Hai).

Tuynh is married and has four adult children. T. make a living, Tuynh operates a family member's rice farm. Tuynh has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2004, Tuynh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women T. gain access T. financial services T. help improve her business and living situation. Tuynh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used T. purchase fertilizers such as manure. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,787,900 VND which will be used T. purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops T. raise. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Tuynh from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuynh plans T. use the additional revenue generated from the business T. improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:
1. L. T. T. Van (54) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan T. support her specialized retail store.

2. T. T. Yen (257) is a 34-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan T. support her butcher shop.

3. N. T. Hien (55) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan T. support her livestock business.

4. L. T. Dong (17) is a 38-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan T. support her farming business.

5. L. T. Hieu (52) is a 56-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan T. support her farming business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is T. provide sustainabL. financial services T. disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: T. maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template T. automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner T. allow them T. continue T. post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information T. Kiva lenders.

Tuynh D. T. (227) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Tuynh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02-Dong hai (16-05-02-Dong Hai).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ trồng & thu hoạch gạo để bán.  Tuynh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tuynh kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Tuynh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tuynh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua phân bón như phân chuồng.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,787,900 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  L. T. T. Van (54) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

2.  T. T. Yen (257) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng thịt.

3.  N. T. Hien (55) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4.  L. T. Dong (17) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.

5.  L. T. Hieu (52) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds, glaze and clay to make her crafts

loans.name: Vivina

texts.en:
Vivina L. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Vivina is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Vivina owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) transport services. Vivina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Vivina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivina has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC.  Vivina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a new transport unit. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Vivina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new transport unit.

loans.name: Nael

texts.en:
Nael is an employee and a father of two daughters and three sons. Nael also runs a small grocery store to have a better income that covers the expenses of a big family.

Nael took out a loan from FATEN's Qalqilia branch to purchase larger variety of grocery store item and increase the profit. 

Nael who appears in the picture above inherited the store from his father.

loans.use: to purchase a large variety of goods to sell in a grocery store.

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
X. Trương Thị (20203050008) is a 22-year-old woman who lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 1 child, an infant. To make a living, X. owns and operates a furniture-making business in the manufacturing sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. X. has been engaged in this business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from business activities.

X. joined SEDA in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. X. has successfully repaid a previous SEDA loan of 6,496,000 VND, which was used to purchase  wood as  materials to expand her product offerings. X. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase . This will be her 3rd loan from SEDA. X. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

X. Trương Thị (20203050008) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 1 trẻ ở độ tuổi nhỏ.  Để kiếm sống, X. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  X. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, X. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.

Vào 2009, X. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  X. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  X. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch.  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase wood as material

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene F. is from the village of Brgy. Barat, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 48 years old. Rene is married and has four school-age children. He has been operating his rice-farming business for almost 25 years now. His earnings of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per harvest are being utilized for the school expenses of his children and for his family's daily needs. Rene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rene is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to financially support members of his immediate family.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Angelino

texts.en:
Angelino is 51 years old and married with eight grown children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines. His wife helps him till their farm lot. He has been raising rice for five years already. He earns approximately PHP 50,000 average net income per cropping or for every five months.

Angelino is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 that he will use to purchase a variety of rice and fertilizers. He hopes to harvest more crops by the next cropping season. He is doing his best to make further improvement in the business for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of rice and fertilizers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is from the village of Central Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Gloria is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Gloria buys and sells rice and corn grains in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional sacks of rice and corn grains. This will be Gloria's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice and corn grains

loans.name: Gladys Marcela

texts.es: La Sra. Gladys es conviviente de 47 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos donde uno de ellos dependen de ella. Gladys  se dedica a la venta de pasteles y empanadas donde lleva ya 8 años en el negocio, este trabajo comenzó de a poco con la idea de obtener más ganancias y así poder brindarle una mejor vida  a sus hijos gracias a los préstamo que ella solicito anteriormente pudo invertir más, también nos cuenta que es promotora en educación donde trabaja con niños de 0 a 3 años ayudando en su estimulación,  gracias a sus esfuerzo a podido construir su casa y ayudar con los gastos del hogar. El sueño de Gladys  es de mejorar su casa y de poner un negocio de internet bien implementado. Con el préstamo solicitado Gladys piensa implementar productos para su negocio  como harina, leche, huevo entre azucar entre otros.
texts.en: Gladys is 27 years old and has a live-in partner.  She has two children, one of which is her dependent.  Gladys has worked selling pastries and empanadas for eight years.  She started the business little by little with the idea of earning more income and thus being able to provide her children with a better life.  Thanks to the loans she previously requested, she was able to invest more.  She also tells us that she is an educator, working with children 0-3 years old to help with their stimulation.  Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to build her house and help with the household expenses.  Gladys’ dream is to improve her house and to set up an internet cafe.  With the loan requested, Gladys plans to buy products for her business like flour, milk, eggs and sugar, among others.

loans.use: to buy flour, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a farther of three children who all attend school. 

He is a farmer in his hometown in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. His farm produces milk, tobacco and maize, which all go to the local market and The Mastermind tobacco industries. He operates a motorcycle transport business besides his farming.

Titus has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says this will enable him to pay for the education of his children owing to improved income from the additional cow. He plans to buy more land to expand his farming.

Titus mentions the high cost of animal feed and insufficient rains as the challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Ra, 49 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a fisherman and their income is $4.50 per day. They have six children. Four of the children are studying, one is working in the factory and one helps his farther to fish. Every month, she has to spend $55 on food, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her daughter to travel to work. She plans to buy another bigger boat for her husband when she can save enough money. For the rest of her children who are studying, she will try to support them to finish at least high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughter

loans.name: Nyame Wo Yenho Do(Ankyernyin) Group

texts.en: Dorothy is married and has two children. She sells fish and rice at Talkoradi. Dorothy uses her income to assist her spouse in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will add the loan she hopes to receive to her initial capital to buy raw rice and fresh fish in a large quantity, to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest for further growth. In the picture above, Dorothy has her hand raised.

loans.use: to buy raw rice and fresh fish in bulk, to sell.

loans.name: Tutugirl

texts.en: Tutugirl is 33 years old and lives in the airport community. She stopped her education in the 4th grade. She is married and has three children between 7 and 15 years old who are in school and live at home. Hr husband has been a contractor (building ) for the past 10 years. She has been selling oil, rice, pepper  and charcoal. She started this business with charcoal and learned it from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, pepper, and charcoal, for her business. She likes her business because it enables her to take care of her family. Her plan is to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, pepper, and charcoal

loans.name: Darlinda

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Darlinda.  She is married to a welder and has three children aged 1, 7 and 10 years. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because she helps to them with their education. 

 In 2009, Darlinda established her clothing and plastic slippers business. She began her business because she had dropped out of school. She joined her mother in business until she was able to start her own business. She makes good profit and she is glad to be a self-employed woman.  

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le1,300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.   Darlinda requires a loan in order to buy wax cotton - 2 bales @ Le2,000,000 and 5 bundles of plastic slippers @ Le200,000 for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000.  

In the future, Darlinda plans to build her own house, become an international businesswoman and support her children through their education.  Darlinda always travels to Guinea Conakry to get her goods twice a month. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for wax cotton - 2 bales @ Le2,000,000 and 5 bundles of plastic slippers @ Le200,000.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena tiene 50 años de edad, es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos de veinte y treinta años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C SAN FRANCISCO DE ASIS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rumipamba, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz, fréjol y crianza de animales.
María se dedica al cultivo de maíz, fréjol y crianza de animales. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado del Cantón Chillanes cada fin de semana. Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos y líquidos para la maleza de los cultivos para mantener los productos en buenas condiciones y compra de comida para los animales que tiene para la crianza para lo posterior venderlos en un mejor precio. 

El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad del producto y sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es poderse comprar un terreno para poder sembrar un poco más, comprar más animales para la crianza y poder venderlos para obtener mayores utilidades para el bienestar de la familia.

Es una mujer muy responsable, perseverante, puntual en los pagos y le gusta salir a pasear y conocer otros lugares en compañia de la familia.
texts.en:
María Magdalena is 50 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and their two children, ages 20 and 30, in the Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.

The San Francisco de Asis Communal Bank is located in the Rumipamba district in the Chillanes Canton. The members of this group mainly devote themselves to growing corn and beans and raising animals.

María grows corn and beans and raises animals.  She buys and sells her products at the Chillanes Cantón market every week-end.

She is requesting the loan to buy natural and chemical fertilizers, seeds, supplies, and liquid for the weeds around her crops.  She will do this to keep her crops in good condition.  She will also buy feed for the animals that she is raising in order to later sell them for a better price.

The loan will serve as a support to her by meeting her financial needs and improving the quality of her agricultural products.  She faces challenges like the fall of the prices of the products she sells and the middlemen.  

Her dream is to be able to buy a piece of land in order to be able to grow a little more.  She also dreams of buying more animals to raise and being able to sell them for greater income for the well-being of her family.

She is a very responsible and determined woman, and she is punctual with her payments.

She likes to go for walks with her family and to get to know other places.

loans.use: to buy natural and chemical fertilizers, seeds, supplies, and liquid for the weeds around her crops and to buy more animals to raise.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: El Sr. Joel solicita su préstamo mas que nada por que desea construir  un cuarto en la planta baja de su  domicilio , ya que el se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia, ya  que  el esta casado y tiene  dos hijos para  los cuales  desea  lo mejor afortunadamente   cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de  su esposo   la  cual  también  trabaja ,  agradecen   el apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de su proyecto  ya  que  ve  en  el crédito  la posibilidad  de   brindar  a  su  familia  una  mayor  comodidad.
texts.en: Mr. Joel is requesting a loan because he wants to build a room on the ground floor of his home, since he is looking out for his family's well-being. He is married and has two children, and he wants the best for them. Fortunately, he has his wife's unconditional support. She also works. They are grateful for the support offered for the completion of their project. Joel sees this loan as an opportunity to offer his family greater comfort.

loans.use: to expand the ground floor of his home.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 20 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is single and she stopped her education in 8th grade. For some years now she has been selling fresh meat in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers, but she has insufficient goods.    She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh meat for her business; she hopes to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh meat for her business.

loans.name: Samuel N.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from a primary school in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 9,600,000 SLL in order to solve their immediate financial problems. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.
Samuel is the leader of this group. A native of Moyamba, the 52-year-old is married and has six children – two in secondary school, two in primary school, one in college and the other not attending school. Samuel has served in the teaching profession for 32 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy a plot of land for the future construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for the future construction of a family house.

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.ru:
Лидия замужем. У них с Андреем трое детей. Муж занимается фермерством, а Лидия имеет собственный бизнес.
Лидия занимается выпечкой и реализацией пекарных изделий.  Приемлемые цены и качественная продукция помогли Лидии «держаться на плаву» уже 17 лет. Но она хочет увеличить прибыль и вложить ее в подсобное хозяйство. Лидия трудолюбивая, ответственная и старательная. 
Лидия просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10000 гривен  на ремонт и улучшение торгового места, и закупку продуктов.
texts.en: Lidiya is married.  She and her husband Andrey have three children.  Her husband is involved in farm work, and Lidiya has her own business.  She is involved in baking and selling baked goods.  Reasonable prices and quality products helped Lidiya "to stay afloat" for 17 years.  However, she wants to increase her profits and invest them into her private household.  Lidiya is a hard-working, responsible and diligent person.  Lidiya is requesting a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia to make repairs and improvements to her retail outlet and to buy products.

loans.use: to make improvements to her retail outlet and buy products

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis de 32 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su familia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Luis desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y aves de corral), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y su respectivo alimento, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Luis es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia a pesar de las dificultades de la vida.
texts.en:
Luis is 32 years old and lives in his parents' house with his family. The house has electric service only. It is located in Tambogrande district, pertaining to Piura department. The zone is dedicated to agriculture, livestock-raising, and artisan production.

For some years now, Luis has been raising and selling corral animals (sheep and farm foul). His corrals are located at the back of his house, and they are ample and appropriate. He feeds the animals with the proper feed formulas so that they will have optimal growth, and he can sell them in the zone's different markets and obtain good earnings to pay his family's expenses.

Luis is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 new sols to buy more livestock and their respective feed. With the earnings he will obtain through the sale of his animals, he will be able to cover his loan as well as enjoy a better quality of life. Luis is a person who with effort and much enterprise has been able to advance his family, despite life's difficulties.

loans.use: to buy more farm animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is a 44-year-old lady who is married to Leonard, a 49-year-old man. They are blessed with two lovely daughters: Maria, 10, and Katharina, 6. Both are attending elementary school.

Sherly has been running a food stall business for three years. The business is located at an elementary school about 10 meters from her residence.  Sherly sells yellow rice; fried banana, fried tofu, etc to the children at school. She operates the business from 7 am to 1 pm.

Sherly dreams of improving her income by adding a variety of cakes, meals and snacks as demanded by her customers. She is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to make her dream come true. She is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase more snacks and cake ingredients

loans.name: Awatef

texts.en:
Awatef is a 50-year-old married woman, mother of six children. Awatef has been working selling men's, women's and children's shoes since 2006. She is a hard worker, and she insists on providing the best living for her family.

Just like every mother, Awatef cares a lot for her children's comfort, and that's why she supports and develops her business as much as she can, in order to keep on developing.

Awatef has been an Al Majmoua-KIva partner borrower for two cycles. Her experience with Al Majmoua was very effective and encouraging. Today Awatef is requesting a loan from Kiva, in order to buy a new winter collection  of shoes, attracting enough to new customers and old ones.

She hopes to open another branch to expand her working zone and to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy a range of new winter shoes.

loans.name: Unsi

texts.en:
Unsi is a 40-year-old married woman with six children. All of them are in school. She's had a business of selling maize in Kator, South Sudan for seven years.
 
Unsi requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase maize. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase maize for sale.

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es: La señora Marta a sus 38 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 17 y 9 años de edad, es una emprendedora quien desea iniciar su propio taller de producción de vestidos de baño, esta idea surge del deseo de tener su propia empresa puesto que la señora Marta esta por graduarse de diseñadora de modas. La señora Marta cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en este oficio. La señora Marta requiere de la compra de insumos para iniciar su producción de vestidos de baño, lo que le permita poder iniciar su taller y tener satisfacción personal y profesional. El sueño de la señora Marta es tener su propio almacén de venta de vestidos de baño y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marta, 38, is the mother of two children who are 17 and 9 years of age.  She’s an enterprising woman who wants to start her own bathing suit manufacturing workshop.  This idea arose from her wish to have a business of her own since Marta graduated as clothing designer.

Marta has more than five years’ experience in this occupation.  She needs to buy supplies to start bathing suit production so that she can start her shop and attain personal and professional satisfaction.  Marta’s dream is to have her own bathing suit store and to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and patterns.

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Guillermo de Jesús se dedica a la venta de bananos en el municipio de Bello, ubicado al Norte de la ciudad de Medellín. Posee una bodega en la plaza de mercado donde almacena los bananos verdes cuando los compra y los deja madurar para luego distribuirlo a restaurantes, cafeterías y por algunas de las calles de bello. El señor Guillermo tiene 53 años, es casado y tiene 4 hijos a los que le debe brindar el sustento. Aspira con el crédito, a aumentar su inventario y por ende su ganancia, pues se espera que este producto aumente su precio en los próximos años. Con el crecimiento de su negocio, planea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa y cumplir el sueño de conseguirse un carro para poder desplazarse con mayor facilidad.
texts.en: Guillermo de Jesús is dedicated to the sale of bananas in the town of Bello, located to the north of the city of Medellín. He has a bodega in the market plaza where he stores the green bananas when he buys them and he lets them mature to later distribute them to restaurants, cafes, and in some of the streets of Bello. Guillermo is 53 years old, he is married and he has 4 children to whom he must provide support. He aims with the loan to increase his inventory and therefore his profits, since he believes that this product will increase in price in the next few years. With the growth of his business, he plans to provide a better quality of life for his children and wife and to complete his dream of buying a car to be able to travel with greater ease.

loans.use: To buy green bananas and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has 5 children. Ama cooks banku (cooked fermented corn dough) to sell in Abuenu, and has done so for one year. Her husband is a farmer. Ama uses her income to help her husband to feed their children. Ama will use the loan to purchase bags of maize for preparing the banku she sells. With the new profits, Ama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for the preparation of the banku she sells.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agness is married with four children .  She also takes care of additional family members . She operates a pub on retail basis in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of beer,soda,spirits,and other soft drinks. She works seven days a week.  She would like to buy a plot of land.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in the family house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer,soda,spirits,and other soft drinks.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.en:
Yadira is a decorator for social events such as birthday parties, weddings and baptisms. She makes most of decorations herself with the skills she learned at an institution that sells the supplies for decorations. She has been doing this for about 7 years and she is doing very well. She has no shortage of clients because her work is well liked. She works with her mother as an assistant.

Yadira will use the money from this loan to invest in supplies for her decorations. She is a a very hardworker and she is dedicated to providing a better living for her 2 kids. She also volunteers at the Mifex MERIT Centers as a teacher of our arts and crafts courses.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in supplies for her decorations

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: As people of the sea, seafood is favored by many people. Ana is one of many people that fish for a living. Her husband helps her out with the hard part  of the work, which is getting the sea urchins and fish. The seafood is sold on the roadside to people going to and from town to the rural areas. Sometimes it is bought by people going back to their country of residence. If her sales are good for the day, she earns one hundred and twenty tala. That is then used to pay for family needs and wants and most importantly to update her payments with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and pay school fees.

loans.name: Karima

texts.en: Karima lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is uneducated and she wants to help with her family because her husband is faced with economic difficulty. She is a traditional embroiderer and she wants to take a group loan to buy the materials that she needs for her work to expand her business and make a good life for her husband and her family. She would like to thank AFSG for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy extra materials

loans.name: Ablam

texts.fr:
Ablam A. was born in 1967. He is married, a father of six, and is very active earning his living from agriculture, which constitutes his main source of income. He grows various crops according to the season. Today, arable lands are undeniably becoming poorer and poorer, and crops are successful less and less. Now then, his entire life and family depend on these crops. In order to reap a good harvest, these lands need fertilizer. His corn plants are stunted. For these reasons, Mr. A. is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizers and some pesticides, which will allow him to treat his crops against devastating insects. A successful season will result in a good harvest. And the sale of these staple crops will provide for his family and make their lives better.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Ablam est né en 1967, marié et père de six (6) enfants. Il est très actif et vit de l'agriculture qui constitue sa principale source de revenu. Il fait des cultures variées selon les saisons. Aujourd'hui, force est de constater que les terres cultivables s'appauvrissent et les cultures réussissent de moins en moins. Or, toute sa vie et celle de sa famille en dépendent. Pour donner de bons rendements, ces terres ont besoin de fertilisants. C'est pourquoi Monsieur A. Ablam, vu le niveau actuel de ses plants de maïs, sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter de l'engrais et des produits phytosanitaires qui lui permettront de traiter ces plants contre des insectes dévastateurs. La réussite de la saison lui permettra de faire une bonne moisson. La vente des vivres lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de mieux vivre.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Usma

texts.en: I was married only a year ago. I manufacture zippers and sell them in a local market and my husband has a donkey cart that he uses to transfer goods from one place to another on order. The income from these ventures is just enough for us to live on. We plan to get another donkey cart, which we will rent out to increase our income. We both are not educated but we hope that same fate does not befall our children, who have yet to come in to this world. I need $175 to buy a new donkey cart.

loans.use: Buy another donkey cart.

loans.name: Cyntia

texts.es:
Srta. Cynthia P., 19, is single and lives with her mother, Sra. Maria Palma. They've worked together for 3 years, as street vendors selling clothing. Their merchandise includes, among other things, t-shirts, pants, shorts, and skirts. Cynthia goes to school in the mornings and she's now in her last year of high school. She hopes to finish high school, go on to college and, one day, have a professional career. By doing so, she believes she'll have the greatest chance of providing her mother, her biggest supporter, with a decent life.

The income from their joint business supports them. Cynthia has been thinking of starting a business selling clothes from a home-based store so they will no longer have to go out to work everyday in the oppresive heat. For that purpose, she's applying for a loan that she will invest in the purchase of merchandise--t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, seasonal clothing, for example--for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Cynthia P. tiene 19 años, es soltera, vive con su madre la Sra. María Palma, ellas trabajan juntas desde hace 3 años, se dedican a la venta de ropas de forma ambulante. Entre algunas de sus mercaderías podemos citar: remeras, pantalones, shorts, faldas, etc. Cynthia estudia por la mañana, esta cursando el ultimo año de la secundaria. Su mayor anhelo es culminar sus estudios y seguir una carrera universitaria, ser el día de mañana una profesional y de este modo acceder a mayores oportunidades laborales; piensa que de este modo ella podrá dar una vida digna a su madre quien es su mayor apoyo.

Con el ingreso de las ventas, ellas mantienen la casa juntas. Cynthia tiene pensado montar su negocio de venta de ropas en su casa, de este modo evitarán salir todos los días a recorrer las calles en el agobiante calor; para ello solicita el crédito pues desea invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor, tales como remeras, vestidos, jeans, camisas, pantalones, y prendas de temporada.

loans.use: Buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts and seasonal clothing for resale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
In the middle of the “Jesus de Nazarenas” Market in Ayacucho, Peru, one can find Gladys behind her large condiments stand, surrounded by colorful sauces and spices. Located directly in front of the butcher section, she is in the perfect place to sell her products. Gladys prepares the condiments daily in her home very early in the morning. She packs these up in tupperware containers and brings it to her stand. She makes ground garlic, red, yellow, and green chili sauces, boiled potatoes, and several additional types of condiments used daily in almost every Ayacuchan household. She also sells other types of ingredients such as milk, butter, cheese, crackers, soy sauce, etc. This is a very common and very convenient type of stand found in a number of the large farmers markets within Peru.

For example, a mother shopping in preparation for the large daily meal at noon can stop by the butcher’s section and order a supply of fresh meat. From there, she can turn around to Gladys, tell her that she will be preparing a beef dish. With this information, Gladys takes a small plastic bag and fills it with a complex mixture of the different types of her condiments to customize the perfect beef seasoning.

Gladys knows exactly how helpful her stand is for her busy customers who are taking care of their children and their homes and also need to prepare a large meal for several hungry mouths. Seven years ago, just before she decided to open up a stand in the market, Gladys was a housewife raising 3 children while her husband worked. When her children grew older, she found she had free time and decided to supplement her husband’s modest income.

One day, Gladys would love to open a grocery store from her home. She is also financing the education of all three of her children. One daughter is studying obstetrics, one is just about to enter the university, and the last is still in middle school. There are many reasons Gladys is motivated to expand her business and save money. This is why she is so glad to have been a part of her village bank for the past 7 years. It was through the bank that she has learned about punctuality and responsibility, two values essential to running a successful business. She is currently requesting a loan of $350. With this money she will stock up on all of her most popular products and the ingredients that go into her freshly prepared condiments.

loans.use: To stock up on her most popular products and the ingredients that go into her freshly prepared condiments.

loans.name: Usalama Wa Pesa Group

texts.en: Selamani M. K.. Bakari A. Wahura, Tadei M. M., Mohamedi M. Kidili, Maimuma J. K., Sada K., Aruna N. and Fukirini R. are members of the Usalama wa Pesa group, in Vingunguti market in Dar Es Salaam city. Their businesses are located in Vingunguti municipal market and include fruit and vegetable sales, kiosks, small restaurants, and shops. They are jointly in need of US$ 3200, or US$ 400 each, to help them boost their businesses.

loans.use: expand their various businesses

loans.name: Farid

texts.en: This single man lives in the Khachmaz region. He was born in 1985 and started this business a year ago. Now Farid needs a loan of $725 to buy phone accessories to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories

loans.name: Adisa

texts.en: Adisa, 27 years old and married with 2 daughters. lives in Orahovica, a suburb of the town of Zenica. With her husband she sells milk and milk products, which earns them a monthly income of 400 KM.  Adisa requests  this loan in the amount of $775 (1000 KM)  in order to purchase animal nutrients so they can earn more money  selling  their  products.

loans.use: To buy animal nutrients.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
The group "Mujeres Luchadoras CD." (Hardworking Women CD.) is 1 year old and has good savings accumulated due to the hard work and dedication from the women members, who are the group's strongest foundation.

The women who make up this group are engaged in various productive activities. They will use the loan as working capital to buy more goods, in some cases, or will use it as capital for product development.

The businesses featured incluD.: sale of cosmetics (creams, makeup, colognes), selling clothes, selling fast food, selling chipas (typical meal Paraguayan maD. based on starch, cheese, flour and eggs), sale of purses maD. from polythene bags, etc.

These women yearn for a better future for their children - this is why they strive twice as hard to generate sufficient income to enable them to pay for their children's education. They want the country to move forward and to decrease the number of people who must migrate to other countries in search of job opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El comité “Mujeres Luchadoras D. CD.” tiene 1 año formación posee un buen ahorro acumulado gracias al trabajo y dedicación D. estas mujeres, que son las bases mas fuertes D. este comité emprendedor.

Las señoras que componen este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas, ellas utilizan el préstamo como capital operativo comprando mas mercaderías en algunos casos o insumos para la elaboración D. productos en el caso D. las señoras que se dedican a la venta D. comestibles.

Entre las actividades que realizan podemos citar: venta D. cosméticos (cremas, maquillajes, colonias), venta D. ropas, venta D. comidas rápidas, venta D. chipas (comida típica paraguaya hecha a base D. almidón, queso, harina y huevo), despensa, venta D. bolsas D. polietileno, entre otros.

Estas mujeres anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, por eso se esfuerzan el doble para generar suficiente ingresos que les permita pagar los estudios D. sus hijos. Desean que el país salga adelante y que disminuya el número D. personas que debe emigrar a otros países en busca D. oportunidades laborales.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, shirts, T-shirts, shoes, bags made of polyethylene, vegetables, fruits, meat, canned goods, sugar, flour, oil, etc  (Compra de telas, hilos, botones, camisas, remeras, calzados, bolsas de polietilenos, verduras, frutas, carne, productos enlatados, azúcar, harina, aceite, etc.)

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Señor Vicente Villaba is married to Señora Zulma Ramirez. They have 2 kids: a girl, Zulema, who is in 4th grade, and a boy, David, who is in 2nd grade. Vicente tells us that his children are the biggest miracle in his life, and all of the work and sacrifice that he does is to provide them with a better future.

Vicente has a hardware store where he sells various articles like paint, cables, hammers, nails, wires, electrical items, flashlights, pliers, and other items. Vicente told us that he started his business in 1986 and sold bazaar items. He then added hardware items, and this is currently his main business since there are few businesses in the area that sell these type of items.

Today he would like to expand his stock of merchandise, especially paint, since there is a shortage of paint in the city. He hopes to be one of the biggest suppliers of quality paint in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Señor Vicente Villaba esta casado con la Sra. Zulma Ramirez y tienen dos hijos; una niña Zulema que está cursando el 4to grado de la primaria y David que está en el 2do. Grado; Vicente cuenta que sus hijos son el milagro más grande de su vida y que todo el trabajo y sacrificio que hace es para proveerles a ellos de un mejor futuro.

Vicente posee una ferretería en donde comercializa artículos varios como pinturas, cables, martillos, clavos, alambres, artículos eléctricos, focos, pinzas, entre otros. Vicente nos contó que empezó su negocio en el año 1.986 primeramente vendía artículos de bazar y mercería; luego fue agregando artículos de ferretería y actualmente este es el rubro principal, ya que en la zona existen muy pocos negocios que se dediquen a la venta de este tipo de artículos.

Hoy día el tiene proyectado ampliar su stock de mercaderías especialmente de pinturas, ya que en la ciudad escasea la venta de pinturas y el desea ser uno de los mayores proveedores de pinturas de la ciudad.

loans.use: To purchase paint

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo J. sells frozen food, such as turkey and chicken, a skill that she acquired over 3 years. She has been in this business since 1993. She is 42 years old and is married with 5 children. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 4 years. Iyabo needs a loan of $1200 to buy more frozen food to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Kokou Edi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou Edi Kekpedou-Blewoussi was born in Kpalimé on May 15, 1976. His wife is a retailer. He has opened a photocopying center in the Agoè neighborhood of Lomé. His business is located next to a middle school and serves the photocopying needs of many students.

This is the first loan he is requesting. It will allow him to buy twelve boxes of reams of paper, and to begin selling cards to recharge mobile phones.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur KEKPEDOU-BLEWOUSSI Kokou Edi est né le 15 mai 1976 à Kpalimé. Il s’est marié à une femme revendeuse. Il a ouvert un centre de photocopie dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Son centre est situé à coté d’un collège et il reçoit beaucoup d’élèves qui font la photocopie.

Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 12 cartons de rames et de débuter la vente de cartes de recharge.

loans.use: Purchase of paper and mobile phone cards

loans.name: Amiran's Group

texts.en:
Amiran baji is a wife of M. Y. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. Amiran baji couldn't get an education due to poor financial conditions. She owns a two-room house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her elder sons make decoratively embroidered clothes. Her younger son and daughter are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Amiran baji is a housewife. Her husband sells popcorn and has been in this profession for the last 12 years. Amiran baji successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another popcorn machine to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Waziran baji requests a loan to buy cloth for her garment business. Naziran baji and Rushda baji each are requesting a loan to buy more fruits to sell. Shamim baji requests a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheel vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand and improve each group member's business

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is married with 4 children aged 12, 10, and 8 years old and one child is only 2 months old. She is a firewood seller. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 175 from her sales.

Ashura is now requesting a loan to buy more firewood for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Milton R. es carpintero, elabora muebles de todo tipo como también arreglos en general, tiene dos hijos pequeños y su esposa realiza labores de casa.
Su taller y casa se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Villa Armonía de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de madera (mara, roble, gabú, venesta, cola y clavos)
Es la Quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial es bastante alentador por lo que recomendamos ayudar a esta persona.
texts.en:
Milton R. is a carpenter and produces furniture of all kinds and arrangements. He has two young children and his wife works at home.His shop and home are located in the area of Villa Harmony in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used for the purchase of wood (mara, oak, gabú), glue and nails. It is the fifth time he is requesting a credit from Impro and his history is encouraging, which is why we recommend helping this person.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel L. es originaria de Tampico Tamaulipas, y cuenta con 39 años de edad. Ella se considera una persona muy trabajadora, inteligente y emprendedora. <

> Actualmente solicita un préstamo por USD$450 a un plazo de 6 meses, para la compra de ropa usada. Anabel inició en las ventas de ropa usada por necesidad, ya que es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, y nunca recibió el apoyo del padre de sus hijos. Anabel tenía la necesidad de obtener un ingreso adicional al de su empleo, ya que ella trabaja en una compañía de telefonía celular, sin embargo, muchas veces no alcanzaba a cubrir todas sus necesidades y las de sus hijos, razón por la cual quería tener mi propio negocio. <

> Anabel comenzo en las ventas hace varios años, vendiendo cosméticos de reconocidas marcas entre sus compañeros de trabajo, pero hace 2 años una amiga la animó para que vendiera ropa usada, sobre todo de niño, ya que se obtenían buenas ganancias y ella la asesoró sobre donde comprar dicha ropa. Fue así que inició su actual negocio, en enero de 2005, primero vendiendo entre sus vecinos y amistades, y hoy en día también los sábados y los domingos en los mercados ambulantes. Actualmente, ella hace sus pedidos de pacas de ropa usada vía internet y las recibe por paquetería, además también ya vende zapatos y bolsas usadas para dar mas variedad a mis clientes <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyen a Anabel para seguir haciendo crecer su negocio! <

>
texts.en:
Anabel L. is originally from Tampico Tamaulipas and is 39 years old. She considers herself a hardworking, intelligent and entrepreneurial person. Today she is asking for a loan for USD $450, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy used clothing. Anabel began selling used clothing out of necessity. As a single mother, she has two children, and never received support from the father of her children. Anabel had to get additional income to her regular job, as she works for a cell phone company, however many times that income alone doesn’t cover all her and her children’s necessities, so she wanted to have her own business. Anabel began selling a few years ago, beginning with selling well-known brands of cosmetics to her coworkers. But two years ago a friend encouraged her to sell used clothing, above all children’s clothing, as they could make good earnings and her friend helped her acquire used clothing to sell. This is how in January of 2005 she started the business she has today, first selling to neighbors and friends, and today she also sells on Saturdays and Sundays in the street markets. Today she orders her bundles of used clothing over the internet and they are shipped to her. In addition she sells used shoes and bags to provide more variety to her customers. I invite you to support Anabel to continue growing her business!

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothing

loans.name: Salomão Alberto

texts.pt:
Salomão Alberto G. é natural do Distrito de Namaacha um dos distrito da província do Maputo que faz fronteira com a Suazilândia, é maior de 50 anos de idade, casado maritalmente com 2 esposa e mãe de 15 filhos já maior de idade quase todos apenas 3 que ainda vivem com ele e vão a escola, para alem desse vive com dois netos e sub suas responsabilidades.

Salomão estudou até 4ªclasse e parou porque naqueles tempo os colonos não deixava estudar mais que isso excepto algumas zonas, também pela condição social que tinha viu se obrigado a procurar emprego para o seu sustento. Desde a sua infância nunca mudou se da cidade.

Salomão é reformado e dedica se a agricultura de subsistência familiar desde 1990, tem um empregado, onde pratica monocultura ( o Repolho), tem uma pensão mensal de 1280,00mt. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, o primeiro foi de 10000,00mt e destinou na compra de insumos agrícolas que são adubos de forma a produzir um repolho de qualidade.

Salomão pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo afim de abrir outra machamba de forma a diversificar as culturas.
texts.en:
Salomão Alberto G. is from Namaacha district, one of the districts of Maputo province that is on the frontier with Swaziland. He is over 50 years old, married, with two wives and fifteen children. Most of his children are already grown; only three still live with him and go to school. Besides these children, he lives with and is responsible for two grandchildren. Salomão studied until 4th grade and stopped because at that time, they were not allowed further study, except in some zones. Also, because of his living conditions, he felt obligated to look for employment to support himself. Since his childhood, he has never moved Namaacha. Salomão has worked in subsistence agriculture since 1990. He has one worker and grows a single crop, cabbage. He receives a monthly pension of 1280 meticais. This is his second loan from Hluvuku and his first from Kiva. The first loan was for 10000 meticais and went to buying agricultural inputs--fertilizers to grow quality cabbage. Salomão plans to repay his loan ahead of time in order to apply for another loan for opening another small farm to diversify his crops.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural inputs

loans.name: Serafina

texts.en:
Serafina is a member of the Prosperidad (“Prosperity”) Village Bank. Serafina is 63 years old and widowed with seven children, two of whom still live with her. Serafina has a stand in the Santa Clara Market, where she sells a variety of prepared meals. On a daily basis, she works from 6am to 6pm. She also owns two motorcycle taxis, of which her two sons drive.  

Serafina is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to buy rice, pasta and potatoes. Serafina dreams of improving her business so that she can improve the lives of her children.

loans.use: To buy rice, pasta and potatoes

loans.name: Kimsreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimsreng Pel, 50, and her husband married in 1980 and have four sons. Two of them attend school and assist their mother in their silk weaving business, and another child is a disabled person. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Kimsreng has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a policeman. Kimsreng is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her weaving business

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
M. M. HERMELINDA 
La señora Hermelinda es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 37 años de edad, tiene 02 hijos, de estado civil casada y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace 01 año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorde y venta de ganado vacuno, su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para adquirir alimentación para sus ganados.
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses de manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado, semilla de alfalfa, y asistencia técnica para poder engordar mejor a los ganados que posee; ello le permitirá vender a mejor precio sus toros y obtener mayores ganancias para pode ayudar en los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the Miraflores Communal Bank in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 37 years old, has two children, is married, and has a high school education. She has worked for the past year with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos. Her business is buying, fattening and selling cattle. With her first loan of 500 soles ($175), she bought food for her cattle. With this loan of 500 soles ($175), which she has promised to repay punctually over three months, she will buy balanced nutrition, alfalfa seeds, and hire an expert to help her better fatten her cattle. This will allow her to sell them at a better price and earn a better income. This, in turn, will help her pay for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced nutrition, alfalfa seeds, and hire an expert to help her better fatten her cattle

loans.name: Djura

texts.en:
Djura H. is 44 years old. She is married and has four children. Her family lives in Isfara, Northern Tajikistan. Djura sells clothes for children at the market. Djura has been in this business for many years. She has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. Djura is hoping to take a loan of 800 USD to increase the variety of inventory in her store and keep her business running successfully. She promises to fulfill the loan term within 5 months. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the education expenses of her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
