loans.use: Increasing her working capital with the purpose of business development

loans.name: Mahkamboi

texts.ru:
Кенчаев Махкамбой  1967 года рождения имеет 3 детей. Он работает  в больнице медбратом и изза маленькой заработной платы он торгует  лекарствами в аптеке. Опыт  торговли 15 лет . С микроинвест начал сотрудничать несколько дней назад. 
Он получает кредит для расширения  ассортимента в  аптеке. Товар ему привозят поставшики, так ему выгодно потому что он не тратиться на дорогу.
texts.en:
Mahkamboi K. was born in 1967 and has three children. He works in hospital as a nurse, and because of the low pay, he sells medicines in a drugstore. He has fifteen years of sales experience. He started working with MicroInvest several days ago. He wants to take out the loan to expand the inventory in the drugstore. Suppliers bring him his goods, which is good for him since he need not spend time traveling.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina A. is fifty years old. She is married and the mother of six children. Four of them have completed junior high school and are into apprenticeships, while the others are still in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. Georgina works to make some income to help support the family. She trades in cereals such as maize. She purchases the maize from the farmers in the nearby communities and distributes to the retailers in her community. She also supplies to food vendors. Georgina has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy maize in bulk to increase her stock. She intends to trek to other markets to do business. She wants to improve her standard of living and to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia has owned a small charcoal store and has been a juice seller the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to the Subira ina mpaka group loan (Group code 2062). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $25. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from Kiva partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and juice for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Rabia is 26 years old, married and has two children, ages 7 and 4.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and juice for her business

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 26-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his parents. Marwan has owned a mobile shop for one year and is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new mobile phones and phone accessories for his shop. This is the first time that Marwan has requested a loan. 

Marwan is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have very much money but he decided on this line of business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase new mobile phones and accessories for his mobile shop.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao S., 37, pictured here with her husband, is married with three children and lives in Takeo province. She and her husband work selling rice in the local market and are able to make US$15 in revenue per day. Three of their children are in school. Sao S. would like to take out a loan to purchase rice in bulk so that they can have a special discount and meet their client’s demand, too.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk.

loans.name: Jasila

texts.en:
Jasila gets to work with her father every day on their farm. She had a previous loan with ASHI and because she was on-time with all of her payments, she was able to double the amount of this loan.

She and her father have a rice field and also grow vegetables. She is going to use the loan to buy fertilizer for the field and rice to plant. She is looking to increase the standard of living for her and her family by growing her business and increasing profits. She is excited to be a member of Kiva and says thank you for supporting her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the field and rice to plant

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene una tienda de abarrotes y carnicería ubicada en la Zona Rio Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto, el esposo es empleado de la empresa EPSAS como plomero. De estas dos actividades provienen sus ingresos económicos para la manutención de sus tres hijos que dependen de la pareja; la familia  vive en la casa de los padres de Virginia, ubicada en Zona Rio Seco de la misma ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes para poder satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Virginia has a grocery and butcher's shop located in the Rio Seco Zone of the city of El Alto. Her husband is employed with EPSAS as a plumber. Their income comes from these two economic activities for the maintenance of their three children who depend on them. The family lives in the home of Virginia's parents, located in the Rio Seco Zone of the same city. The loan will serve to purchase merchandise for their grocery store in order to satisfy demand. It is the first loan with IMPRO; the completed evaluation qualifies them to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for their grocery store

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose is thirty-three years old and married with four children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and provisions. She hopes for a loan of N50000 to purchase more provisions and drinks. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A., widow, age 51, makes a living primarily from raising pigs for sale. She is from the city of Oroquieta and has two adult children. Lydia earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama M. is married and has three children. She has no educational background. Ama sells groceries and other food supplies at cape coast, which she has done since 1979. Her husband is a pensioner. Ama uses her income to pay for feeding of her children, and also paying of their utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase more of the food supplies for resale at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to add to her capital to increase her business.

loans.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase more of the food supplies for resale at the market.

loans.name: Mrs. Noeun Siv Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
A village bank, which consists of seventeen people and is requesting a bank loan, is located in Trapeang Ampil village in Kandal province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Noeun S. is the village bank president. She owns a poultry business. Her husband, Mr. Sao Horn, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectar field of land used to cultivate rice. Mrs. Noeun S. is requesting a loan to buy some chickens, ducks, and fertilizer to support the field. She is 53 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer while the other is employed in a garment factory.

Fifteen members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy some chickens, ducks, and fertilizer to support the field.

loans.name: Ablavi Enyonam

texts.fr: Cette femme est uniquement spécialisée dans la vente d’ignames ; elle exerce ce commerce comme vendeuse ambulante dans le quartier d’Ahligo à Lomé. Elle est mariée et grâce à ce commerce, elle apporte sa contribution financière à son mari pour l’éducation scolaire de leurs 05 enfants. Elle s’approvisionne à Anié, localité située à des dizaines de kilomètres de Lomé. Certains ménages font des commandes chez elle parce qu’elles apprécient beaucoup la qualité de ses ignames. Elle veut à cet effet lancer une nouvelle commande ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 paniers d’ignames.
texts.en:
Ablavi Enyonam A. has specialized in the sole business of selling yams. She walks through the streets of the neighborhood of Ahligo in Lomé to sell her yams. She is married and this business enables her to help her husband financially with the school expenses for their five children. She gets her supplies in Anié, a village located dozens of kilometers from Lomé.

Several households order their yams from Ablavi, because they highly appreciate their quality. Therefore she wants to order a new lot of yams and applies to WAGES for a loan to buy 15 baskets of yams.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams

loans.name: Segunda Clorinda

texts.es:
La señora SEGUNDA CLORINDA C. A., tiene 55 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS  y presenta estudios hasta 2DO de Primaria, refiere que dejo de estudiar porque sus padres la llevan al campo a que los ayude.. Se caso la edad de 17 años y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales el ultimo de 17 años de edad depende económicamente de ella porque se encuentra estudiando. Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de pan. Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro sacos de harinas la por mayor, manteca ,sal, levadura para la preparación de su pan.
Con este crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles comprará sacos de harina, levadura ,manteca, sal y también leña al por mayor para vender. La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas para poder así obtener dinero y seguir apoyando a que su hijo termine su carrera.
texts.en:
Sra. Segunda Clorinda C. A. is 55 years old and lives in the District of Trujillo, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the San Luis Communal Bank and has a 2nd grade education. Segunda says she left school because her parents wanted her to help them in the fields. She got married at age 17 and now has 4 children. The youngest child is 17 years old and still financially dependent because he is a student.

Segunda prepares and sells bread. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy sacks of flour at wholesale, shortening, salt, and yeast in order to bake bread.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will purchase sacks of flour, yeast, shortening, and salt. She also will buy firewood in bulk for resale. Segunda dreams of increasing her sales so that she earn an income and continue supporting her son’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for baking bread & firewood at wholesale

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan J. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and sandles. She is requesting a loan to purchase shoes to sell. Susan is 20 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase bedsheets and a sewing machine, etc.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, as well as human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: Martha del Socorro tiene 40 años de edad, y sus 2 hijos que solamente 1 de ellos vive con ella. Hace más de 6 años que cuenta con la actividad de mercadería en general, por lo que siempre es administrada por lo que hace la diferencia con Martha es que siempre trata de comprar lo que esté de moda, ya que por encargos de algunos clientes ella viaja a conseguir esta mercadería, algunas veces es muy arriesgado por no consigue traer todos los encargos por no tener suficiente capital. Sus deseos son que su hija maneje el negocio sin ningún problema. El financiamiento ser utilizado para pantalones, camisetas, faldas, calzado, cosméticos, ropa interior y trajes para niños de 5 a 10 años.
texts.en:
Martha del Socorro, 40, has two children, one of whom still lives with her. For over six years she has sold general merchandise. Martha's administrative touch that makes the difference is that she always tries to stock items that are in style since she travels to get items her customers order. Sometimes this is very risky because she doesn't always have enough capital to bring back all the items that have been requested. Her wish is that her daughter run the business without any problems. The financing will be used to buy pants, t-shirts, skirts, footwear, cosmetics, underwear and children's clothing for ages 5 to 10.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Kayode

texts.en:
Kayode is 45 years old and is married with four children. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. His wife is a fashion designer.

Kayode sells video cassettes and is able to support his family's basic needs and other necessities. With the loan of N50,000 he plans to expand his video cassette business, which is now booming. With this kind of business he hopes to increase his earnings in the long run and be able to better provide for his children's education.

Kayode says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more video cassettes to sell

loans.name: Chiv

texts.en:
Chiv C., 37, is a cloth vendor living in the capital, Phnom Penh. She collects orders to buy cloth in bulk on credit from garment industries. She prepares the orders as sets and then sells them to her customers who need cloth to either decorate their houses or turn into furniture to sell. She repays her supplier when she has sold all the cloth.

Chiv C. is married with three kids: two are married and one is single and attending school. Her husband works as a military policeman. Chiv C. needs a loan to order more cloth to resell to raise more profit.

loans.use: To order additional cloth

loans.name: Otilia

texts.en:
Otilia is 48 and married with 1 child.  She owns & operates a business venture, selling bamboo handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.    Otilia needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 40 talas or US $17 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Otilia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Otilia's 2nd loan with SPBD. 

Overall Social Metric Score:*               1 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3 

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD : http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Mawuli

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un jeune homme célibataire, afin de subvenir à ses propres charges, il s’est lancé en 2007 dans la vente des produits de quincaillerie, il a ouvert sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé « ETS DAM » dans le quartier d’agoè qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Beaucoup d’entrepreneurs viennent acheter chez lui. Faisant face à une rupture de stock, il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit afin de s’approvisionner avec 30 contreplaqués, 10 paquets de fils de rouleaux et des ampoules.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a single young man. To provide for himself, he started selling hardware in 2007. He opened his own store, which he named "ETS DAM", in the Agoe neighborhood at the periphery of Lome. Many entrepreneurs purchase from his store. Faced with a stock shortage, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES to replenish his stock with 30 plywood sheets, 10 packs of wire spools and light bulbs.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware products

loans.name: Molayo

texts.en: Molayo makes a living selling frozen fish, a business she very much enjoys being in. She sells her fish to customers in Lagos state, Nigeria, and hopes to expand her business in the future. She is married, has two children, and is very pleased because they are doing extremely well in school. Molayo says that her children give her peace, courage and hope for the future. She has applied for a loan of NGN 120,000 to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She hopes to live a long and peaceful life, and extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen fish to sell

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Adrian Antonio I. O., tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el Barrio la conejita, vive con su pareja, ellos tienen 2 hijos de las edades de 12 y 8 años de edad ellos son estudiantes de Primaria. Dentro de los planes de la familia esta la compra de un lote para el establezimiento de cosecha de citrico.

Ellos se dedican desde hace 15 años y dentro de los problemas que han tenido a sido la falta de financiamiento y apoyo de las empresas a este sector, es por esta razon que solicita de este credito para la compra de materiales agricolas que le brinden a sus tierras un mantenimiento optimo que ayude al excelente crecimiento de la producciön. El apoyo que se le puediera brindar a la familia I. les seria de mucho beneficio para futuras inversiones y/o planes programados para el buen beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Adrian Antonio I. O. is 37 years old and lives in the neighborhood of La Conejita with his partner. They have two children, ages 12 and 8, who are elementary school students. The plans for his family include buying a plot of land for establishing a citrus orchard.

Adrian has been in business for 15 years but he has encountered problems due to a lack of financing to support his ventures in the agricultural sector. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies so that he can provide optimal maintenance to his farmland and boost production. The assistance provided to the I. family has been of great benefit to them and for their future investments and plans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies to increase his crop production

loans.name: Jessica Del Socorro

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 34 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos D. 15 y 9 años D. edad en casa D. sus suegros, ubicada en la zona comercial D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace ocho años tiene instalado un negocio D. cabinas D. internet en el domicilio en donD. vive. Ella nos comenta que pudo instalar el negocio con los ahorros que su esposo percibía D. su trabajo como vendedor D. computadoras. Jessica atienD. el negocio durante todo el dia desD. las 8:00 am hasta las 10:00 pm. El negocio goza D. buena acogida debido a su céntrica ubicación y a que muy cerca hay varios colegios, por lo que es D. utilidad para los escolares D. la zona.

Además del servicio D. internet, otro D. los motivos por el que el negocio D. Jessica es frecuentado es porque brinda servicio D. búsqueda D. información y D. impresiónes a los escolares, precisamente, para optimizar este servicio ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. una impresora multifuncional con sistema D. inyección D. tinta, la cual haría que el servicio D. impresiones se agilice y que sus clientes estén mas satisfechos con el servicio.

Jessica es una mujer bastante trabajadora y empeñosa. Su mayor anhelo es seguir implementando el negocio con una fotocopiadora. Ella ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jessica is 34 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children ages 15 and 19. They live with her in-laws in the commercial section of the city of Chiclayo. She has had an Internet store she operates out of her home for eight years. She tells us that she was able to start her business with savings her husband got from his work selling computers. Jessica takes care of the business all day long from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. The business does well because of its central location and also because there are several high schools nearby and it’s useful for students. In addition to Internet service, another reason for Jessica’s business being so busy is because she helps people do searches as well as printing for the schools. To proviD. the best service, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 soles to be invested in the purchase of a multi-functional color printer which would help improve her printing service and satisfy her customers. Jessica is a very hard working and enterprising woman. Her greatest desire is to make her business better with a photocopier. She has worked with our institution before and proven herself to by punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a multi-functional color printer.

loans.name: Arona

texts.fr: Monsieur Arona D. est un jeune couturier qui habite a Camberene. Il exerce ce métier  depuis plus de 7 ans. Il expose et vend sur commande. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs destine a l’achat de garniture pour confectionner ses commandes. L’acquisition de ce crédit lui permettra de mieux  gérer  ses commandes et accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
Mr. Arona D. is a young clothier who lives in Camberene. He has been in this business for over seven years. He displays and sells his products by special order. Arona is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for buying trim for fulfilling his orders. Acquiring this loan will enable him to manage his orders better and to grow his profit margin.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing

loans.name: Edarlina's Group

texts.en:
Edarlina G. is from the village of Old San Mariano. She is 49 years old. Edarlina is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Edarlina G.'s Group'.

Edarlina is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Edarlina owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Edarlina has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Edarlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edarlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Edarlina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano, Isabela

loans.name: Priyadarshani

texts.en:
Priyadarshani is a 26-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura, Matara. Her husband works as a conductor. She has three children: two daughters and one son.  All three children are in school. Priyadarshani has been managing a business selling clothes, which she started six months ago.

She has asked for a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to further develop her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Iqbal's Group

texts.en:
Iqbal is a wife of M. P. and lives in the Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She owns a small, two-roomed house where she has lived with her family for the past 35 years. Iqbal is a very talented lady who operates her own business making and selling embroidered clothes. She has been running this business for over five years. Initially, her customer base was limited to her neighbors, but now she sells in the clothes markets as well to generate income. She has one daughter, who is just two years old.
Iqbal's husband operates a clothes-selling business. He purchases clothes from cities such as Multan, Faisalabad and Lahore because of their good designs and low prices. He has been operating this business for over ten years and has a good reputation among his customers. The couple's earnings help them to manage the financial expenses of their home. They dream that their daughter will grow up with a good education and a bright future.
Iqbal has successfully repaid her first loan to Kiva partner, Asasah – a microfinance institution in Pakistan. Now she is applying for her second loan, which will be used to purchase clothes so that her husband can increase his business and earn a good profit from it.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale in her husband's business

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en: Sorm S., 55, sells clothes and shoes in the local market of Kampong Chhnang province. She is a widow with four children. Two of her children are in school and two are employed. She typically makes about US$6 each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for US$400 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Mrs. Pov Moul Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people in Aopheasang village in Takeo province are seeking a group loan. The members of the group have selected Mrs. PO. M. as the group leader. All the members are responsible for the total loan, but each will use a portion for different purposes to improve their individual businesses. Mrs. PO. M. was born in 1966. Now she sells frogs and palms at her local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. To improve this business, Mrs. PO. M. is requesting a loan to buy more frogs and palms to resell. Her husband, Mr. Eng Srey, is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell in order to support his family. Through these activities, they support three children, all of whom attend a local public school.

loans.use: To buy more frogs and palms

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 35 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos la socia estudio hasta la secundaria completa pero por motivos económicos ella no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional y desde entonces trabajo en todo lo que pudo, ingeniándose para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella ahora se dedica a l comercio minorista, esta señora vende yuca en el mercado de Huancaro, en el distrito de Santiago, La socia también vende en la época escolar útiles de escritorio de manera informal, en las ferias escolares que cada año en el mes de febrero se apertura para poder comprar los diferentes útiles escolares. La socia solicita el préstamo para compra productos como yuca y de este modo incrementar su venta en el mercado. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member lives in Santiago district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She’s a member of the “TRES MARIAS” (Three Marys) communal bank. She is Luz Marina, 35. She lives with her significant other and has three children. She completed secondary school but due to lack of financial resources was unable to study a professional career and has worked at a variety of jobs since then managing to support her children. Currently she’s in retail commerce, she sells manioc in Santiago’s Huancaro market. During the school year she also sells school supplies informally at the school supply fairs that open every February. She is asking for funds to buy products like manioc in order to increase sales in the market. She is grateful for and values the loan granted because it permits her business to grow and her quality of life to improve. She pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria pertenece al banco Comunal Despertar y lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones que la distraen mucho y los prestamos fáciles.
Maria es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 hijos estudian y uno esta preparándose para la universidad.
Maria vende ropa variada en las diferentes ferias sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo, negocio que inicio hace 1 años y le esta yendo bien. Maria solicita un crédito de 2500 soles para la compra de una congeladora, con la cual preparara postres.
Maria sueña con construir el tercer piso de su casa, su hija ingrese a la universidad y progresar.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the Despertar (Wake up) Community Bank. She most enjoys the meetings and the accessible loan system. She is married and has four children, three of whom are students, and one who is preparing to go to university. Maria sells clothing in various markets, clothing which she has obtained in Lima. She also runs a restaurant in rented premises. She does this on a daily basis with help from her husband. It’s a business she started a year ago and it’s doing well. Maria is asking for a loan of 2,500 soles to buy a freezer in which she will keep desserts. Her dreams are to add a third floor to her house and to see her daughter go to university and do well in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Our God Is Able. Group

texts.en:
Angeline T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Our God Is Able. Angeline is 35 years old, married, and has five children aged from 5 to 19 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support.
For the last two years, Angeline has been selling peanuts in Devine's Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of peanuts. Angeline describes herself as an earnest woman. Her goals are to improve her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married man and father of three school-aged children. He lives in Lebanon. 

He has 17 years of experience as a construction worker. He used to work with entrepreneurs but in 2000 he started working independently. He takes projects upon request of the customers and he was able to build a good business reputation. His business has significantly been developed during this period. He works hard because he is the main provider for his family. His wife, who works as a clothing seller, tries to help him with her business income. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional wood for a new project. His target is to expand his business in the coming years and be able to continue the education of his children.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Janet B. is from the village of Flores. She is 43 years old. Janet is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Janet B..

Janet is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Janet owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Janet is just starting this business.

In 2010, Janet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Janet from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a forty-year-old man, married and very hard-working. He is the head of eight family members living in a self-owned permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His desire is to see his children attain higher level education qualifications in reputable institutions.

 Augustine has been in the lumber business and running a retail shop for sixteen years now and with such vast experience, he has been able to increase his capital from five hundred shillings to three million a year currently. His business dream is to have increased returns from his projects. Augustine intends to use the loan to purchase trees for timber making and selling.

loans.use: Purchasing trees for timber making and selling

loans.name: Dieumbe

texts.fr: Madame Dieumbe D. est une femme qui habite dans la localité de Camberene. Elle s’active dans la vente de petit déjeuner,  de glace et de jus. Madame  D. a opté son choix sur cette activité a cause de son   caractère  rentable. Elle  sollicite un crédit de 200 000frs prévu pour développer son commerce de petit déjeuner et de jus (achat de produits de base). Selon elle  le crédit  lui permet d’accroitre sa productivité et ses bénéfices.
texts.en: Dieumbe D. is a woman who lives in the town of Camberene. She sells breakfast foods, ice and juice. Mrs. D. got into this business because it is profitable. She is requesting a 200,000 XOF loan to expand her breakfast and juice sales (purchase of basic ingredients). She says this loan will allow her to increase her productivity and earnings.

loans.use: Purchase of basic ingredients

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a 32-year-old woman who has been buying & selling charcoal in the province of Talim Island, Rizal. She started the business 4 years ago to help her family meet basic needs as everything is very expensive and her husband’s salary wasn’t enough to sustain daily expenses. For this reason, she joined Kiva partner, ASHI. ASHI means “To rise up from Poverty”. Iin 2006 Lucila felt very thankful to obtain secured working capital and peer support to achieve her dreams.

Now, Lucila continue to run her business to generate income and financially support her family. She would like to increase her weekly income. To this end, she has applied for new loan of 25,000 Php to purchase more stock for her business and increase her working capital. Lucila has already had previous loans from ASHI and repaid them successfully therefore she is being trusted to apply for a  much larger loan. As active businesswoman, Lucila would like also to explore alternate businesses to provide her family a good living.

Lucila has been dedicating herself to expand her business in order to support her dreams for her family and improve their standard way of living. She will be very responsible with her obligations and she is thankful to the people who will support the loan she is requesting. The loans have been  very helpful in making her business grow further and allowing her four children to  fulfill their dreams of completing college degrees and find stable jobs.
.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of charcoal and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 44 años, esta casada con Enrique, de 53 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Aime, de 21 y Katy, de 14 años. Los cuatro como una gran familia viven, en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Yaroka. Después de los años trascurridos, Julia se siente feliz, de haber sacado adelante a sus hijos y, ahora está luchando para poder salir adelante. Para ello puso una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su casa, ahí proporciona productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su comunidad. Con ello tiene un dinero extra, ya que la agricultura, actividad que se desempeña hace 10 años, le brinda buenas utilidades, pero en épocas de sequía, solo obtiene pérdidas, solventándose con ello. Sus principales productos son arveja, papa y gladiolos, los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado central de su ciudad y en temporadas agrícolas, viaja a la capital para obtener mayores utilidades. Ahora ella está planeando comprarse sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y como integrante de su banco comunal, afirma que se siente desarrollada y con mucho apoyo para poder salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá adquirir varios sacos de abono orgánico, con el que podrá, esparcir en sus plantaciones de papa, que dentro de algunos meses cosechará.
texts.en: Julia is 44 years old and married to Enrique, 53. They have five children, but only two live with them: Aime, 21; and Katy, 14. The four live together in their own home located in a rural area of Yaroka. As the years have passed Julia has felt happy of having made headway for her children, and now she is working hard to continue making progress. To do that, she has a small food store in her home where she offered products of primary need to the people in her community. The extra money, along with the agricultural work she has done for the past 10 years, provides her with good profits, but during times of drought she suffers losses that the store helps cover. Her main crops are peas, potatoes and gladiolus, which after every harvest she sells at her town's local market. During agricultural seasons she travels to the capital to obtain better profits. She is currently planning to purchase more farmland. This is Julia's second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and as a member of her community banks she says she has developed as a businesswoman and has a lot of support to be able to succeed. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase bags of organic fertilizer, which she plans to use on her potato crops, which she will harvest in a few months.

loans.use: Purchase bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul A. is 49 years old. She was born in a large, low-income family in the north of Kyrgyzstan. From early childhood, she was eager to study, which led her to graduating from the Industrial College with a diploma with honors. In 1985, Jumagul got married and soon gave a birth to her son, Tilek. Unfortunately, her happy marriage was broken by tragic death of her husband in car accident. 

To support her small family, Jumagul took any available work, but her earnings didn’t cover all of their expenses. In 1995, Jumagul decided to start her own sales business. With initial capital of only 1,000 Kyrgyz Soms (~$20 USD), she began to resell groceries at the local market. Thanks to her persistent desire to provide a good education for Tilek, she worked hard, managed to purchase a small shop at the new market in Cholpon-Ata town, and increase her floating capital to 60,000 Kyrgyz Soms (~$1280). 

Now, Jumagul plans to take a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broader her assortment of goods. It will allow her to increase her sales and acquire new customers. In the future, Jumagul dreams of hosting her son’s marriage and building a house where she can hear her grandchildren’s voices.

About Bai-Tushum: 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Nelva

texts.en:
Nelva P. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 56 years old. Nelva is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Nelva owns & operates a business making and selling snacks & other delicacies like ampao, piniato, polvoron & torones de mani in the local community. Nelva has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Nelva is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed for making snacks like peanuts & flour. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Nelva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients like peanuts and flour needed for making snacks

loans.name: Jibirila

texts.fr: M. Jibirila a 37 ans  et est marié. Il a en charge 2 enfants. Il est tailleur  brodeur  de profession mais a associé la vente de Bazins et les fils à coudre pour mieux s’occuper de ses enfants. Il compte dans cette activité 12 ans déjà et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Il revend ensuite dans son atelier.  Il a 2 apprentis qui l’aident dans ses activités. IL pense acheter une machine à coudre et 5 pièces de Bazins avec le nouveau crédit.
texts.en: Mr. Jibirila is 37 years old and married. HEehas two children in his care. He is a tailor and does embroidery work; in addition,   he sells traditional “bazins” fabric and thread, in order to be able to better provide for his children. He has 12 years of experience in this field and stocks up at the big market in Lomé. He then resells the wares in his shop. He has two apprentices who help him in his business. He plans to buy a sewing machine and five sets of the “bazins “fabric with this new loan.

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine and tradtional fabrics

loans.name: Bugambilia Group

texts.es: Esta  fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de la Sra. Yolanda A., una integrante del grupo Bugambilia que está ubicado en el estado de Morelos en México, en la foto se ve parte de la mercancía que ella ofrece, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes negocio que inicio hace 30 años, solicita el préstamo para comprar mercancía y surtir su tienda, va a comprar granos como son: arroz, frijol, lenteja, etc. Sus clientes la prefieren porque tiene muy buenos precios, además de que los atiende muy bien, al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque va a poder ofrecer más productos a sus clientes, tiene 64 años, estudió hasta el 6º grado de primaria, es casada y tiene 7 hijos: 3 mujeres y 4 varones, quiere este crédito para hacer crecer su negocio, también espera con las ganancias poder comprar una televisión para su familia.
texts.en:
This photograph was taken at Yolanda A.’s store.  She is a member of the Bugambilia group, which is located in the state of Morelos in Mexico.  In the photo you can see part of the merchandise that she sells.  She sells groceries, and she started this business 30 years ago.

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise and to stock her store.  She will buy grains like rice, beans, and lentils, etc.  Her customers prefer her because she has very good prices.  Also, she provides very good service.

At the time of requesting the loan she is happy because she will be able to offer her customers more products.

She is 64 years old, and she has a sixth grade education.  She is married and has seven children, three girls and four boys.  She wants this loan to make her business grow.  She also hopes to use the earnings to be able to buy a television for her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe BENKADI sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames au quartier MEDINE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur onzième collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce des habits pour enfants à travers OUMOU D., qui  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 balles  de friperie d’habits pour enfants, au grand marché de  Bamako. Les habits sont revendus au  marché de MEDINE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95.000FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The four women that make up the Benkadi loan group are all married and are an average age of 26 years old, with two children.  They live in the Medine quarter of the city of Siskasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are mainly from monogamous families.

The group is taking their 11th group loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance bank to meet their customers needs. Their previous loans have been successfully repaid. These women are in the business of selling childrens clothing through hawking. 

Olimou D. plans to use her loan to buy two bales of children's clothing from the main market at Bamako. The cloths will be resold at the Medine market in Sikasso to her family and to clients made up for both man and women, at retail, for cash and credit. She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 95,000 Francs CFA that will be used to meet her family needs.

loans.use: To buy childrens clothing

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 52 years old and from the town of San Francisco. She is married and has six children, three of whom attend college. Melinda works hard to provide for their education.

For over a decade, Melinda has been a farmer. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells at the market. She makes sure she is selling quality rice and she serves her customers well. Melinda needs farm inputs such as seed and fertilizer. She has applied for a loan from CEVI, a microfinance institution that she recently joined to gain access to financial services.


About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua M. is married and has 4 children. She has been through junior high school, and now sells yam tubers at Korfofordo, near Jukwa in Cape Coast, by moving from one area of the locality to another. She has been in this trade for 3 years. Her husband is a carpenter. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in the education of her children, and will use the loan to purchase more yam tubers to expand her business. (At the time of the visit, she was left with just 2 tubers after her normal rounds.)  With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to provide her children with a meaningful education.

loans.use: to purchase more yam tubers

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta R. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Crisanta is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Crisanta owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle transport services. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Crisanta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La señora Nora del Socorro V. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora, casada y tiene un hijo. Ella tiene una pulpería la cual inicio hace 17 años con la venta de hielo, helados, chocobananos, bolis, puntos rojos, polvorones etc. luego poco a poco fue invirtiendo en otros productos hasta que estuviera surtido.

Ella invertirá en granos básicos, carne, cosméticos… etc.
texts.en: Señora Nora del Socorro V. is a hardworking, determined and enterprising woman. She is married and has a son. She has a grocery store, which she started 17 years ago, selling just ice, icecreams, choco-bananas, pens, polvorones [a kind of shortbread biscuit], etc. Later, little by little, she went on investing in other products until the store was well stocked. She intends to invest in grain, meat, cosmetics etc.

loans.use: to buy grain.

loans.name: Lakisa

texts.en:
Lakisa is a forty-three-year-old divorced woman with four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. After divorcing her husband who was the family breadwinner, she decided to venture into business in order to sustain the family and achieve her goal of educating her children. She has been in the textile business for twenty-five years starting with a working capital of 100,000 shillings. She now has 2,000,000 shillings.

 Her vision is to set up a boutique, buy a car, land, and build a house. Lakisa intends to use the loan facility to buy men's and women's clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hou

texts.en: Hou L. is a 41-year-old widow who works as a requirement laborer. She is hired by people for various things they need done. She is the mother of two kids: one of them works sewing clothes, while the other one attends school. This family has a problem with their living conditions: her house is really old and often needs repair. Hou L. is going to use the loan she requested to repair her old house. This will make her family's lives much more comfortable.

loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Lengkoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Lengkoem Y. (pictured with her loom) is 56 years old and her husband, Mr. Lan Tan is 61 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1974 and have six daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, two are hairdressers, one has full-time employment and other two assist their mother in her business. 

Lengkoem is a silk weaver, while her husband is a vegetable and rice farmer. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en: Maxima is married and 59 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells snacks and daily used products such as soap, shampoo, and toothpaste in the local community. She has had this business for 10 years. Maxima is requesting a loan of PHP 22,000 to purchase more retail items such as canned goods, soft drinks, and instant noodles that would increase the capacity of sales in her business. Each month, she earns about PHP 9,000 doing this type of work. In the future, Maxima hopes to have a big business, achieve financial independence and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more retail items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, and instant noodles.

loans.name: Manh Tan-1-2 Group

texts.en:
Khanh is 45 years old with 3 children. Her oldest child is studying at Technical University and two others are in High school. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice, corn and vegetables. Her farming products are used to meet the family's food demand. To make money for her daily expenditure, she makes tofu and sells it in local market. Besides, she uses the by-product as food for pig raising which helps her get more profit from her pig raising. Participating in our credit program in second loan cycle, she is requesting a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy beans.

Cuc is 30 years old with 1 child. She is raising 100 chickens for eggs. She wants to borrow a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy some fans to cool down the chickens.

Chieu is 45 years old with 2 children. She is growing vegetables and raising chicken for meat. She needs a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food and fertilizer.

Du is 35 years old with 1 child. She is raising 200 chickens for eggs . She needs a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for them.

Hoa is 28 years old with 1 child. She is raising pigs for meat. She is requesting a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy  food for her small business

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: La Sra. Nieves  y su esposo son clientes antiguos D. la institución ellos tienen tres hijas y un hijo, ellos viven en la comunidad D. Unni la cual se encuentra a unos 20 min. D. nuestra institución D. Chasquipampa los buses no pasan con mucha frecuencia que solo pasan en ciertos horarios establecidos, el esposo trabaja como transportista en el radio taxi y ella venD. verduras en el mercado Rodríguez solo tres veces a la semana esos días ella va desD. muy temprano para comprar las verduras D. las señoras productoras para luego venderlos mas tarD., también produce en su comunidad los productos como ser: la papa, alverja, aba, etc. Ella en este momento necesita para aumentar su capital en mercadería comprando verduras por mayor ya que todo esta subido D. precio, es un apersona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Nieves and her husband are long-standing clients of our institution.  They have three daughters and one son, and live in the community of Unni which is 20 minutes away from our institution in Chasquipampa.  They do not have a very frequent bus service and the buses run to certain set timetables.  Nieves' husband works as a radio taxi driver and Nieves herself sells vegetables in Rodríguez market three times a week.  On those days, she goes out very early in the morning to buy vegetables from the ladies who produce them.  She re-sells them later in the day.  In her community, people produce products such as potatoes, peas, beans, etc.

At the moment, Nieves needs to increase her capital.  She will buy merchandise (vegetables) wholesale since everything has increased in price.  Nieves is a very hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support she has been offered.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in large quantities

loans.name: Sefhora Ester

texts.es: Sefhora Ester D. cuarenta y ocho años D. edad vive junto a su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee un comedor el cual es muy visitado por las personas del lugar pues Sefhora se ha hecho D. mucha fama por sus ricos platillos y por la calidad D. su comida además tienen los mejores precios del lugar y su puesto D. trabajo siempre lo  mantienen muy aseado. Ella es muy trabajadora y quiere ver crecer su negocio y hará lo posible por no desistir D. su sueño es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material como granos básicos, carnes, embutidos, lácteos, plátanos, bebidas, verduras, entre otros para seguir haciendo los exquisitos platillos. Sefhora tiene fe que con su dedicación en el trabajo podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida mejor para su familia.
texts.en: Sefhora Ester is forty-eight years old and she lives with her life partner and their children in a house of their own. She has a restaurant which is highly visited by people from their community. Sefhora has maD. a name for herself through her delicious recipes and for the quality of her foods. She also offers the best prices in their community and her area is always very clean. She is a very hardworking woman and she wants to see her business grown. She will do what is possible and she will not desist from her dream. She requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) and it will permit her to purchase ingredients such as basic grains, meats, sausages, dairy products, bananas, drinks, vegetables, and others to keep making her delicious meals. Sefhora has faith that through her dedication to her work she will be able to proviD. her household with financial security and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, meats, sausages, dairy products, bananas, drinks, and vegetables.

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.es: El señor Primitivo es agricultor,  casado con la señora Eloida la cual se dedica a labores del hogar, Tienen  5 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el Sr. Primitivo nació en Potosí, hoy vive en Limones a 25 km del Torno se vino a Santa Cruz a buscar mejores condiciones de vida, donde trabaja juntamente con su familia siembran maíz, arroz, yuca y también se dedica a sacar madera para las carpinterías,  Es con la única entidad financiera que el trabaja ya que es la que le da apoyo financiero, el destino del crédito es para preparar el terreno y sembrar arroz, es una persona trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señor Primitivo is a farmer.  He is married to Señora Eloida who devotes herself to the household chores.  They have 5 school age children.  Señor Primitivo was born in Potosí.  Today, he lives in Limones, 25 km from El Torno.  He came to Santa Cruz looking for better living conditions.  He works with his family growing corn, rice, and yucca as well logging for carpenters.  This is the only financial institution that he works with since they give him financial support.  He will use the loan to prepare the land and to plant rice.  He is a hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support they have granted him.

loans.use: prepare the land and plant rice.

loans.name: Ssuubi Development Association Group

texts.en:
From the very beginning, 50-year-old Mary stressed to her workers the need for diligence if her poultry business was to have good prospects. She wanted her business to be reckoned among the best in the metropolis of Kampala. Once she zeroed in on what gives this genre of business a vantage point, she went to every length to see to it that she purchases more bags of chicken mash, medicine and layer chickens.

That was her way of making a statement that she was in for the long haul and that she wanted to make quick headway. Though her journey from the start was fraught with many challenges like the lack of financing for the purchase of more chickens, she nevertheless obtained a footing.

The way she has organised and planned for her business the last 10 years bears all the hallmarks of success.

Mary is to all appearances a buoyant and assiduous lady. She is happily married with eight high-spirited kids. She says the inspiration before she took root in this business came from her close friends.

On the side, she ekes out additional income from two other businesses--bricks sales and rentals.

This Kiva loan, Mary says, will be used to purchase more layer chickens and chicken mash and she says she will use the rest to pay fees for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more layer hens, chicken mash, and use the rest of the loan to pay fees for her kids.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 32-year-old married man with four children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in a bar and bakery business for eight years and he got the initial capital to start his current businesses from farming. 

His hardships are bad debtors and price fluctuations, and his vision is to improve the quality of products in the bakery and to educate his family.

Peter needs the loan facility to buy raw materials for baking bread.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for baking bread.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina nació en la ciudad de Coya (Pisaq, Cusco, Perú) y tiene 49 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de hermosa relación tiene once hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a la elaboración de chicha de jora, crianza de animales menores y venta de cerveza, ella tiene una pequeña picantería donde vende sus productos. Ya son 15 años que se dedican a este negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

El crédito que requiere Paulina es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cerveza y maíz. 

Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Paulina was born in the city of Coya (Pisaq, Cusco, Perú).  She’s 49 years old, married and her beautiful relationship produced eleven children.  Currently, she’s living in the city of her birth and where she carries out her activities.  She manufactures “chicha de jora” (corn-based drink), raises small farm animals and sells beer.  She has a small snack bar where she sells her products.  She’s been in business 15 years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  The loan Paulina needs is to buy merchandise like beer and corn, for example.

The “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” (Urubamba Lord of Miracles) communal bank meets monthly in the Pisaq District, Calca Province (Cusco, Perú).  Cusco is known for tourism, commerce, its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like beer and corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 46-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four school-aged children. He has been running a clothing store for the past 21 years. He sells women's and children's clothes. He is the only income source of the family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to expand his store’s inventory with a new winter clothes collection. He is certain that the loan will help him get a diversity of new original clothes. In the future, he plans to branch out his business and start selling men's clothes.

loans.use: to expand his store’s inventory with a new winter clothes collection.

loans.name: Salome De Jesús

texts.es:
Salome, tiene setenta y un   años de edad, es casado con  una persona a su cargo, y esta se encuentra en la universidad.
 Una de las necesidades que atraviesa el sr., es la urgencia de comprar productos de pulpería para su negocio ya que para este tiempo las ventas se pone buena. Es  por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita mejorar sus condiciones económicas tanto en su negocio como en su familia. Ha trabajado dieciséis  préstamo con ceprodel, agradece a la institución ya que con este nuevo préstamo podrá tener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Salome is seventy-one years old, married and has one dependent who is currently at the university. One of the needs he is experiencing is the importance of purchasing products for his general store since during this season the sales start to pick up. For this reason he comes to Ceprodel in order to be granted a loan which will allow him to improve his financial circumstances in his business as well as his family. He has had sixteen loans with Ceprodel and gives his thanks to the institution, as with this new loan he will be able to make a better income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase products for his general store.

loans.name: Loncia

texts.en: Loncia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. Loncia has been in this business for 20 years. Loncia earns more income by selling ready-to-wear clothing. Loncia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Gladis; la socia tiene 43 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 3 hijos, La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de panaderia,ella prepara panes, tortas y pasteles y luego los vende en su tienda desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negcoio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de panaderia . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina,mantequilla,huevos y azucar para preparar toetas,pasteles y panes invertiré n la compra de insumos para la panadería.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The borrower is Gladis. She is 43 years old, lives with her common law husband, and has three children. She continues to operate her bakery. She makes breads, pies, and cakes, and she later sells them in her shop from 9:00 am until 8:00 pm. With this business she is able to support her children. She would like to expand and improve the bakery. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, butter, eggs, and sugar to make the pies, cakes, and breads. She will invest the loan into the purchase of ingredients for the bakery. 

She is thankful for the support she’s been given, and she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, butter, eggs, and sugar to make pies, cakes, and breads in her bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar and rice.

loans.name: Progressive B Group

texts.en:
Paul is the facilitator of the Progressive B group. Paul and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Paul and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Paul takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seed and to secure enough food for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Paul had an excellent maize yield harvesting five bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Paul was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Paul will educate his children and save for his business and livestock rearing in the future.

In 2012, the members of Progressive B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Paul with his group members with the field officer on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a 31-year-old married woman with four school-going children. Her husband is businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanahamisi has operated a food stall for the past four years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase building blocks to renovate her house. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase building blocks to renovate her house.

loans.name: Germin Antonio

texts.es:
Germin, es empleado de un hospital, vive con su esposa, no tienen hijos, solamente viven los dos, él trabaja como empleado del hospital, lleva 18 años trabajando en el lugar.
Actualmente Germin solicita un préstamo para el pago de unas recetas de su esposa, pues no cuenta con la solvencia económica para la compra de medicamentos familiares.
Su aspiración es suplir las necesidades de su familia, trabajando de la mejor manera para conservar el empleo.
texts.en:
Germin is employed in a hospital. He lives with his wife and they do not have children; so it is just the two of them.  

He works in a hospital, and has been employed there for 18 years. Now, Germin is applying for a loan to pay for some prescriptions for his wife, as he doesn't have the financial means to buy medicines for his family. 

His ambition is to meet his family's needs, working as best he can, so that he can keep his job.

loans.use: To pay for some prescriptions for his wife.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is from Samtredia. He is 50 years old, married and lives with his family: wife – Iamze and two daughters (25 and 21 years old). Gia works as a construction worker in the village. Iamze leads the agricultural business of the family: a dairy farm with two cows and one calf. Iamze produces cheese and sells it locally to dairy product retailers. 

Gia requested credit for purchasing construction materials for expansion of the cattle-shed. After the family has a bigger cattle-shed, they won’t sell calves and will raise them to have more milk for dairy production. It will increase the income of the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for cattle-shed expansion.

loans.name: Odalma Lisseth

texts.es:
Odalma, es madre soltera, vive con su madre, ella es empleada desde hace 4 años en la alcaldía municipal, este trabajo le permite generar los ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y los de ella.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo, ya que presenta  unos problemas mecánicos, para lo cual debe cancelar la mano de obra y comprar los repuestos que necesite, pues quiere tener en buenas condiciones el vehiculo, para transportarse con mayor seguridad.
El propósito de Odalma es, cuidar primeramente su empleo, ya que de el dependen sus ingresos, también con el crédito quiere ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en: Odalma is a single mother and lives with her mother. She has worked for some 4 years in the municipal mayor’s office; this job has allowed her to have enough income to cover her family’s expenses. At present, Odalma needs the loan to buy spare parts for her car since it has some mechanical problems and needs to pay labor and the spare parts that are needed since she needs her car to be in good condition to be able to move around safely. Odalma’s goal is to first of all take care of her job since she depends on that income, and second regarding the loan, to be responsible and punctual in her payments.

loans.use: buy spare parts for her vehicle.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia anteriormentese dedicaba al negocio de venta de yogurt pero no le fue muy bien en este negocio,ahora la socia es eta dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa y ropas interiores,ella tiene una pequeña tienda en el mercado donde atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un locla man amplio donde pueda vender la ropa.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones,polos,blusas y casacas y ropas interiores al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Teresa, previously had a business selling yogurt, however the business unfortunately did not do well and she now sells clothes and undergarments. She has a small shop in the market, which is open from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. Teresa raises her family with earnings from her business, and her dream is to have a larger premises where she can sell her clothes. Teresa has sought this loan to purchase pants, polo shirts, blouses, jackets and underwear wholesale.

Teresa is happy that she can take this loan and agrees to comply with the repayments.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale pants, polo shirts, blouses, jackets and underwear for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
