loans.use: to build a modern dairy.

loans.name: Iris Yolanda

texts.en:
My name is Iris and I run a small pulperia ( grocercies, cafe) called \"Pulperia Irias.\" It is loacted in my home and in one of the neighborhoods with the most traffic in the city. I have had my business for several years and the earnings allow me to cover family expenses and other bills. Thanks to this business I can make an income and support my family. I need to stock my store as the Holiday Christmas Season is approaching and the volume of my customers is beginning to increase.

Mi Nombre es Iris, cuento con un pequeño negocio de Pulperia, Operando Bajo el Nombre de Pulperia Irias, ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, en una de las colonias mas transitables de la ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y cubrir otros compromisos con los proveedores, grancias a este negocio puedo atender generar ingresos y atender a mi familia, necesito surtir mas tomando en cuenta que se aproxima la Navidad y el Volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use:
To purchase sugar, rice, salt, butter, soap, toilet paper, coffee, flour, instant soup, sodas

Compra de Azucar, Arroz, Sal, Manteca,Jabon, papel higienico,Cafe,Harina, Sopas instantaneas, refrescos.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
O. began his charcoal sales business with $150.  He has managed his business well, and is married with one child. A loan will enable him to buy the charcoal in bulk and save on transport.

He will use his profits to open a business for his wife and save for the future.

loans.use: Purchase of additional stock

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en:
Isidora lives with her 18 year-old grandson (who is orphaned) and works at raising cattle and small-scale agriculture. Her main income derives from the sale of cheese in the public markets in the city of El Alto. She lives in the town of Achica Baja in the Ingavi province of the department of La Paz. Her grandson helps her with raising the cattle.

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production. This is Isidora’s first loan. According to the evaluation she underwent to qualify for the loan, she will increase her herd and therefore produce a larger quantity of cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Isidora, vive con su nieto de 18 años (huérfano de madre y padre) y se dedica a la ganadería y pequeña agricultura, su ingresos principales provienen de la venta de queso de leche de ganado vacuno en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive en la Comunidad Achica Baja Provincia Ingavi de La Paz, el nieto le ayuda con el trabajo de la crianza del ganado. El crédito será destinado a comprar una vaca lechera para incrementar su producción de leche.. Es el primer crédito, según la evaluación realizada califica para otorgarle el préstamo para poder incrementar su ganado y así producir mayor cantidad de queso.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
Elvia is a very hard-working and responsible person. She is 45 years old and married with five children; they are between the ages of 13 and 17. On occassion, her husband would be unemployed and they would not have the resources to provide their family with basic necessities. Three years ago Elvia decided to start her own business. First, she started washing clothes, and then, she started producing foods for sale. Her product's great quality increased the number of customers and her business.

Now she asks for a loan of 475 dollars to purchase a small oven, a tank of gas, and kitchen utensils. With these she expects to increase her production and offer a better service to her customers. Elvia pledges to pay off the loan within 4 months. In your hands is the well-being of this family. They sincerely appreciate your contribution to the growth of this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvia es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, ella tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos, de entre 3 y 17 años de edad. En ocasiones a su esposo le faltaba trabajo y no tenían los recursos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, ante esta situación desde hace tres años Elvia decidió empezar a trabajar primero lavando ropa ajena y después elaborando comidas para vender, la buena calidad de sus productos le ha permitido incrementar su número de clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Ahora esta solicitando un crédito por $ 475 dólares que planea destinar a la compra de una estufa pequeña con horno, un tanque de gas y utensilios de cocina, con lo que espera incrementar su capacidad de producción y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Elvia se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 4 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase work equipment

loans.name: Lek

texts.en:
Mr. Lek C. D. is a 63-year-old widower who lives with his four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver, and earns about $3 each day. One of his children works as a security guard, one is a motor-taxi driver, and another is a singer.

Mr. Lek C. D. has humbly applied for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to replace his old, ruined one, which often needs repairs.

loans.use: Purchase a replacement motorcycle for a taxi service.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila owns a small women’s clothing business located at the busy Central Market in Novaya-Kahovka, Ukraine. For many years, her business has provided a source of income to help support her family. Ludmila and her husband, Oleg, have a son and daughter who are now in their twenties. Ludmila first started her business about 15 years ago and has gained much valuable experience as an entrepreneur. She has been an excellent client with Nadiya Ukraine for the past four years and has never been late with a loan payment. Ludmila’s strategy is to take a loan four times a year to help purchase new inventory supplies. She has requested a short-term loan of $500 that will help her accomplish this goal and be prepared with new inventory for the upcoming colder season.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Maria Magdalena's Group

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena and Maximilian are friends and they have the same profession, they are university trained midwives and members of Bank Yachay Wasi which means “house of knowledge” in Quechua. Maximiliana also sells Renaware kitchen utensils and Maria Magdalena has three businesses, selling cosmetic products, selling health products, and the production of apple vinegar. Maria Magdalena has been a member of the Communal Bank for 8 years of which she has served on the board on various occasions. Maximiliana has been a part of the Communal Bank for 4 years and what she enjoys the most is the fraternity and sense of belonging that has formed between the female members. She also encouraged the other members to save more and a make a Christmas basket for each one of them. Their loans are for $225 and $100 respectively, and will be used for the purchase of cosmetics, supplies for the production of apple vinegar, pots, and kettles. They dream of owning a pretty house, having an independent business, and growing and expanding their current business. At Finca they learned to share, practiced basic finance, and saved.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Magdalena y Maximiliana son amigas y tienen la misma profesión, ellas son Obstetrices y son socias del Banco Yachay Wasi que significa casa del saber en Quechua. Maximiliana es vendedora D. una línea D. utensilios D. cocina llamada Renaware y Maria Magdalena tiene tres negocios, venta D. cosméticos, productos para la salud y elaboración D. vinagre D. manzana. Maria Magdalena está 8 años en el Banco Comunal y durante este tiempo ella fue parte D. la junta directiva en varias ocasiones. Por otro lado Maximiliana está 4 años en el Banco Comunal y lo que más le gusta es la confraternidad y la integración que se fomenta entre las socias. Además motivo a su grupo para ahorrar más y hacer una canasta en navidad para cada una. Sus préstamos D. 225 y 100 USD respectivamente y lo invertirán en la compra D. cosméticos, insumos para la elaboración del vinagre D. manzana, ollas y teteras. Ellas sueñan con tener una casa bonita, tener un negocio independiente, ampliar y hacer crecer su negocio. En Finca aprendieron a compartir, practicar los valores y ahorrar.

loans.use: Their loans for $225 and $100 respectively will be used for the purchase of cosmetics, supplies for the production of apple vinegar, pots, and kettles.

loans.name: Hadija's Group

texts.en: Hadija is 43 years old and is married with nine children. Her current business is selling charcoal. She intends to venture into selling used shoes after acquiring profits.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
M. Farhod is 26 years old. He is married.

During the last year Farhod has provided transportation as a service. With his lorry Farhod transports  hardware, planking, and house ware and house equipment. As a rule he is working in his region only. 

In order to decrease the expenses for fuel, Farhod is planning to install a system so he can use natural gas which is much cheaper than petrol.  For this purpose Farhod requests 600.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan Farhod has applied for  and he would like to promise to pay the loan in time and to thank everyone for their support.

loans.use: Replacing the fuel system with a natural gas supply system in his lorry.

loans.name: Carmen Rosario

texts.es:
Carmen has belonged to the Communal Bank “Amor Divino” for 8 years. In her Communal Bank she learned to be responsible, how to educate her children, and how to plan her family.

Carmen is married, 55 years old, and has 6 children, 4 of whom live with her. Carmen is originally from Compañía. Carmen, together with her brothers, makes bricks, and with the help of laborers create the bricks, then dry them in the sun, later bake them in the oven. She sells the bricks right where they are made.

During the rainy season Carmen travels to the markets where she sells vegetables, fruit, and from the markets she brings beans, wheat, barley, cheese – products she sells in the Nery Garcia market.

Carmen needs a loan of 2000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of wood and her worker’s wages.

Her savings will be used to educate her children and for the construction of a second floor of her home.

Carmen dreams that her children will be professionals, her business will grow, and she will buy another piece of land to keep making bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amor Divino” hace 8 años. En su Banco Comunal aprendió a ser responsable, como educar a los hijos y como planificar su familia.

Carmen es casada, tiene 55 años y 6 hijos de los cuales solo 4 viven con ella, Carmen es natural de la comunidad de Compañía. Carmen junto a sus hermanos hacen ladrillos, y con la ayuda de peones labran el ladrillo, luego se hace secar al sol y posteriormente se quema en el horno, sus ventas lo realiza en el mismo lugar y también puesto en obra.

Además Carmen en las épocas de lluvias, viaja a las ferias donde vende verduras, frutas y de las ferias trae haba, trigo, cebada, queso, productos que vende en el mercado Nery García.

Carmen necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña y para el pago de los peones.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará en los gastos de educación de sus hijos y para la construcción de la segunda planta de su casa.

Los sueños de Carmen con que sus hijos sean profesionales, su negocio sea mas grande y comprar otro terreno para seguir haciendo ladrillos.

loans.use: Carmen needs a loan of 2000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of wood and her worker’s wages.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị L. is 50 years old and her husband is 52. They have 2 children who are grown up. Her main occupation is selling grocery and raising pigs. With her first loan of 30 USD from TYM in 1995, she started her pig raising business which had yielded good results. In 2000, she opened a grocery store and it really picked up. After more than 10 years with TYM, she was able to build a house for her family. Selling grocery and raising pigs are suitable to enabling weekly payment. Her husband is an electrician, he helps her out whenever she needs help. This time Mrs L. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy feed for her herd of 14 pigs. Her family monthly income is 300 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị L. năm nay 50 tuổi còn chồng chị 52. Anh chị có hai con đã trưởng thành. Công việc hàng ngày của chị là chăn nuôi lợn và bán hàng tạp hóa. Với số vốn 30USD vay từ Quỹ năm 1995 chị đầu tư cho chăn nuôi mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Sang năm 2000 chị mở thêm cửa hàng tạp hóa nên kinh tế ngày càng phát triển. Sau hơn 10 năm tham gia Quỹ chị L. đã xây được một ngôi nhà khang trang với đầy đủ công trình phụ. Việc bán hàng kết hợp với chăn nuôi lợn rất phù hợp với mô hình hoàn trả tuần. Bên cạnh đó anh Đức chồng chị, một thợ điện, luôn hỗ vợ mỗi khi có khó khăn. Dự án tiến triển thuận lợi, vòng này chị L. xin vay 1200USD để mua thức ăn cho đàn lợn 14 con, đồng thời mua hàng bán. Mức thu nhập hiện nay của gia đình chị L. là 300USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy goods for grocery store and buy food for pigs

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Señora Elisa is 62 years old and is married to 65-year old Sr. Juan. They have four children all of whom are married. Elisa is the owner of a store which she started in 1990. The business was inherited from her mother, and Elisa has built up a regular clientele because of the good service that she offers. Her husband also helps in the store.

Elisa's personal dream is to expand her business so that she can offer more convenience and a wider range of products to her customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as a range of drinks, rice, noodles, vegetables, fruit, and corn, for which there is a great demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Elisa de 62 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Juan de 65 años de edad. El Matrimonio tiene cuatro hijos los cuales ya están casados.

Doña Elisa es propietaria de una despensa en el cual se inició en el año 1990. El negocio heredo de su madre, Elisa ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada gracias a la buena atención que le ofrece a sus clientes, en el negocio recibe la ayuda de su marido.

Elisa como un sueño personal, desea ampliar su negocio para llegar a ofrecer mejor comodidad y más variedades de productos a sus clientes.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: bebidas en general, arroz, fideos, verduras, frutas y granos de maíz, ya que tiene mucha de demanda de dichos productos.

loans.use: To purchase a range of drinks, rice, noodles, vegetables, fruit, and corn.

loans.name: Risikat

texts.en:
Risikat Luck lives at Iyano-cele, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes and shoes, a skill that she acquired for 2 years. She has been in this business since 2003. She is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She is a business-oriented woman who is eager to increase the prosperity of her business and that of her family. She is requesting a loan amount of $600 to buy more shoes and clothes for sales.

.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes for sales.

loans.name: Flora Zenaida

texts.es:
Mrs. Zenaida is a woman with a lot of experience in the area of sales. Over 30 years ago she opened a general store in her own home, and every day has been better than the last. When she decided to open this business, she was motivated by the need to support her household. She still has a son who needs to finish his studies at the university. After so many years, she keeps struggling with the market, and now that competition is greater Zenaida does not want to be left behind. She needs to purchase new merchandise for her general store. Help her keep forging ahead for her future and that of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Zenaida es una mujer D. mucha trayectoria en el ámbito D. las ventas, hace más D. 30 años abrió una bodega en su propia casa, cada día ha sido mejor que el otro. Cuando ella decidió abrir este negocio su motivación era el sostenimiento D. su hogar. Ahora aún tiene un hijo que debe terminar sus estudios en la universidad. Después D. tantos años, ella sigue luchando con el mercado, ya que la competencia cada día es mayor, por ello, Zenaida no se quiere quedar atrás, necesita comprar nueva mercadería para su bodega, ayúdale para siga forjando su futuro y el D. sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy new merchandise to supply her general store with new products

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 38 years old and is a wife and mother of two kids who are currently in school. She has been sewing for eight years and specializes in female clothing. Her skills and designs are very classy. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers new looks, including kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. Gloria also sells maize  for extra income to support her family. She will use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. and also more maize to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with a quality education. She is a member of the community group Platinum Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access and repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. as well as maize.

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en: Romoke O. lives in Ilogbo, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 46 years old and married with six children. For a long time, Romoke has been in the business of selling drinks and tissue paper in her shop. Romooke is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client, and she is requesting a loan of $425 USD to buy more tissue paper and drinks to sell. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and tissue paper to sell.

loans.name: Sara Ascencion

texts.es:
Sara Gutiérrez vive  en la calle 3 de la zona villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Ella es soltera, vive en casa de sus familiares, se hizo cargo del negocio familiar ya que su padre por razones de salud ya no puede administrar el taller de carpintería. Sara aprendió a  construir  muebles de oficina y domésticos, los cuales tienen mucha calidad

Solicita crédito para comprar madera en mayor cantidad, lo que le permitirá abaratar sus costos.
 
Es su segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Sara Gutiérrez lives on 3rd Street in the Exaltación neighborhood of the city of El Alto. She is single and lives in her relatives’ house. She became in charge of a family business as her father could not administer the carpentry workshop for health reasons. Sara learned how to build office and home furniture which are of high quality. She is requesting a loan to purchase wood in greater quantities, which will allow her to reduce her costs. This is her second loan with Impro and the evaluation has been carried out to grant her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El joven Nelson C. es una persona que se dedica a la venta de calzados en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originario. Es padre soltero y con la responsabilidad de mantener a su pequeña niña en edad escolar.

La razón por la cual hoy en día el joven Nelson ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito que le permita obtener los calzados para su respectiva comercialización. Por esto es que espera muy confiadamente a que su crédito sea otorgado y así salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The young man Nelson C. is a person who works selling shoes in the central market of the city of Chinandega, which is his hometown. He is a single father and has the responsibility of supporting his young school aged daughter.

The reason why Nelson has come to Ceprodel today is to apply for a loan that will allow him to obtain footwear for its respective sale. This is why he waits very confidently so that his loan is granted and through this he will advance in his business.


Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes.

loans.name: Orudj

texts.en: Orudj was born in 1983 and lives in Baku city. He has been in the clothing sales business for a year. He is married and has one child. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres. Trabaja cada día en un centro de llamadas público, para cubrir sus gastos de estudio, y además ayudar en su casa, además, también vende tarjetas prepago de telefonía celular y chips. Su negocio le ha traído la satisfacción de salir adelante, cumpliendo así un año de constantes esfuerzos, para que pueda tener en el futuro una economía estable. Es la primera vez que Rosa está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con esta cantidad comprará en grandes cantidades de chips y tarjetas prepago de la misma empresa de telefonía.
texts.en:
Rosa is 22 and lives with her parents. She works each day in the public call center to cover her student expenses and she also helps in the house, also she sells prepaid cell phone cards and chips. Her business has brought her the satisfaction of moving forward, completing like this one year of constant strengths, so that she can have in the future a stable economic situation. This is the first time that Rosa is asking for a loan with MFP, so she promises to be very responsible with her payments. With this quantity she will buy in large quantities the prepaid cards and chips from the same phone factory.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying prepaid cell phone cards

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received no formal education. Mary sells fish which she buys from the fishermen then brings them home for processing and preservation. She then sends them to be sold at the Liverpool street market in Elmina. She has done this since 1998. Her husband is a fisherman. Mary uses her income to care for the family's financial needs as well as paying the children's school fees. Mary will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save towards a house which she wants to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: To increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, sector dos, en la comunidad D. Chipana, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D. 45 años D. edad, tienen cuatro hijos, y es casada y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (cuarto D. primaria).
Trabaja hace un año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra y venta D. animales menores (ovejas) su primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra D. animales (ovejas).
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1800.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 meses D. manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará a compra D. toros maltones para engordarlos y venderlos en la feria D. Pilcuyo o Ilave, D. esta manera contribuirá en la educación superior D. sus hijos y en sustento familiar diario.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Community Bang "The United Small Stars of Titicaca", second sector, in the community of Chipana, district of Pilcuyo, Province of El Collao, Department of Puno. Aged 45, she has four children and is married. She didn't complete her primary studies, but did reach fourth graD.. For the last year she has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement. Her business is the purchase and the sale of young animals (sheep), and her first loan was for 300 Soles which she invested in purchasing the animals (sheep). With this loan of 1800 Soles, which she has promised to repay in five months in a punctual manner, the money will be destined to purchase bull calves in order to fatten them and then sell them at the market in Pilcuyo or Ilave. In this way she will be able to contribute to the further education of her children and the family's daily sustenance needs.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase young calves to fatten and sell at market.

loans.name: Namutebi Rose Group

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years of age. She is divorced and has four children between seven and eighteen years of age. The father of her children gives them some assistance but not enough to meet all their needs. She rents a two-roomed house and that’s where she stays with her children. She does have access to electricity but she does not have piped water; she has to fetch her water from a well. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is tuition fees and food.

Roes sells matooke (bananas) to earn a living for herself and her family and she does her business at the market. She works six days a week and sells her bananas on a retail basis. She receives about thirty customers a day and they are mainly women who buy from her.

Rose has done this particular business for over three years and prior to that she was selling fruit. The challenge she faces in her business is that it is seasonal; she only sell a lot when the university students are around since her business is located near the university.

Rose has worked with MCDT for four years now and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because she needed some capital for her business. She will use this loan to buy more bananas for sale. She wants to continue expanding her business and also be able to educate her children from the money she generates from her business.

loans.use: buy more bananas for re-sale

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 22-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Bilal has been working as a floor polisher for three years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Bilal has requested a loan.

Bilal is special in his work because he does it well and because of his punctuality. His clients can be anybody from his region. When Bilal first started his business, he didn't have the startup capital. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: La señora Dora, a sus 65 años, quedó viuda y junto a sus hijos y nietos pudo superar esta penosa pérdida, teniendo en ellos las fuerzas necesA. para seguir trabajando. A pesar de la nostalgia, trata de refugiarse en el trabajo y junto a su nieto mayor están implementando un restaurante en su domicilio, pues éste está ubicado en un lugar bastante transitado que hará próspero su negocio. Como prueba, primero instaló un pequeño puesto de comida en la puerta de su casa, el cual atiende todas las tardes desde las seis hasta la media noche y gracias a su buena sazón las personas han ido frecuentando su puesto de comida, lo cual animó a su nieto a poner en marcha los planes de negocio que tiene junto a su abuela. Ahora están a puertas de abrir su restaurante, donde las personas tendrán la posibilidad de visitar a doña Dora en su nuevo local, que estará en el mismo lugar, sólo que ahora podrán degustar tranquilamente de sus platillos preferidos, pues la atención será todo el día en un local más acogedor. Dora es socia fundadora de su grupo en MFP, y por seis años han compartido buenos momentos juntas, y su trabajo en equipo ha ido mejorando con el tiempo, pues han pasado por diversas dificultades económicas, por lo que han obtenido una valiosa experiencia. Los 3000 soles que ahora solicita están designados a la compra de materiales y utensilios necesarios para el pronto funcionamiento de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dora, at 65 years of age, is widowed and together with her children and grandchildren was able to overcome this painful loss, finding in them the strength necessary to continue working. In spite of the nostalgia, she tries to take refuge in work and together with her oldest grandson she is setting up a restaurant in her home since it is located in a place with good traffic which will make for a prosperous business. As a test, she at first installed a small food stand in the door of her house which she attends every evening from 6pm until midnight and thanks to her good flavors the people are coming frequently to the food stand. This encouraged her grandson to put into motion plans for a business together with her. Now they are about to open their restaurant where people will have the possibility to visit Doña Dora in her new premises, which are in the same place, but now customers will be able to calmly eat their favorite dishes all day in a more comfortable setting.

Dora is a founding member of her group in MFP, and for six years they have shared good times together, and her teamwork has been improving with time. They have had diverse economic difficulties and have obtained valuable experience from them. The 3000 PEN that she is now asking for is designated to the purchase of materials and utensils necessary for the prompt start up of her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of materials and utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou D. est un homme marié de 34 ans qui est père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans la  quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, il a fait le berger pendant 10 ans derrière le bétail familiale. Dans le souci de subvenir à ses propres besoins, il décida de venir à Bougouni chez son frère pour apprendre le commerce notamment la vente  dans une boutique d’articles divers.
Après trois années exercice  de cette activité auprès de son frère, Seydou maitrise les tenants et aboutissants du commerce général et évolue actuellement en solo.
En vu de renforcer  son fonds de commerce, Monsieur Seydou D. décida de rejoindre le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso.
 Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, divers articles pour sa boutique.  Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali.). Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Seydou D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou D., age 34, is a married man and the father of two. He lives with his wife and children in the Hérémakono Nord district of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school, he worked as a shepherd for ten year with the family livestock. Concerned about supporting himself, he decided to come to Bougouni where his brother lives to learn commerce, particularly selling various goods in a shop. After three years working in this business with his brother, he is mastering all the ins and outs of general commerce and is currently improving on his own.

To bolster his capital, Seydou decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso. He intends to use this loan to buy various merchandise for his shop. He supplies himself in Bamako (capital of Mali). His customers are composed of local people. With this loan, he plans to realize a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that he envisions using to expand his shop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods for his shop

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Орифджон проживает в городе Турсун-заде. По профессии экономист , но работает водителем такси. Занимается разведением крупно и мелко рогатого скота. Кредит планирует использовать для покупки овец и коз. Орифджон женат и имеет двоих детей. Возраст 26 лет. Опыт работы в данной сфере около пяти лет.
texts.en:
Orifjon A. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is an economist by profession, but works as a taxi driver. He also breeds large and small cattle. He plans to use the loan to buy sheep and goats. Orifjon is married and has two children. He is 26 years old. He has about five years of experience in this field.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Angella

texts.en: M. Angella is 48 years old and the mother of four children. She deals in a flower business, supplying flowers to various festivals and functions like wedding parties and other outside catering festivals, offices, hotels, etc. She is using the loan to purchase and maintain flowers for sale. Her future dream is to build a rental house.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain flowers for sale

loans.name: Blanche Cécile

texts.fr:
Z. Blanche Cécile est née vers 1984 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Blanche Cécile est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants dont deux (02) sont scolarisés. Blanche Cécile réside à Tokpa Houété dans le Département de l’Ouémé. 

Blanche Cécile a comme activité principale la coiffure. Grâce à cette activité de coiffure, Blanche Cécile arrive à venir en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges du foyer. Blanche Cécile a besoin de mieux équiper son salon de coiffure pour offrir de meilleures prestations à sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. C’est pourquoi Blanche Cécile sollicite de ALIDé un prêt.
texts.en:
Z. Blanche Cécile was born around 1984 in Porto-Novo, the economic and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married and the mother of three children, of whom two are in school. Blanche Cécile resides in Tokpa Houété in Ouémé County. Her main business is hairdressing. Thanks this business, she manages to come to her husband's aid concerning household expenses. She needs to equip her salon better to offer a better range of services to her burgeoning customer base. This is why she's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cap for drying hair and a large mirror

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna D.   agée  de 42 ans est une vendeuse de tisane.  Elle  est mariée et mère de trois enfants avec qui elle vit dans le domicile conjugal. Chaque matin elle se rende dans les jardins situés à la périphérie de la ville de Mbour pour acheter ce tisane pour thé elle revende aux boutiquiers de la ville. Elle fait ce travail depuis 10ans  les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la dépense quotidienne. Pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle elle sollicite un prêt.
texts.en:
Maimouna D. is 42 years old and she sells herbs used for making herbal teas. She is married with three children and they live together in the family home. Every morning, she goes to the gardens on the outskirts of Mbour to buy the herbs used for making tea, which she then resells to the shopkeepers in the town. She has been doing this work for 10 years and the revenue she generates allows her to help her husband out with the daily expenses. She is requesting a loan to keep up with the demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Linet Monyangi

texts.en:
Linet N. is 30 years old, married and blessed with three children. She operates a general store that sells food and household items in Nyamusi Market, which is in Western Province.

She is currently running the business on her own, though at times with the help of her husband, who is a farmer. This is the third loan that Linet is getting from KADET after successfully completing the first and second ones.

Linet hopes to use the money from this loan to expand her business by adding stocks of food and other goods to her store, and even diversify to carrying hardware products. 


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy food and household goods for her general store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda O. is from the town of Aloran. She is 48 years old. Erlinda is married and has seven grown children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixteenth loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia Sabina, es natural de Urubamba ella vive en san isidro chicon.

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tienen 4 hijos menores, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades como madre con el comercio minorista, ella es una señora muy trabajadora y se dedica actualmente a la crianza de animales porcinos y cuyes  al por mayor y para su futura venta, nuestra socia también tiene en casa un espacio donde vende chicha (bebida a base de maíz), a su vez la socia tiene un terreno dedicado al cultivo de maíz y papa, que en esta fecha están ya limpiando el terreno y regándolo para volver a poner semillas y así tener lista su cosecha para el año entrante, la socia con mucho esfuerzo logró comprarse su terreno propio, y poco a poco lo esta construyendo, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mayor número de animales a criar y así tener mayor productividad. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner, Sabina, is a native of Urubamba and lives in San Isidro Chicón. She is 32 years old, lives with her partner, and they have 4 young children. She alternates her activities as a mother with retail trade. This hard-working woman currently raises pigs and guinea pigs for wholesale and also has a space in her house where she sells chicha (a drink made from corn). At the same time, our partner has a plot of land for cultivating corn and potatoes, which she is currently clearing and irrigating in order to plant seeds again and have her harvest ready for the coming year. Through a lot of hard work, she managed to buy her own land, and little by little she is building it up, but she requires the loan to buy a greater number of animals to raise and therefore have greater productivity. She is grateful for and values the support, and she is committed to paying off her debt in the established time-frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more animals for raising and selling.

loans.name: Mrs. Chres At Group Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chres A. is a group leader of five members who all live in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectar field of land used to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation she is a pig breeder. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and fertilizer to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Nhoei Vanny, is a construction worker. Mrs. Chres A. is 32 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.

Three members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets and fertilizer to support the field.

loans.name: God's Center Group

texts.en:
'God's Center' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Janjay B., 34 years old,  married with 3 children aged 4-7 years old. Janjay is illiterate because most rural Liberian prefer farming rather than sending their children to school. She sells foodstuffs and used clothing at the waterside market in downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

Janjay started this business with Ld$ 5000 that was given to her by her husband, and she has been running this business for 10 years. She buys good quality goods and prepares them very well to attract customers.

Janjay needs this loan in order to purchase more goods. She has hopes of expanding her business to a bigger shop and dreams of giving her children quality education so they can become successful.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for resale

loans.name: Encarnacion Remedios

texts.es: La señora Encarnación es una cliente antigua de la institución, se dedica a la compra y venta de electrodomésticos con 10 años de experiencia. La Sra. es Separada de su esposo, tiene una hija de 15 años de edad, que le acompaña cuando va a visitar a sus clientes; vive en la casa de su papá, quien también le colabora en todo lo que puede. Es una cliente muy puntual y este crédito será invertido en completar el saldo que le hace falta para comprar una movilidad  a medio uso y así poder entregar sus pedidos en menos tiempo.
texts.en:
Encarnación is a long time client of the institution; she purchases and sells household appliances, and counts with 10 years of experience in this business. She is separated from her husband, and has one 15 year-old daughter that accompanies her when she visits her clients; she lives in her father’s house, who also helps in any way he can. She is a punctual client, and this loan will be used to complete the amount that she needs to purchase a used means of transportation so that she can deliver her orders in less time.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete the amount that she needs to purchase a used means of transportation.

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane M. is 43 years old and is divorced. She has 4 children, ages 22 to 9 years, and she also takes care of 7 dependents. This hardworking woman lives in Kicukiro, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. Diane has not been in business for very long -- she started selling milk in 2007 -- and today she employs one person as a helper. Her business requires that she works from 6 AM to 8 PM every day.

Diane is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing more milk and supplies to sell to her growing customer base. With this loan, Diane will be able to better take care of her children and the dependents that are in her care.

loans.use: Milk and supplies

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 47 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia. La mayor parte de su tiempo trabaja como jornalero en las chacras de sus familiares y vecinos, por lo que le pagan 15 soles, incluido almuerzo o 18 soles sin almuerzo. En esta actividad labora desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, y en todo este tiempo se ganado el reconocimiento por su  puntualidad y cumplimento de su trabajos, es por ello que es muy querido y algunas veces no se da abasto para trabajar en sus propias chacras de café y plátanos.
Pero para las cosechas de café deja sus labores como jornalero y juntamente con su esposa  recolectan los granos los llevan a vender a las acopiadoras de la ciudad, terminada eso regresan muy contentos a su casa con los alimentos para todo mes.

Él tiene buenas expectativas de MFP, ya que por primera vez trabaja con una entidad microfinanciera, en su banco comunal se lleva bien con todos sus compañeros, y a su vez se compromete a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Alberto is 47 years old and lives in his own home with his partner, who is the mother of his two children. He spends the majority of his time working as a day laborer on the farms of his relatives and neighbors, for which they pay him 15 soles including lunch, or 18 soles without lunch. In this activity he works from 7 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon, and over time he has gained recognition for his punctuality and the quality of his work. For this reason he is very much in demand, and at times does not even have time to work on his own fields of coffee and bananas. But for the coffee harvest he leaves his work as a day laborer and, jointly with his wife, collects the beans that they take to sell to the buyers in the city. Once they finish with this, they return very satisfied to their home with food for the whole month. He has high expectations for MFP, since this is the first time that he has worked with a microfinance entity. In his communal bank, he gets along with all of his fellow members, and in turn pledges to make his own payments on time. The money that he is requesting is for the purchase of chemical fertilizers to fertilize his coffee plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells curtains at retail prices to her customers to make a living. She is 38 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband is also involved in this business. She sells for long hours to ensure that she is able to meet the basic needs of her family members. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more curtains to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more curtains to sell.

loans.name: Servanda

texts.en: Servanda I. is from the village of Mantigue, San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Servanda owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Servanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Servanda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
Mrs. Baby Jane C. is a direct seller of Avon Products, Fullerlife Products, DXN Food Supplement Products, longganisa and chorizo (Filipino local sausages). She is 42 years-old and a resident of Purok 4- Maquilao in Tangub City. She has two children, aged 12 and 17 and her husband is a construction worker in Cagayan de Oro city. Four years ago, when Baby Jane realized that her husband's income was not enough to support the entire family, particularly with the cost of the children's education, she opened her store.

She now earns an average net income of not less than PHP 4,000.00. Baby Jane has been a member of Kiva partner Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperation (PMPC) for two years. She plans to take out an eight loan of PHP 5,000 to add a new line of goods to her general store: dried fish which is a popular snack in the Philippines. The future income from this loan will be used to pay for her weekly obligations and savings for her children's future.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish.

loans.name: We Praised God Group

texts.en: We Promised God is a group of five borrowers, led by J. F., living and working near Red Light, Paynesville. Red Light, near the capital (Monrovia), is Liberia's largest market. It is a bustling area full of shops, stalls and vendor tables. J. is 77 years old and married with seven children, aged 17 to 42 years of age. He also helps care for two nephews and a niece. J. is originally from Lofa County in northern Liberia and grew up on a farm. As a child, he worked on his family's farm and never had the opportunity to go to school. J.’s business is selling traditional alcoholic beverages such as hard cane juice and root liquor. He buys wholesale and sells retail to customers. J.'s share of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan is 6,000 Liberian dollars. He intends to buy more wholesale hard cane juice and root liquor. J. has been running his business for more than 45 years and this is his first loan from Kiva field partner LEAP. J. says the key to his success has been talking to customers nicely. He sells from a table at the market now and hopes that one day he will be able to open a storefront. If he continues to have a profitable business, J. says he'll be able to take care of his family well. In the photo that accompanies this profile, J. is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy wholesale hard cane juice and root liquor

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad is a 27 year-old man who lives in Gaza, Palestine. He is single and he lives with his family of eight. He supports his parents and members of the family. He has owned a mobile booth in which he sells clothes since 2008. He needs a loan of $2000 to increase the stock in his booth. He aims to own a fixed store in which he could sell clothes.

loans.use: To buy more wholesale clothes to sell in his booth.

loans.name: Edwin Francisco

texts.es:
Edwin Francisco R. G., tiene la edad de 18 años, está soltero, y no tiene hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra pollos para granja, la idea es criar y engordar los pollos para luego venderlos, y así obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Edwin Francisco desea que este negocio le ayude a dar un aporte económico a su casa, además espera poder ayudarse para poder terminar con sus estudios. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Edwin Francisco R. G. is 18 years old, unmarried, and has no children. He is requesting a loan to buy and raise chickens. His idea is to raise and fatten the chickens to later sell; that way, he can get the best possible income from their sale. This is the first time he is taking out a loan through FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the resources they provide him. Edwin Francisco hopes that this business can help bring economic support to his home and also hopes that it will allow him to finish his studies. He wishes to provide his family with a better quality of life in the future and greater economic stability, and he hopes to continue to grow as a person and agricultural producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens for fattening

loans.name: Tamemsu Traders Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Tamemsu Traders' group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Aminata K.. The 55-year-old Aminata was born in Kambia, northern Sierra Leone. She is married to an Imam and they have 4 children. Aminata sells cooked rice and has been in this business for five years now. Aminata is seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 in order to buy cooking ingredients such as palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, onions, etc. wholesale.

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients such as palm oil, rice, onions, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Sidonie

texts.fr: Née en 1975 à Atchoukpa à Avrankou, dans le département de l'Ouémé, D. Sidonie vit depuis 9 ans à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Sidonie est mariée à MISSIKPODE Barnabé, un revendeur, et est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. La famille vit ensemble à Ekpè et le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges. Sidonie n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Sidonie mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, piles, savons, huile de palme, tomates fraîches, oignons, etc.) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Sidonie achète ses produits. Sidonie a bénéficié une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Sidonie envisage renforcer son activité et mieux faire face à la demande des clients. Compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose, Sidonie sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé pour rehausser son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1975 in Atchoukpa, Avrankou in the "département" (administrative district) of Ouémé, Sidonie D. has lived for the past nine years in Ekpè, in the municipality of Sèmè-Pödji. Sidonie is married to Barnabé MISSIKPODE, a retailer, and is mother to two children, one of whom is at school. The family lives together in Ekpè and the couple cover the various expenses between them. Sidonie has never been to school. For around ten years she has run a business selling various products (pasta, batteries, soaps, palm oil, fresh tomatoes, onions etc.) from home. She buys her products at Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Sidonie has had one loan from ALIDé and repaid it without problem. She is planning to strengthen her business and to meet customer demand more readily. In view of her limited financial means, she is looking for financial support from ALIDé in order to increase her activity.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products (pasta, cans of palm oil, fresh tomatoes etc.)

loans.name: Mrs. Rom Son Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Rom S. is a 31-year-old married woman who also leads a loan group made up of eight members who live in Chvea village in Takeo province. Each member will use his or her portion of the loan to meet a specific business goal. Mrs. Rom S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she earns a living by cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Tou S., makes a living selling dried fish. Mrs. Rom S. will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide as well as more dried fish for her husband to sell. The couple has three children, all of whom are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and other items for various local businesses

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 56 años, casada, vive con sus 2 hijos ya mayores de edad y con su padre en su casa propia. Hace mas de 15 años se dedica a la compra y venta de productos nutricionales, mientras que su esposo trabaja en el extranjero, proveyéndole cada quince días este producto, convirtiéndose así en la distribuidora principal. Cada vez que los comerciantes minoristas acuden a su domicilio, casi siempre la orienta de cómo debe llegar al cliente y al visitar a sus fieles compradores, ella le indica la manera de usar adecuadamente de la mercadería, por lo que disfruta mucho lo que hace. En el futuro planea ampliar su negocio en otros distritos aledaños. Este es su dieciseisavo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a seguir siendo puntual con sus pagos. Asimismo dentro de su grupo solidario, es la secretaria y es muy entregada a sus funciones. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el incremento de estos productos nutricionales, puesto que sabe, cuanto más capital de trabajo más serán sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana is 56 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her father and two adult children. For more than 15 years she has been buying and selling nutritional products. Meanwhile, her husband works abroad and sends her products every two weeks. This has allowed her to become one of the top distributors.

Every time she conducts a sales orientation in her home, she instructs the participants on how to reach out to the customer and conduct visits with their loyal clientele. Juana demonstrates how the merchandise should be properly used in order to maximize the enjoyment of its benefits. In the future, she plans to expand her business into other neighboring districts.

This is her sixteenth loan with MFP and she promises to remain punctual with her payments. Juana also serves as the secretary of her solidarity group, so she is very dedicated to her duties. With the loan she requested, Juana will increase her supply of nutritional products since more operating capital translates into more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nutritional products

loans.name: So

texts.en: Mrs. So P. became a requirement (on-call) laborer in a plantation company when she was single, but she is now married with three young children, all of whom are students and dependent upon their parents' income. In addition to her current job, So P. planted some vegetables on the land next to her house for extra income. She has a life partner in her husband who is a laborer who works with her in the same company. The couple helps each other to generate substantial income for her family. The family’s living situation is not comfortable because their house cracks often when there is heavy rainfall. That is why So P. is applying for a loan to hire a repairman to mend the broken house.

loans.use: To hire a repairman to mend her broken house.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Ren C., 40, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

She sells Chinese noodle for an income of about USD $10 per day. Her husband is employed as a gardener, earning an income of USD $6 per day. C. also helps her husband in gardening.

C. is requesting a loan of USD $1000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached for her husband to provide transportation services. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
R. Farida is a farmer. She is 45 years old, married, and has one child. Farida puts a lot of enthusiasm into the development of her farming efforts because she is aware that they can help her child. The unconditional support that she receives from her child provides her with optimism, and despite the financial shortcomings at home she tries to alleviate those shortcomings efficiently. Her wish to improve the living conditions of her family brings her to request a loan to increase the quality and quantity of her products. Farida asks 10,000 Somoni. She wants to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. Farida is very grateful to everyone who is helping her to achieve her dreams with this loan.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Damas De Honor Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Exaltación, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal Damas de Honor. Una de las integrantes y presidenta es Reina de 30 años, casada y con 3 hijos. Hace 18 años tiene el negocio de venta de leche y sus derivados, comenzó  ayudando a su mamá y con el pasar del tiempo consolidó su propio negocio, que le permite, cubrir gastos de alimentación, techo y vestimenta de sus hijos. En esta oportunidad necesita el préstamo para comprar mayor mercadería y seguir mejorando su negocio.
Reina es clienta de Pro Mujer hace 10 años aproximadamente e indica que le gusta la capacitación ya que es una orientación, también visita el consultorio llevando a sus hijos pequeños.
Las demás integrantes de ésta Asociación tienen diferentes negocios de producción, servicio y comercio. Todas necesitan el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
In one of the Communal Associations of Pro Mujer Exaltación, the Communal Association Damas de Honor meets every two weeks. One of the members is the president Reina who is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. She has had her business selling milk and milk product for 18 years. She began helping her mother and with time formed her own business. This allowed her to cover living expenses for her children such as food, housing and clothing. She needs this loan to purchase more merchandise and continue improving her business. Reina has been a customer of Pro Mujer for about 10 years. She states that she likes the training since it is an orientation and also likes that she can visit the office with her young children. The other members of the Association have different businesses in production, services and trade. They all need the loan to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Feagaimalii

texts.en:
Feagaimalii L. is 34 and married with 2 children. She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale. Feagaimalii has many years of experience in this business. Feagaimalii needs a loan of WST$1700 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas per week) to improve/expand her business.

This is Feagaimalii's third loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Feagaimalii's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana D. was born in Belovodskoe village (near the capital of Kyrgyzstan), where she still lives. She is 63 years old.  Tatyana was born in a low-income family and from early childhood, she had to help her parents around the house. 

Tatyana got married at the age of 23. Soon she gave birth to two daughters and one son. Her husband served as an inspector in a juvenile colony, and Tatyana got a job as a cleaner in a local school. Their salaries didn’t cover all expenses of the household. In order to support her family, Tatyana decided to start animal breeding. Using the small amount of 1,000 Kyrgyz Soms, she bought goats and rabbits. Later on, her livestock grew and she got milk cows, whose milk she sold to a dairy factory.

In 1998, Tatyana divorced her husband and became the only breadwinner for her children. During the next five years, Tatyana married her daughters off. In 2006, Tatyana’s son got married; at the same time her grandson was born, which further raised the family’s expenditures. Because of this, Tatyana had to sell most of her cattle. Today she has only 20 rabbits at her farm.

Now Tatyana is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy ten pigs and one bull. That will allow her to further develop her household and business. 
In future, Tatyana plans to help her son buy a house. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Reginal

texts.en:
Reginal A. is from the village of Salay, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 52 years old. Reginal is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Reginal owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Reginal has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Reginal joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reginal has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Reginal is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Perlina

texts.en:
This is Perlina S., 56, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Jess S., a chef. She is the mother of five children, one of whom is still in high school. By the grace of God, Perlina has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her youngest to college. This is the dream for most Filipino parents like Perlina, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Perlina operates a food stall and alS. works as a direct selling agent. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families  eat home-cooked meals during the evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15, 000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 
 
Perlina dreams that her business will continue to grow. She alS. hopes that her house can be repaired and renovated someday soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings

loans.name: Phen

texts.en: Phen P., 33, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. P. is a housewife while her husband is a cameraman, earning an income of about $10 per day.  P. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new camera and other photography business needs to improve her husband's business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a new camera and other photography business needs

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura tiene 46 años, una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. Desde que tuvo sus hijos trabaja en diversos oficios, ya que su principal prioridad es sacar adelante a sus hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, siendo estos ofrecidos a sus amigas y vecinos de su barrio. Paralelo a este trabajo, todos los fines de semana, se dedica a preparar tortas y queques, para ello se  trasnochan amasando la masa, además prepara también mazamorra, postres que son vendidos en la puerta de su casa. Lo que más de gusta de su trabajo es la comunicación que mantiene con sus clientes, ya que le genera buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ayudar en los gastos del hogar. En adelante tiene planeado instalar un bazar, en el que procurar mantenerlo abastecidos de artículos para el hogar. Este es su 25avo crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser puntual en sus cuotas como hasta hoy en día. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos de belleza para cumplir con la demanda que tiene con sus clientes.
texts.en: Laura is 46 years old; she is a very hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and her three children, who are the reason for her hard work. Since she had her children, she has worked various jobs because now her main priority is to see her children succeed. She is currently selling beauty products to her friends and neighbors. In addition to this, every weekend she makes cakes, which has her up all night mixing the dough. She is also makes mazamorra (corn pudding). The desserts are sold in the doorway of her home. The thing she likes most about her work is talking to customers. She generates good income and that helps with household expenses. In the future she plans to set up a hardware store, which she will keep stocked with household goods. This is her 25th loan through Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to be punctual in her payments, just like she has been up until now. With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase more beauty products to keep up with client demand.

loans.use: Stock up on beauty products in order to keep up with client demand

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
Lidubina B. Mendosa es una señora trabajadora que a sus 66 años ha hecho de todo desde vender fritanga (pollo asado, enchiladas, tacos, carne asada, ensaladas, gallo pinto), sopas los domingos (de pollo, de mondongo, de hueso, de queso) y bisutería actualmente. Ella con el crédito comprara arroz, aceite, pollo, azúcar entre ostros productos paras sus negocios.
B. es una mujer activa es por ello que está recibiendo talleres sobre cómo hacer bisutería, actividad muy lucrativa que le ha ayudado a prender nuevas cosas y sacar su creatividad. Ella sueña en viajar lejos y conocer México.
texts.en:
Lidubina B. Mendosa is a hard-working woman at her 66 years.  She has done everything from selling snacks (chicken, enchiladas, meat, salads, and rice and beans), to selling soup on Sundays (chicken, tripe, and cheese soups) to currently selling costume jewelry.  With this loan, she will buy rice, oil, chicken, sugar, and other products for her businesses.

B. is an active woman, and that is why she is taking classes on how to make costume jewelry.  This is a lucrative business, and it has helped her learn new things and bring out her creativity.  Her dream is to travel far and to visit Mexico.

loans.use: She will purchase rice, oil, chicken, sugar, etc., for her businesses

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida T. has the status of group leader. She is 32 and married. Together with her spouse she has raised three children. The elder children are in school and the youngest is a toddler. Three years ago, after having received credit, the family purchased livestock animals. Farida’s husband feeds, waters, and puts the cattle in the pasture. Selling milk also enriches the family's budget (8-9 liters daily). The family has managed to increase its number of livestock and has purchased 10 more livestock animals for fattening. The family hopes to obtain a loan. In the future, they are planning to build a house and repaid a shed.

Farida’s partners:

Gulzat M., 36, is married. She is the treasurer of the group. Together with her husband, who is a farmer, she raises 3 children. The family makes money by selling milk (8-9 liters daily). In order to increase the total number of animals for business development, the family needs to get a loan. 

Elmira J., 43, is married. Her family consists of her husband and their 5 children. The family budget is being enlarged by cattle breeding. In order to breed more cattle, the family wants to purchase 2 livestock animals. 

Ulan T., 29, is married. His spouse is a housewife and takes care of their 2 small children. The head of the family is engaged in trading; he sells foodstuff. In order to enlarge his assortment of goods, he plans to purchase sugar, macaroni and detergents. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan.
