Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock animals

loans.name: Celia Rosa

texts.es:
Celia es  madre de familia de cuatro hijos mayores, tiene la edad de 46 años, vive en un bario de la capital Waspan Norte.
Hoy en día trabaja en servicios domestico, y en costura para poder cubrir los gastos de mi hogar. Su meta es poder tener capital para lograr trabajar solo en la costura. Ya que ha veces le resulta cansado llegar a casa y ponerse a trabajar en costura.
Con este financiamiento  desea comprar telas variadas, y hacer costura y poder ayudarse con las ganancias ya que ha logrado captar clientes en donde la mayorías de las veces los encargos de costura, ella tiene que comprar la tela y cobra en gastos total.
Contenta ya que Afodenic está abriendo puerta para lograr a corto plazo su objetivo.
texts.en:
Celia is a mother of four grown up children; she is 46 years old and lives in the Waspan Norte district.

She currently works in domestic services and dressmaking in order to make ends meet at home. Her goal is to have enough capital to set up her own dressmaking business, as there are times when she finds it very tiring to arrive home from work and start her sewing work. 

With this loan, she wants to buy a variety of fabrics for dressmaking. This could help her to make more money as she has succeeded in attracting customers and she usually has to buy the fabric for the customers' orders and charge for it in the total cost. 

She is happy that Kiva Field Partner, Afodenic, is opening doors for her to be able to achieve her goal in the short term.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fabrics for dressmaking, so that she can improve her sales

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun T., age 32, owns a grocery store in front of her home, where she sells various kinds of cooking ingredients to earn a living. Bun T. has been in this business since the beginning of 2008 and is earning around US$ 10 each day. She is married to Seng Hun, 37, who is an electrician for a government ministry. 

Bun T. has conducted her business very well, gained many customers and earned a good income. Recently, part of her inventory has sold out and she lacks money to resupply her stock. Therefore, Bun T. requests a loan of US$ 1000 which she will use to buy additional grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa A. is from the village of Tupsan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old. Rosa is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Rosa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & instant noodles, in the local community. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to like snack foods & instant noodles. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rosa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Aida Fabiola

texts.es:
Aida Fabiola Q. R. tiene 33 años, Es casada, vive con la compañera y con el hijo,  vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.
 
Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD  se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a lobores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, maracuyá esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Aida Fabiola se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Viscarra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Escudero.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Le gusta la música.
texts.en:
Aida Fabiola Q. R. is 25 years old and lives with his husband and their three children. They live in the town of Ventenas Provincia los Rios.

The Señor de la Salud group is located Soloma and is part of the Echandia municipality. This community bank focuses on the agricultural sector specifically the cultivation of short cycle crops like corn, rice, and passion fruit. The group has been working in this area for a long time.

Aida Fabiola is a farmer and works growing corn, rice, and passion fruit. She purchases her supplies in Comercial Viscarra, a large store, and she sells her products in Comercial Escudero.

She is applying for the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer to cultivate corn, rice, and passion fruit. The loan will provide economic support that will allow her to fulfill her family's needs. She faces challenges like insect infestations, plant diseases, and unpredictable weather. Her dream is buy a house. Aida Fabiola likes music.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Luís Bernardo

texts.es:
Luís Bernardo M. M., tiene 24 años, es soltero, vive con los padres en el  Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1  hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Temistocles perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembre de maíz y arroz.

Luís Bernardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es buscar un futuro bueno.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luís Bernardo M. M., age 24, is single. He lives with his parents in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. He has 1 child.

The members of the V.R.C. Narcisa de Jesus are located in the San Temistocles region, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Luis Bernardo works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He buys and sells his products in stalls in the Peña shopping center and also sells them at home or in the market every day.

He is requesting this loan for sowing corn and buying supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to have a good future.
He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Jess

texts.en:
Jess G. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 31 years old. Jess is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Jess owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jess works hard to build his business. He wants to improve his family's living conditions.

Jess joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jess is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. This will be the first loan taken out by Jess from CEVI.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kidindimya Tweyambe Group

texts.en: George is a member of Kidindimya Tweyambe group where each member guarantees the others for access to credit. For five years he has been in the business of livestock farming. With the money generated from his activities, he has been able to provide basics for his family. His biggest hardship is diseases that affect his animals. George's business plan is to own at least 100 cows. George is requesting the loan to buy medicine and sprays.

loans.use: To purchase medicine and sprays for his animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more boxes of soap to expand her business

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen T. N. is 35 years old and has three children who are in high school or secondary school. She has a shop that provides a motor repair service. She has run the shop for four years and was able to develop her business further when she took a loan from SEDA's credit program. In so doing, she created a stable income that helped her to  manage her family life and pay her children's school fees. During her time participating in the SEDA project, she has been a good repayer. For this loan, she is requesting 9,374,000 VND to buy more motor parts to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more motor parts to meet customer demand

loans.name: Iliana Aide

texts.es:
La Sra. Iliana Aidé está solicitando un préstamo por que  requiere invertir  en su negocio de  venta  de  ropa  usada, desea ofrecer a  sus clientes  una  mayor  variedad  de productos  ya  que  se ha caracterizado  por  brindarles  el  mejor  servicio, los lugares de venta varían, los primeros días de la semana generalmente lo hace desde su casa y los fines de semana recorre mercados que se encuentran al aire libre.
Agradece  el  apoyo otorgado, porque de esta  manera  se ha mantenido y así ofrecer a  sus pequeños   hijos una excelente  calidad  de vida.
texts.en:
Iliana Aidé is asking for a loan because she wants to invest in her used clothing business. She wants to offer her clients a greater variety of products since this will result in better service. The places where she sells vary. Usually at the beginning of the week she does it from her house and on the weekends she walks around the open air markets.

She is thankful for the help that has been offered, because this way she has been able to maintain her family and offer her small children an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is a forty-year-old married woman with three children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in clothes for ten years, starting with a working capital of 100,000 shillings and now has three million shillings. Her hardships are low sales and high transport costs and her vision is to own a boutique and build a house. Scovia needs the loan facility to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen C. is 22 years old, married, and has two children.  Her husband is a school teacher.  She buys and sells dry maize in Ndurio trading centre in Kapsabet and has been in this business for three years earning a monthly income of 9,700 KES.

Hellen is requesting a loan for 15,000 KES from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase seven bags of dry maize and for transport costs. She will use the profits to purchase a posho mill.  Her dream is to own a hotel in Kapsabet town.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize

loans.name: Den-Den

texts.en:
At the age of 34, Den-den B. knows just how important savings are in preparation for the future. This is the reason that she makes effort to assure that her business will go smoothly and earn sufficient profits. Denden is married to Benjamin, a barber. They are raising two children who are both in elementary level. Their family resides in Caloocan City, Metro Manila.

Capitalizing on the occupation of her husband, Denden has begun her own barber shop and has run it with Benjamin. The shop is located along Araneta Avenue, Quezon City. Having been six years in this business, Den-den learned the strategies in making a barber shop function effectively and gain more customers. She also applies the entrepreneurial trainings she receives from CCT* as she gets encouraged weekly by attending its fellowship* meetings. Every month she is able to earn roughly Php11,000.

Den-den applies for a loan worth Php20,000 to help her grow her business. This she will utilize by purchasing necessary equipment and materials for the barber shop. Denden also says that part of the loan will go to her savings. She will make sure that all she needs for the optimum functioning of the shop will be purchased so that more profits would go to her savings.

One major challenge Den-den faces is demolition in the place where she is supposed to branch out her business. Currently she is devising plans on where to locate her to-be-opened store. This is one step towards her goal of owning both a big salon and a well-known barber shop. She works hard to make this dream happen, because the bottom line is, a successful business will mean sufficient savings to secure the future of her children. It is her ultimate desire to see her children finish their education.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new equipment and materials needed for her barber shop.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea, age 28, is married and lives with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Lea is a singer, earning an income of $6 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who sells groceries, earning an income of $5 per day. The family's standard of living has improved since Lea and her husband have started these businesses. Lea is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an oven for roasting meat.

loans.name: Disenia Dolores

texts.es:
Disenia, es comerciante de verduras, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 5 y 4 años de edad, Ella es comerciante, tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado municipal, ofrece verduras en un horario de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar plátanos, repollo, tomates, cebollas, con esta compra fortalecerá el negocio, aumentando el número de verduras, para ofrecer a los clientes.
Sus aspiraciones es tener el negocio fuerte, con mayores posibilidades de ingresos, viendo la forma de mejorar y que sus hijos puedan crecer sanamente.
texts.en:
Disenia is a vegetable merchant.  She lives with her husband and two children who are 5 and 4 years of age.  She’s a merchant and has a stand in the municipal market selling vegetables from 7am until 4pm.

She currently requests a loan to buy bananas, cabbage, tomatoes and onions.  She will strengthen the business with this purchase increasing the number of vegetables she has in stock for customers.

Her goal is to have a thriving business with better income generating capabilities aimed at improving and so that her children can grow up healthily.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cabbage, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 32 years old, married and blessed with two children.  He operates a butchery to earn a living.  He also does dairy farming to generate more income for his family.  Francis says that he is a hardworking man and he is determined to open other butcheries in the future. Francis joined Faulu Kenya so that he could easily access financial resources.  He has also learned to manage his finances by saving his money.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy meat.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Hilda Orfelia

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo en edad escolar.  Hilda tiene  educación superior incompleta.
Se dedica a la venta de libros, útiles de escritorio y brinda servicio de fotocopias, además tiene locutorios.  Trabaja con  el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años.  Su primer crédito fue de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incremento al capital de su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/ 800.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco cajas de papel bond, útiles de escritorio, comprará también banderas, escarapelas y otros para las fiestas patrias.  La señora nos cuenta que su esposo a veces le ayuda en el negocio ya que tiene un empleo fijo.
Su sueño es tener el negocio bien implementado con más mercadería así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque es una distracción para las socias y las charlas que se les brinda son de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medallion) which is located in the District of Pomata, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 38 years old, married, and has a son who is in school. Hilda did not finish her higher education.

She has been with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was in the amount of 500 PEN and the money was used to increase her business capital.

With this new loan of 800 PEN, she will buy five boxes of bond paper and writing supplies. Hilda will also purchase banners, ribbons, and other items used for the patron saint festivals. Sra. Hilda says that her husband occasionally helps her with her business, but he already has a permanent job.

Her dream is to keep her business well-stocked with merchandise so that she can improve her earnings. What she likes about the Communal Bank are the meetings, because they provide a distraction for the members, and the seminars since they have been a great help.

loans.use: to purchase five boxes of bond paper, writing supplies, banners, ribbons, and other items.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario nació en Chuquisaca casado con la Sra. Eusevia tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, hace 19 años llegaron a la localidad del Torno Santa cruz y se quedaron pero tuvieron la suerte de conseguirse una parcela mediante el sindicato de la misma comunidad de Santo Corazón en la cual viven y trabajan agricultura siembra maíz, yuca, maní, el viene trabajando con Emprender desde hace 3 años, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en lo que implica la siembra de maiz, es una persona muy amable y trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mario was born in Chuquisaca and he is married to Eusevia.  The couple have four school-age children.  19 years ago, they arrived in the town of Torno, Santa Cruz and stayed there.  They were lucky enough to acquire a plot of land through the union in the community of Santo Corazón in which they live.  They grow corn, cassava and peanuts on this land.

Mario has been working with Emprender for three years.  He will use his loan money to buy what he needs to sow his corn.  He is a very kind and hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing corn and peanuts

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny is 49 years old and married with three children. She earns a living farming sugarcane and buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Zeny has been a sugarcane farmer for the past six years. 

Zeny is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to build and expand her business and secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Erika Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Erika se dedica al comercio desde hace seis años, vende cosmeticos, ropa, zapatos en su casa de habitacion, es madre de dos hijos, y su esposo labora en una lavanderia y es muy responsable.
Inicio con iniciativa propia, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, en donde ha venido aumentando al vender mas mercaderia, lograndolo con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en tres ciclos de prestamo.
Su mercaderia la compra a proveedores para obtener mejores precios, los productos Avon son de pedidos pere siempre compra mas, para mantener sus ventas activas,
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo sera para la compra de ropa, zapatos, cosmeticos, siendo el cincuenta por siento encargos. Pues gracias a los años, y a sus productos ha logrado la captacion de su clientela.
texts.en:
Doña Erika has been in business for the last six years selling cosmetics, clothes and shoes from her home.  She is a mother of two children.  Her husband works in a laundromat and is very responsible.

She started on her own initiative in order to assist her husband with their expenses.  She has been able to sell more merchandise with financing from Afodenic, from whom she has had three loans.

She buys her merchandise from wholesalers in order to obtain better prices. She purchases Avon products that her customers have ordered, and she keeps extra Avon products in stock so that she can meet ongoing customer demand.

This new loan is for the purchase of clothes, shoes and cosmetics. Fifty percent of the merchandise she is ordering is to fulfill orders her customers have already placed.  Thanks to her years in business and to her products, she has managed to build a customer base.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics to keep growing her sales.

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. We are very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the primary schools in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with us to start a branch. This group of teachers would like to receive a loan of 7,900,000 SLL from Kiva lenders in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will then repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

Mohamed is the leader of this group. The 35-year-old was born in Pujehun district. He is married to a housewife and the couple has two children. Mohamed has requested a loan of 500,000 SLL in order to buy house-building materials like cement, sand, stones, etc. for the completion of the house-building project he has begun.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like cement, sand, stones, etc. for the completion of the house he has begun.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
Lalita is 35 years-old. She is married and has one child, aged 6.  

In 2005, she established her tailoring business. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.  

In the future, Lalita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

As a borrower, to improve living standards extra training is needed. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel es una joven con muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante con su joven esposo, ella todavía no tiene hijos ya que esta recién casada, ella dice “primero quiero tener algo estable donde vivir con mi esposo ya que los hijos son una gran responsabilidad, yo quiero darles a mis hijos una buena calidad de vida por eso quiero tener mi negocio para que cuando los tenga no les falte lo necesario”. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de artículos para surtir su negocio ella quiere comprar cloro, azúcar, un poco de pan empacado, leche, dulces, frituras, jugos, sabritas etc. ella tiene con ese negocio 5 meses y surte su mercancía en diferentes tiendas de su población. Esta muy contenta por que dice que es la primera vez que trabaja con una financiera y que se le hacen los pagos fáciles y no pesados.
texts.en:
Raquel is a young woman who desires to work and move forward along with her husband. She still does not have children since she is recently married. Raquel says, “First I want to have some stability living with my husband since children are a huge responsibility. I want to provide my children a good quality of life, so I want to establish my business so that they will not lack the things they need.”

She is requesting a loan to buy products to restock her business. Raquel plans to buy bleach, sugar, a little bit of packaged bread, milk, candy, fried foods, juices, snacks, and other items. She has been in this business for five months and restocks her inventory by going to different stores in her village. Raquel is very pleased because she says this is the first time she has worked with a loan. She says the payments will be easy instead of a heavy burden.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Lina Luz

texts.en:
Lina Luz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a sewing business in the Philippines for 15 years. She also earns income from a general store.

Lina Luz, who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF, is now requesting a new loan of PHP 13,000 to buy more fabrics for her sewing business. She dreams of expanding her enterprise to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics for her sewing.

loans.name: Aníbal Jose

texts.es:
Aníbal tiene 38 años, tiene una Bodega sobre la ruta principal en la ciudad de Paraguarí hace aproximadamente 2 años.  Está en pareja con la señora Emilia de 40 años, quien también posee una despensa en el domicilio. Tienen 2 Hijos, Alejandro de 14 años y Andrea de 12 años.
Aníbal nos cuenta que empezó con la Bodega por qué le pareció muy rentable este negocio y a 2 años de abrir se sintió muy conforme con los clientes que ya tenía, pero ambicionó un poco más y de allí surgió la despensa.
El solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y Kiva para la compra de bebidas como ser vinos, cervezas para su bodega y también comestibles como ser panificados, cárnicos, lácteos para su despensa. Sabe que esto le ayudará mucho en su microempresa.
texts.en:
Aníbal is 38 years old, and has had a store on the main street in the city of Paraguarí for about the last two years.  He lives with Señora Emilia, aged 40, who also has a small store she runs from their home.   They have two children; Alejandro, aged 14, and Andrea, aged 12.

Aníbal tells us that he started his store because this business seemed to him to be a very profitable one.  Two years after he opened, he feels very happy with his customer base, but has ambitions to grow it a little further and so grow his business.

He is requesting the help of Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the purchase of beverages such as wines and beers, and also baked goods, meats and dairy products for his stores.  He knows that this will help him greatly in his micro-enterprise.

loans.use: to buy beverages, and also food, dairy products, vegetables, and other things.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a hardworking businesswoman aged 40. She is married and blessed with four children,  three of whom are in school. She has been running a beauty salon to support her family. Previously, she was runnng a welding business. Florence has employed two people to assist her to manage the business. She describes her business as good since her potential customers are local residents. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a hairdrier machine and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy a hairdrier machine and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Phiona has been working hard to manage her small business which sells fresh produce. 

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food items for resale, and will help Phiona to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Phiona hopes that in the future she will be able to continue expanding her business. 

Phiona is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Phiona's future prospects by helping her to learn how to manage money.

loans.use: to purchase more food items for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 35 year old married woman with three children. Two of them are in school. She has a business of selling g-nuts (short for ground nuts or also known as peanuts) in Kator South Sudan for four years.
Joyce requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase g-nuts. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase g-nuts for sale.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su hija y dos nietos, ella administra una tienda donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad desde hace 10 años, su hija le ayuda a atender a los clientes, viven en una zona donde hay bastante clientela.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para la tienda como: aceite, arroz, frijoles, harina para hacer tortillas, condimentos y boquitas, la compra le ayudara para incrementar el negocio y atender a la demanda de los clientes.
Entre sus aspiraciones es tener una mejor calidad de vida con su hija y nietos, creciendo en el negocio y siendo una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Ana lives together with her daughter and two grandchildren.  She runs a store where she has been selling basic household products for ten years.  Her daughter helps her to serve her customers.  They live in an area where there are a lot of customers. 

Ana is requesting a loan to buy products for her store such as oil, rice, beans, flour for making tortillas, seasonings and snacks.  This purchase will help her to increase her business and meet her customer demand.

Ana's aspirations include achieving a better quality of life for her daughter and grandchildren, growing in her business and being a good client.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, flour, seasonings and snacks

loans.name: Cecilia Rosario

texts.es:
Cecilia es una persona joven, alegre, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir a delante. cecilia vive con su esposo y dos hijos en San Gabriel, Provincia del Carchi al Norte de Ecuador. Trabaja sola en la crianza y venta de cerdos.

Trabaja ya cinco años en este negocio, comenzó en este negocio cuando se casó por la situación económica y por mejorar su calidad de vida, optó por el negocio de chanchos y de ganado. Es el quinto año consecutivo que trabaja con Fodemi, el actual crédito que solicta es para la compra de crías de cerdos para su crianza y engorde para posteriormente sacar a la venta, proceso que ayuda a que Cecilia incremente sus ventas e ingresos económicos para poder cubrir las necesidades diarias que tiene su familia.

Su sueño es poder construir su casa propia y seguir trabajando para sus hijos.
texts.en: Cecilia is a happy and hard-working young woman with a strong desire to move up in life. She lives with her husband and two children in San Gaabriel, northern Ecuador. She works by herself raising and selling pigs. She has been in the business five years and started after she married to improve her quality of life. This is her fifth year in a row working with Kiva partner FODEMI, and she is requesting the loan to purchase baby pigs to fatten and later sell, which will help her increase her income to cover her family's daily needs. Her dream is to be able to build her own home and to continue working for her children.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to fatten and later sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: make improvements to her business premises and purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe DEME  sont  essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à  SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame DJENEBA fait le commerce d’habillements dans ce groupe de femmes de  DEME, elle se tient  au milieu en position debout.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 15 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché de Bamako.  Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso  à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The Deme group is mostly made up of married women with an average age of 35 and, on average, 5 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, one of the popular districts in the town of Sikasso. This will be the group's 2nd loan from Soro Yiriwaso, and has been requested so that the women can keep up with their customer demand. Their previous loan was fully repaid.

One of the group's members, Djeneba, standing in the middle of the picture, sells clothing. She will use her part of the loan to buy 15 pieces of wax pagnes (traditional sarong-like clothing) from the Grand Market in Bamako. She and her family sell the merchandise from a fixed spot at the Grand Market of Sikasso, for cash, to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Djeneba anticipates making an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs, which she will use to repay the loan and interest, whilst saving the rest. She would like to increase her turnover so that she is in a better position to satisfy her customer's needs.

loans.use: to buy some pagnes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 25-year-old single woman. She has a daughter who is 2 years old. She describes herself to be a focused woman. 

Grace operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services such as plaiting, blowdrying, etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 1 staff members. Her business is located within a strategic business environment  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

Grace will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more beauty products for use in her salon. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have expanded her business and created more job opportunities.

loans.use: buy products for her salon

loans.name: Abednego

texts.en: Abednego is a 34 year old married man. He has a child who is  years old. He describes himself as a social and talkative man. He operates a motorcycle  where he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located along a busy road and his primary customers are local residents and business people. In addition, he is farms, which adds to his business income from products he harvests such as cereals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent police harassment due to lack of a driving license. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to buy another motorcycle  within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a twenty nine year old hardworking single man with one child living in Kamwenge Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income though he also owns rental houses to earn an extra income. 

He started this business with the intention of generating funds to meet personal goals. Justus hopes to expand his businesses and buy a motor vehicle though he faces a challenge of lack of capital to meet the increasing demands.

He is requesting for a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Ada Marina

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Ada and I run a pulperia ( groceries/cafe),called \\\"Pulperia Angie,\\\" located in the center of my community. I have several years experience running my business, the income from which contributes to covering the family expenses and other bills. I need to stock my business in order to satisfy my clientel.

Hola Mi Nombre es Ada, cuento con un negocio de pulperia, llamada Pulperia Angie, ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios experiencia en este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para contribuir en los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, necesito surtir mi negocio para poder satisfacer a mis cliente.

loans.use:
To purchase rice, sugar, butter, soap, flour, toilet paper, coffee, milk products, chicken and meats.

Compra de Arroz, azucar, manteca, jabon, arina, papel Higienico, cafe,cubitos, lacteos, pollo, carnes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph Otieno O. is a 25-year-old man. He is married with two children and lives within the Kibera slums of Nairobi. Apart from his wife and two children, Joseph takes care of nine orphans too. Four children from his brother and five from his sister, who are both victims of the AIDS pandemic.

Joseph earns his livelihood by operating a salon and barbershop in Raila, a small village within the Kibera slums. It has been in operation for the last 7 years. Joseph received hair dressing skills from his father’s salon and barbershop in Ahero, in the Western part of Kenya, where he worked for 2 years. He would blow dry (straightening) and perm (chemical application for straightening) ladies’ hair and give haircuts to men. Joseph pooled his savings of Ksh 2,000.00 ($29) with his father’s kind donation of 3,000.00 ($43) to rent a room, buy a blowdryer and a shaving machine. He says he is happy seeing his clients beam with joy after doing their hair.

Joseph’s fame in Kibera is known and right now he is turning away a good number of his clients because the hairdryer and blowdryer he has cannot meet the growing demand of his many customers. Therefore Joseph is requesting a loan of $175, to be repaid within 8 months, which he will use to buy a hairdryer and a blowdryer. Both of these tools will translate into more income for his business. This will in turn create job opportunities for more people, therefore alleviating poverty within his community.

loans.use: To purchase one hairdryer and one blowdryer.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.en:
Carmelo, his wife and their 8 year old son live in a house that they own in Las Lomas area, which is on the west side of La Paz. He works as a builder, taking different jobs at private homes in La Paz, while his wife sells vegetables in Buenos Aires Av. Mr. Carmelo M.'s house has 2 adobe rooms and with the loans our institution has given him, he has added 3 brick rooms, which are almost finished, and thus be able to accommodate his family comfortably. The loan will be used to finish the details of the three rooms (doors, windows, plastering, and interior painting). It is his sixth loan with our institution and his paying on time as well as good performance shows that he has good credit.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Carmelo vive con su esposa Placida Quispe y su hijo Alan de 8 años en una vivienda de su propiedad en la zona Las Lomas, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Carmelo trabaja como constructor libre realizando distintos trabajos en la casas particulares en la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa vende verduras en un puesto de venta en la Av. Buenos Aires, de la misma ciudad. La casa del señor Carmelo M. cuenta con dos habitaciones de adobe a la que con créditos realizados en nuestra institución pudo incrementar tres habitaciones de ladrillo las cuales se encuentran en la etapa de conclusión para poder dar condiciones mínimas de comodidad a su familia. El crédito es para concluir la construcción de las tres habitaciones en obra fina (puertas, ventanas, revoque interior y pintado). Es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo en nuestra institución, y su rendimiento y puntualidad demuestran un comportamiento crediticio bueno.

loans.use: Construccion

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom has a small candy store on the first floor of Pahjshanbe market. She is married and has 4 children. Her elder son is in 8th grade, and helps his mother at the store after lessons.

Dilorom became a client of Micro Invest in 2006, when she borrowd $100 to expand her assortment of candy and attract more clients. She only sells candy produced in Russia, which is provided by various distributors. Her candies are of high quality, so her small shop is one of the well-known shops in Panjshanbe.

She is now requesting another loan, this time for $1,000, to buy more candy and increase the volume of her goods so that she can sell and earn more for her family.

loans.use: Increasing her inventory of candy for her candy store

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice Osagie sells drinks and provisions in her little shop. She is 35 years old, married with two children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs US$ 400 for the expansion of her business. She has been in this business since 2005.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Aldo

texts.en:
Aldo is 27 and single. He learned how to be a tailor from his father and worked with whom he worked for many years. He is an extremely dedicated and hard-working young man; he works as a tailor during the day and at night attends the University of Paraguay where he studies Administrative Sciences. He is currently completing his third year.

Two years ago, Aldo opened his own tailor shop and now works independently. Today, he is passing on the trade to the next generation. His two children work and assist him in the tailor shop.

With the micro-credit loan, he plans to buy a sewing machine. Since he has a high level of demand with established clients, he needs to be able to produce large quantities of clothing in short time spans. This is a goal that will be made possible with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy grain to resell

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia lives at 482 Chavarria Street in a neighborhood called Satelite, which is located in the city of El Alto. She lives there with her two children, ages three and one. Her husband works at an institution in the city of Santa Cruz. Claudia works as a hairdresser from her home, in an area converted for her to work. She would like this loan in order to buy more material, such as dyes, hair developer, combs and brushes, etc. This is her second loan with Impro, and her evaluation qualifies her for this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer

Claudia vive Calle Chavarria plan 482 de la zona Ciudad Satélite, ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 3 y 1 año respectivamente, su esposo trabaja en una institución en la ciudad de Santa Cruz..Trabaja como peinadora en una habitación adaptada para su actividad en su domicilio. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de material - tintes, Developer, peines, etc., para desempeñar su trabajo. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase dyes, hair developer, and brushes for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Blung

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 38, is a widow. She has one son and three daughters who are all studying in the village school. She is living with her elderly mother and children along Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

She has been selling personal beauty products for 15 years, which earns five dollars gross income daily. She buys these items from a market in Phnom Penh and sells to the local villagers and visitors who travel through her village. Mrs. S. is requesting a loan for the fourth time from MAXIMA in the amount of $600 to fix her house and fence.

loans.use: To fix her house and fence

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Hoàng Thị Ngoán is 54 years old. She lives in ý Yên, Nam Định with her husband and 2 children. She joined TYM fund in 1998. Like the majority of the villagers, her main occupation is farming and raising pigs. Before joining TYM, she did not have any capital to start up a business so her income was just barely sufficient for her family. After joining TYM, the loan was well invested in the pig raising business so her income was steadily increasing. Now on average, she makes 100 USD a month. Mrs Ngoán also sells basic goods at the market: vegetables, eggs ...etc. to make the weekly payment. Her husband and 2 children do help her out when she is overloaded with work. This time Mrs Ngoán is requesting a loan of 400 USD to buy a new batch of piglets to replace the ones that she sold during the Tet holidays.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Ngoán, 50 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại ý Yên, Nam Định. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Như phần lớn các gia đình trong vùng, công việc chủ yếu của chị Ngoán là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi lợn. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ, do ít vốn nên thu nhập từ việc chăn nuôi chỉ đủ nuôi sống gia đình. Sau khi vào Quỹ, có thêm vốn nên việc chăn nuôi được mở rộng, thu nhập cũng tăng lên. Lãi bình quân hàng tháng từ việc chăn nuôi hiện nay là 100USD. Để có tiền hoàn trả hàng tuần, chị Ngoán cũng tích cực chạy chợ, khi mớ rau, khi quả trứng. Những lúc khó khăn chồng và hai con cũng tích cực hỗ trợ chị. Vòng vốn này chị Ngoán xin vay 400USD để mua lợn con thay cho lứa lợn mới xuất chuồng dịp Tết.

loans.use: Buy piglets

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen is married with Jose Olivo Moldonado and they have two children aged 24 and 19 years old. She started her business when she was invited to joint a group in selling a prestigious brand of cometics and she liked the idea, especially because the income they earn is from her husband and she contributes what she can to the household finances.

Her motivation rested on the fact that she wanted to help with the household expenses and since her husband is now retired they needed an income to cover the extra family expenses. So she entered the sales group and it has helped her because she many more people and at the same time she is doing something productive, and provides for their needs. She started her sales 6 years ago and it has gone very well. At the beginning she only had a few clients but now she has a larger clientele and in this type of business the same clients recommend to others and the circle of sales keeps on growing, so long as the orders are filled and the costumer service is right.

She needs a loan of $100 US that she will repay in a term of 3 months, a loan that will help her fill the orders that have been made and are outstanding, and this way she will be able to fulfill the commitment to her clients. With your help Carment will continue to see success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del Carmen esta casada con José Olivo Maldonado y tiene dos hijos de 24 y 19 años. Inició el negocio cuando la invitaron a integrar parte del grupo de venta de una prestigiada marca de cosméticos y le gusto la idea, ya que los ingresos que tienen son por parte de su marido pero ella apoya con lo que puede a la economía de su casa.

Su motivación fue que quería ayudar con los gastos de la casa y como su marido ya esta jubilado necesitaba un ingreso extra para los gastos de la casa. Por eso entro al grupo de ventas y le sirve porque conoce a mas personas y a la vez hace algo productivo, que genere utilidades. Comenzó a vender hace 6 años y le ha ido muy bien, porque tenia muy poquitos clientes en un comienzo pero ahora ya tiene mas clientela y en este tipo de productos la misma gente la va recomendando con otras y se va ampliando el circulo de ventas, siempre y cuando les cumplas con sus pedidos y les des un buen trato.

Requiere un crédito por US $100 que pagara en 3 meses y le va ayudar a sacar adelante un pedido de mercancía que tiene pendiente y así cumplir con el compromiso que tiene con la gente. Con tu ayuda carmen podrá seguir prosperando.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Martha Regina

texts.es:
S. M. has obtained nine loans with Fundación Leon over the past six years. She has invested this capital in merchandise to sell, which she does from her mobile stand. The business has visibly grown over the years. She has had recent success selling a new brand of mop heads.

Her husband works as a mechanic and they live with S.' parents. They have two small children.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora S. M. Trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace seis años obteniendo nueve prestamos los que ha utilizado para la compra de mercaderia en general se puede ver que el negocio a crecido actualmente ademas de la mercaderia vende mechas de lampazo que es una nueva linea que antes no tenia, casada vive con su esposo y padres el esposo trabaja como mecanico. tiene dos hijos pequeños.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise to sell from her mobile stand

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en: Ronke O. lives in Ikotun, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 51 years old and married with 6 children. She sells yam and garri (a food made from cassava). She travels outside the state, to Ogun State (a 3-hour drive by car) from Lagos State, to buy directly from farmers in their farms. This, she says, will cut costs, thereby making her able to sell at a lower price, which in turn will attract more customers to her shop. She acquired the skill for a year. She has been in this business since the year 1976. Ronke needs a loan of $700 to buy more yams and garri in large quantities so that she can increase her profit and lift her family above poverty.

loans.use: To buy more yams and garri

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa has been a seamstress for 8 years, she learned to seam whilst working on a textiles factory.

Before, she had a workshop inside her home but six months ago she decided to open her own workshop at the local market.

She has several sewing machines and for the moment she works by herself at the workshop, where she works all day long. She has used the loans she has received so far to refurbish her workshop.

Teresa would like her business to grow more and to be better known.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa se dedica a la costura desde hace 8 años. Teresa aprendió a coser debido a que trabajaba en una fábrica textil. Ella antes tenía su taller en su casa, pero hace 6 meses decidió poner su taller en el mercado de su barrio. Tiene varias máquinas de costura industriales. Por el momento, ella trabaja sola en el taller. Atiende todo el día. Los préstamos los ha utilizado para refaccionar el local propio que ahora tiene en el mercado.

Teresa quisiera que su negocio crezca más y hacerse más conocida.

loans.use: To refurbish the sewing workshop she has at the local market

loans.name: Assaad

texts.en:
Assaad is 66 years old, married, and the father of one child. He lives with his family in a village close to Saida, south of Lebanon.

Assaad runs two parallel businesses: he owns a small shop selling gadgets and accessories and is also a taxi driver. He has been a microcredit client of Al Majmoua for the past three years. According to Assaad, the loans he requested were very supportive and resulted in a lot of positive changes in his life. He was able to help his child receive a good education and was also able purchase a taxi car that increased his income and guaranteed a better livelihood for his family. This time, Assaad needs a loan for $1200 to conduct maintenance on his taxi car.

loans.use: Conduct maintenance on his taxi car

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine O. sells foodstuffs like vegetable, palm oil, garri, plantain, etc. Josephine has been in this business for a long time. She is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She is a client of LAPO. She needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She says this will increase her sales and she will be able to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores inició el negocio para apoyar a su esposo ya que el estuvo desempleado y empezó a trabajar como taxista, lo que les generaba un ingreso variable. Empezó vendiendo frutas y verduras en su casa, al inicio con poca mercancía y los clientes de la colonia le fueron pidiendo mas variedad hasta lograr tener mas productos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante.
texts.en:
Dolores started her business to help her husband who was unemployed. Her husband started working as a taxi driver but this generates a variable income for them so she started selling fruits and vegetables from her home. At first, she started with a little merchandise but the clients in the neighborhood started asking for more variety and she obtained more products.

Dolores needs a loan in the amount of $375 - which she will repay in four months - to purchase merchanside. With your help she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Savoeurn M., 47, grows and sells vegetables, earning around $1 per day. She is married with five children, three of whom are married and other two are single. Two work as garment workers in Phnom Penh. Her husband, Mr. Pan Long, 48, makes wood bed, earning around $2.50 per day. Savoeurn requests a loan of $700 for her husband to purchase more wood to make beds and to buy 200 baby ducks to breed.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to make beds and to buy 200 baby ducks to breed

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel H. is a resident of Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 23 and has two children.  Her husband is a motorcycle driver and his work is their main source of income but is not enough for them. After one year of marriage, she joined Paglaum MPC in 2002 to acquire start-up capital of Php 3,000.00. Through the continuous education of PMPC, she enhanced her knowledge of “moron” (a native delicacy made of ground glutinous rice with coco milk and cocoa) and "puto" (made of ground rice with coco milk and sugar), but she had no start-up capital. As per records she has been a trusted borrower for almost 6 years.

With so much dedication, she sells her quality moron products to the passengers in the bus terminal of the town next to Plaridel and even in the nearby municipality. She has the passion to serve her customers' satisfactions. Because of this, the demand for moron products increases. In order to fulfill her orders, she needs to borrow additional capital of Php 10,000.00. She wants to help her community by hiring additional moron makers and purchase her own motorcycle so that she can prepare an education plan for her children.

loans.use: Purchase of glutinous rice, sugar, coconut, cocoa, and peanuts

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris tiene 34 años, está separada de su pareja, vive con sus hijos; Juan de 14, Daniel de 12, Griselda de 10 y Frank de 2 años. Tras haber laborado en diversos oficios, desde hace tres años, se dedica a la venta ambulante de popcorn, para poder solventar los gastos de su familia. La venta de este producto es muy buena, ya que su rico sabor atrae a muchos paladares al puesto de Doris. Lo complicado de su trabajo es preparar el popcorn, de manera artesanal, y dejarlo en su punto, pero Doris tiene buena mano para la preparación y los prepara muy agradables. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mejorar sus ventas, refaccionando su triciclo donde vende su producto, para mejorar la atención al público y producir mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Doris is 34 years old. She is separated from her husband and lives with her children, Juan (14 years old), Daniel (12), Griselda (10), and Frank (2). After having worked a variety of jobs, she has been working for three years as a popcorn street vendor in order to cover her family's expenses. Sales of the product are excellent, since the delicious flavor attracts many palates to Doris's stand. The complicated part of her job is preparing the popcorn by hand and getting it just right, but Doris has a knack for it and prepares it very well. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She plans to improve her sales with the money requested, refurbishing the cart from which she sells her product in order to better serve her customers and increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish the cart she uses for her business

loans.name: Azad

texts.en: Café businesses are a flourishing business in Azerbaijan for the simple reasons that all people have lunch out of their offices and men of Azerbaijan like to spend time in cafés in the evenings. Azad has been running his cafe in the small village of Sabirabad for the past five years. He is a cook and finished a special cookery college course.  He began his own stall with his hard-earned savings, as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. Slowly, he began to understand what people want to eat and now his menu consists of only five meals but they are most popular. Azad is a father of three young children who are in school. Like any father, he is doing all he can in order to ensure his children the best future and make them well educated. Now he needs a loan of US $1,200 in order to make improvements in his cafe. He promises to repay the loan and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: To make improvements to his cafe

loans.name: Fraternidad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Fraternidad inicia su segundo ciclo con  14 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta abarrotes en general, comida, frutas, cereales, ropa, venta D. animales y la agricultura.

Como es el caso D. Dolores que es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Dolores se dedica a la agricultura D. alfalfa, arverja que luego comercializa en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Dolores tiene un pequeño taller D. confección D. prendas D. vestir.

Mientras que Juliana es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Juliana venD. ropa en las diferentes ferias D. la región, y D. las ferias compra animales y cereales que comercializa en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles,  haciendo un total D. 6,450 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. semilla, papa, telas, mandiles, faldas, arroz, azúcar, fideo, frutas.

Los sueños D. las socias son educar a sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas, tener una granja D. cuy y aumentar la producción en sus tierras.
texts.en:
The Bank 'Fraternidad' ('Brotherhood') is starting its second cycle with 14 members.

The members have different businesses like selling groceries in general, food, fruit, cereals, clothes, selling animals and in agriculture.

In Dolores's case she lives with her partner, is 30 years old and has 2 kids. Dolores dedicates herself to cultivating cress and carob beans which she later sells in the basic supply market in the city of Ayacucho. Moreover, Dolores has a small workshop making clothes.

In the case of Juliana, she is married and is 40 years old with 5 kids. Juliana sells clothes in the different markets of the region, and in the markets she buys animals and cereals which she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho.

The members need different loan amounts like 300 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles, making a total of 6,450 soles in loans for the Community Bank.

Their loans will be invested in buying seeds, potatoes, material, aprons, skirts, rice, sugar, noodles and fruit.

The members' dreams are to educate their kids, improve their homes, have guinea pig farms and to increase their lands' production.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, potatoe, materials, aprons, skirts, rice, sugar, noodles and fruit/la compra de semilla, papa, telas, mandiles, faldas, arroz, azúcar, fideo, frutas.

loans.name: Masay Group

texts.en:
Consolatha has been a clothes seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business from 8am to 6pm.  Consolatha  is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Consolatha is 27 years old, married, and has two children: ages 10 and 4. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwanaidi and Asia. Each woman also has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ghencea

texts.en: Mr. Ghencea currently owns .36 hectares of vineyard and 2.5 hatares of arable land. On the arable land, Mr. Ghencea grows cereals which he sells in the agricultural market. The harvest of grapes he sells to the exporters of table grapes. A portI. of the grapes he brings home to produce wine that he sells during difficult financial periods. He has run such types of activity already for 8 years. He requested a loan from Microinvest to purchase seedlings. Business is profitable, but the applicant wants to increase the profitability through new seedlings.

loans.use: Purchasing seedlings for renovation works

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont toutes mariées, âgées de 25 à 52 ans avec en moyenne 2 enfants, vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Markala de la sous-préfecture de Garalo, préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes sont en  partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 6 mois. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire après avoir correctement remboursé le premier. Elles  sont unies par des  liens du voisinage.
Le présent prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 250 kg de céréales (mais, fonio).Les femmes s’approvisionnent avec les agriculteurs des villages environnants de Garalo. Ces céréales  seront revendues à Bougouni et Garalo pendant les jours de foire.
Ce commerce permet à chacune des membres du groupe de gagner en moyenne 25.000FCFA par mois. Cette marge bénéficiaire leurs permet de rembourser l’échéance du prêt et de satisfaire également quelques dépenses de la famille (éducation des enfants, santé et habillement surtout).
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group are all married, aged between 25 and 52, with on average 2 children, and live in traditional extended families in the Markala neighborhood of the Sous-prefecture of Garalo, Prefecture of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women have been partners of Soro Yiriwaso for 6 months. They are on their second solidarity loan, after having correctly reimbursed the first. They are united by ties of living in the same neighborhood.

This loan will be used to buy 250 kg of cereals (maize and fonio--a local sort of millet). The women buy their merchandise from the farmers in the villages surrounding Garalo. The cereals are re-sold in Bougouni and Garalo on market days.

This business permits each of the members of the group to earn an average of 25,000 F CFA per month. This profit will allow them to make repayments on the loan and also cover some family expenses (education for their children, health, and clothing costs above all).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals for re-sale

loans.name: Xekh Niak 21 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Xekh Niak 21 (Fighting Poverty 21) est composé de cinq femmes dont la plus jeune a 33 ans et la plus âgée a 63 ans. Elles habitent à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles exercent la même activité d’aviculture.  Dans le cadre de l’amélioration de l’agrandissement de la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance l’IMCEC.  Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des poussins, des sacs d’aliments pour les nourrir, et pour payer les vaccins.  Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30,000 CFA ($60) chaqu’une au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The group Xekh Niak 21 (Fighting Poverty 21) is composed of five women, the youngest is 33 years old and the eldest is 63. They live in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Sénégal. They know one another through ties of community and kinship, and they do the same work, poultry farming.

With regards to improving and expanding their business, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution IMCEC. They intend to use this loan to buy some chicks and sacks of food to feed them and also to pay for vaccines.

The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profit will be used to make loan interest payments, to provide for the family, and to invest the rest in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed, and vaccines

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi A. est un jeune homme de 38 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome. Il exerce cette activité de puis qu’il a quitté les bancs de l’école. Koffi souhaite avec ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto et de bailler la première à une tiers personne qui est tenue de lui verser des mensualités. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses recettes et par conséquent honorer ses engagements et dégager des profits pour la survie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi A. is a young man of 38, married and the father of 2 children. He is a motorcycle taxi driver in Wome. He has been working at this job ever since he left school.

Koffi hopes to use this loan to buy a new motorbike and rent out his present one to a third party who would pay him by the month. This would allow him to increase his earnings and thus pay what he owes and have profit left over for the survival of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Sakina Muhammad Bashir Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is a widow and has resided in Borewala, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Her husband died of a heart attack and left her in a condition where she had no financial resources. She started a clothes-sewing business to earn income. With the profit she was able to start another business and that was selling bangles. She gathers a good number of customers from her variety of bangles. She is very happy with her success and is applying for a loan to buy bangles to expand her bangle-selling business. 

She is the group leader of five other women from her locality:

Hamidan baji, Naseem baji and Jamila baji each want a loan to buy fertilizer to sell.

Sajida parveen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

Nagina kosar baji wants a loan to buy plastic beans for her business making plastic bags.

loans.use: To buy bangles to expand her business

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.en: A. Abdurasul is 29 years old and lives with his wife and a little son. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions and their well-being. He has been a farmer for five years and started this activity on his own. He plans to be able to diversify his crops. With the proceeds of the loan he will buy supplies and fertilizers for his fields, in order to obtain better production and the ability to sell at a better price. Be an important part of the growth of Abdurasul‘s business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Angela Felicitas

texts.es: Ángela Felicita Vásquez B. tiene la edad de 73 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 6 hijos.la actividad económica a la que Ángela se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio vendiendo refrescos naturales y golosinas y por medio de sus clientes que solicitaban otro tipo de productos decide, mantener el negocio de la pulpería, y así es como decide invertir en otro tipo de productos para que sus clientes recurran a su pulpería. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de gaseosas, refrescos, golosinas, aceite, detergentes y jabón. El deseo de Ángela es seguir adelante con este negocio porque fue por medio de este que logro preparar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Senora Angela is 73 years old and is a single mother of 6 children. For more than 30 years, Angela has run a small shop in order to generate income. She began selling fruit drinks and sodas, and when her customers began asking for more products, she decided to open a small general and offer more variety to her customers. With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase sodas, sweets, cooking oil, detergents and soap to stock her store. Angela's goal is to continue to run and grow this business as it has enabled her to care for her family.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her store such as sodas, sweets, detergents, soap, etc.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort V. is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She has received schooling through primary school.

Comfort makes and sells palm kernel oil at Atabadze near Elmina, which she has done since 1995. She uses her income for paying school fees and other expenses.

Comfort will use the loan to purchase more palm kernels to make oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to save towards buying a new house.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernels to make oil for sale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma A. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Vilma is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Vilma plants & harvests corn. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2000 Philippine pesos (about $42 US) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5000 pesos which will be used to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Vilma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a boy and a girl, who are both still in school. She works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. Joyce lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. Joyce cooks and sells rice and stew in the morning on the street in her community. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. Joyce has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants, vivant dans des familles monogames à Ouayerma 1, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt de groupe, après avoir bien remboursés les quatre précédents.
Elles font de la vente de condiments alimentaires, de chaussures, de la pâte d’arachide, de parfums, de l’ encens, du bois de chauffe, la fabrication de boissons locales  non alcoolisées, etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 6 emballages de condiments alimentaires, 1 chargement de camion 10 tonnes en bois de chauffe, 1 douzaine de parfums,  2 douzaines de chaussures, 10 kg de gingembre, 1sac de sucre,  8 kg de graine guenni et magnon pour préparer de l’encens et 150kg de graine d’arachide pour en faire la pâte d’arachide. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville sur place à la maison, soit dans les marchés et aux abords des artères principales soit de façon ambulante dans les quartiers. Elles vendent au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 45.500 FCFA dont une partie servira d’épargne et à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un coin de vente.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are all married women who are on average 38 years old with an average of 2 children, living in monogamous families in Ouayerma 1, one of the neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, in the the third administrative area of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution in order to meet the needs of their customers and this is their fifth loan, after correctly repaying the four preceding loans. They sell seasoning, shoes, peanut butter, perfume, incense, firewood and make local non-alcoholic beverages, etc. With their new loan, they plan to purchase 6 packages of seasoning, 1 truckload of 10 tons of firewood, 1 dozen perfumes, 2 dozen shoes, 10 kg of ginger, 1 sack of sugar, 8 kg of gueni seeds and magnon to make incense, and 150 kg of peanuts to make peanut butter. They get their supplies in the Sikasso marketplace and in the neighboring villages. They sell in Sikasso out of their homes, either in the markets and near the main roads, or in the neighborhoods in a traveling manner. They sell for cash, retail and on credit to a clientele made up of men and women. They each envision a monthly profit of 45,500 CFA francs, of which a portion will be used for savings and to meet the needs of the family, and the other portion will be reinvested in their activities. They plan to have more capital to better satisfy their customers and to build a sales area.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various items.

loans.name: God Mercy Group

texts.en:
'God Mercy' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Eslie C., 53 years old and a widow with 7 children aged 21-35; their educational levels: 11th grade-college graduate. Eslie also cares for 5 siblings.

Eslie's business is food preparation.She prepares home food right in front of her house in Pipe Lines, Paynes Ville in the capital, Monrovia, Liberia. 
She started with doing a part-time job, saved, and later decided to get into business 29 years ago.

Eslie prepares her food like good home food that her customers will always want to buy from her. She needs this loan in order to expand her food preparation business.
