Eslie dreams of making her children successful so that their father's name will remain.

loans.use: to expand her food preparation business

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto B. Jr. is 28 years old. He is married to Babylyn, an overseas Filipino worker. The couple were blessed with two children: Vince, 5 years old and already in preschool, and Jackielyn, 3 years old. He is living with his son at San Pablo, Alicia Isabela, while his daughter is being cared for by his parents. Before his wife went abroad, she entrusted her business to Roberto Jr., which he has managed for almost three months.  

Additionally, Roberto works as a motorcycle driver. He has done this for almost two years and earns a daily income of PHP 300.00. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000.00 from the Kiva lenders that he needs for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.use: repairing and maintaining his motorcycle

loans.name: Petrona Maritza

texts.es: La señora Petrona es una mujer de recursos bajos, desde su juventud  ayudaba a sus padres ya que eran familia humilde de casos recursos, tiene 46 años de edad, con tres hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando para que tengan un mejor futuro, es casada y su esposo trabaja en mantenimiento, viven en un barrio muy pobre donde la delincuencia asecha cada día, por el poco desempleo en Nicaragua. Ella desde hace diez años trabaja como domestica donde gana un salario bajo,  y no le permite proyectarse con sus objetivos de terminar su casa, en tiempos libre ella lava y plancha para obtener otros ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades en la alimentación ya que la canasta básica esta súper cara y no ajusta con su salario. Lleva cocho ciclo en Afodenic y gracias a los financiamientos ha logrado hacer las mejoras, con el préstamo anterior compro piedra, arena, hierro pero no logro hacer nada lo cual con este préstamo podrá comenzar a cambiar el techo que esta muy viejo y se pasa el agua y hacer las mejora. Agrádese a la institución por dar la oportunidad que da a mujeres pobres para que logren mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Petrona has few resources. Since she was young she helped her parents. They were a humble family with scant resources. She is 46, and she has three children who are studying so that they can have a better future. She is married, and her husband works in maintenance. They live in a very poor neighborhood, which is threatened with violence everyday because of unemployment in Nicaragua. Since she was ten years old, she has worked as a domestic employee, where she earns a low salary. This does not allow her to work towards her objective of finishing her house. In her free time she washes and irons to get other income to be able to cover the food necessities. The basic necessities are super expensive, and they do not match her salary. She has had eight cycles with Afodenic. Thanks to the loans she has been able to make improvements. With the previous loan she bought stones, sand, and iron. But, she was not able to do anything. With this loan she will start to change the roof, which is very old and leaks, and make the improvement. She is grateful to the institution for giving poor women the opportunity to improve their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zince to change the very old roof on her house

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with two grown sons. He is a businessman from Kamenka, where he works in the sphere of construction, selling construction supplies and offering related services. Sergei has recently opened a small store and is hoping to stock it with inventory. He has been working in this sphere for over 5 years. However, he could make enough savings to open his own small store only this year. Currently, Sergei has about 60,000 grivnyas invested in merchandise. His monthly income amounts to 10,000 grivnyas.

Sergei is requesting a loan of 10,469 grivnyas to expand his new vending location. He has much experience working in the sphere of construction and remodeling, which helps him develop his business efficiently and consistently. Sergei is known as a hard worker with a very enterprising spirit. We believe the current loan will benefit his trade and help him expand it even further.

loans.use: To develop a new vending location

loans.name: Moe

texts.en:
After a seventeen-year career in industrial manufacturing, Moe wanted to change the course of his life by becoming his own boss and controlling his own destiny. He considered opening his own convenience store, running a gas station, and possibly opening a restaurant. Ultimately, he found a new career that finally put his computer and graphic design skills to use.
 
In 2006 Moe became the new owner of Stop Signs, Inc. “I make signs that go on buildings, road signs, and real estate signs. We do all kind of signs – illuminated and non-illuminated, including exterior channel letters. We cover the whole sign-making process from “concept to design to manufacturing.”
 
Business has been growing for Moe since 2006, but in the past year revenue has stabilized. “We’re not growing like we used to. But we’re surviving – we’re keeping our heads above water!” says Moe.
 
But this past summer, Moe’s most expensive piece of equipment – the lift truck he uses to install large outdoor signs on the sides of buildings – broke down. Moe went to his local bank for a loan and was turned down, but they referred him to Opportunity Fund, his local microfinance institution. A $10,000 loan will allow Moe to buy a new lift truck so that he can install his signs more quickly and more safely.
 
Moe’s dreams for his business are to continue serving his local community with quality designed signs and eventually to franchise Stop Signs, Inc. across the nation. “I am proud that I learned this business and became a master sign maker. It’s so different from what I used to do. But I’m great at it. We can handle any job and I am proud of the risk I took to pursue my dream to be my own boss!”

loans.use: To buy a lift truck to install the shop's large outdoor signs

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a 60 year old widow with eight children. Four of her children go to school. Norah also takes care of additional family members. She owns and lives in a four-room house with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day.  

Norah sells charcoal from her store in Naguru. She buys the charcoal locally so she doesn’t incur transportation costs. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala  She works seven days a week .She receives an average of 50 customers a day and sells both wholesale and retail to all types of people. 

Her most significant monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges is the rainy season which make it difficult for customers to reach her because she works in a muddy place. 

She has been in this business for twenty years and a member of MCDT for eight years. She is now borrowing her nineteenth loan. Norah joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She wants to see her business grower bigger and she wants to sell only in wholesale quantities.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Nicole

texts.en:
Nicole L. is from the village of Manabay Ozamiz City. She is 30 years old. Nicole is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Nicole owns & operates a business venture in food sector making and selling food. While not the only the means of generating revenue the only means of g selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Nicole has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.
gt
In 2009, Nicole joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicole has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nicole is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nicole from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Namwezi Development Group, Mukono

texts.en: N. Teopista is 35 years old and married with 6 children aged 20 – 4 years, all in school; she also takes care of her parents. Teopista has had a cosmetics shop in Kiwango – Namwezi for 1 year although her business is mostly affected by seasonal changes. From her shop, she is able to make 60,000/= as profits every week, and this has helped her to grow in addition to the loan. She hopes to expand her shop further as well as educating all her children to the university level. Teopista needs a loan to be able to restock her shop with more cosmetics so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: Buying more weaves, chemicals, and body lotions for her shop

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es una madre de familia de 53 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el caserío El Pueblito, distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde muy joven se ha ganado la vida dedicándose a la agricultura junto a su esposo. Ellos usualmente siembran maracuyá (planta frutal de la zona) y limón. Los frutos recolectados son vendidos a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona y eventualmente en el mercado de la ciudad de Olmos.

Actualmente han instalado cultivo de maracuyá en un terreno de una hectárea de extensión, el cultivo ya tiene 5 meses y es necesario brindarle mantenimiento para que la producción sea favorable. Natividad no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas.

Natividad es una mujer estimada y respetada por los vecinos de la zona en donde vive, ellos la consideran una mujer responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Natividad is a 53 year old mother who lives with her husband in the El Pueblito village in the Olmos district, located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has made a living farming alongside her husband, since she was very young. They usually plant “maracuyá” (a fruiting plant from the region) and limes. They harvest and sell the fruit to businesses who frequent the zone and in the marketplace in the city of Olmos. They have started raising maracuyá on a hectare extension of land. The crop is five months old and needs to be maintained so that it will yield a good harvest. Natividad does not have the necessary capital, so she is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN ($700) that she will invest in the purchase of fertilizer and pesticides. Natividad is a very well liked and respected woman in her zone. They consider her to be a very responsible, hard working person.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Nueva Generacion Iii Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”, actualmente se encuentra en el XIII ciclo y esta conformado por 12 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la distrito D. Cusco la provincia D. Cusco. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur D. país.

Las actividades económicas de los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo, venta productos secos, venta de alimentos, venta de comestibles y venta de comida  y otros brindan servicio de transportes.  El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

La socia Rosa forma parte D. banco comunal la “Nueva Generación” y las reuniones de los socios son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa.
Rosa tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos (L., Sheyla y Santos Ollantay), ella se levanta muy temprano para atender a su familia como por ejemplo prepara desayuno para sus hijos y los envía al colegio, después hacer sus actividades D. hogar su actividad comercial es la confección de ropa de lana de forma manual como por ejemplo, ella confecciona chompas para bebes recién nacidos. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella heredó el trabajo de sus padres. Rosa requiere el préstamo para comprar ovillos de lana, hilos, elásticos, botones y muchas cosas más.                   

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nueva Generacion III” (New Generation III) is currently in its thirteenth loan cycle and consists of twelve hardworking and enterprising individuals who view each moment as an opportunity to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to provide a better future for their children. The members of the Communal Bank live in the Province and Department of Cusco. Cusco is a city known for its archaeological sites, its Historical Center, its landscapes, and its history for being one of the most enchanting cities in the southern part of the country.

The business activities of the members include selling dry goods, snacks, groceries, food, or providing transportation services. The members indicate that the Communal Bank has participated in numerous loan cycles and that they are happy and satisfied with the loan services, savings, and training classes. One ongoing aspect of the Communal Bank that is of value is the group savings account that opens the possibility for building up assets, which is what this service provides.

Rosa is a member of the New Generation Communal Bank. She and the other members meet every 30 days at the central office of Asociación Arariwa. Rosa is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (L., Sheyla, and Santos Ollantay). She wakes up very early to attend to her family, such as preparing breakfast for her children and getting them ready for school. After taking care of her household activities, she engages in her business of making woolen clothing by hand. For example, she weaves sweaters for newborn infants. Rosa has been in this business for 15 years and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She inherited this business from her parents. Rosa needs a loan to buy balls of wool, thread, elastic, buttons, and other items.

The members, in general, are grateful for this opportunity and commit to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool, thread, elastic, buttons, and other items

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 36 years old and married with two children who attend school. He farms, growing vegetables and horticultural products for sale. He has been in this business for over 13 years. He has three employees to assist him with the business. 

Daniel has previously taken out a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Faulu Kenya which he used to expand his business. He hopes to open up a shop and improve his standard of living in the future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is a 42-year-old married man and father of 3 children. Two of his children are still school-aged. He has been working as a home electrician for the past 20 years. He offers electrical services to his village and its surroundings. He works on a freelance basis, upon the request of his clients. 

Today, Antoine is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new electrician tools and he is expecting to expand his business. He is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantial growth in the coming years as a result of the loan.

loans.use: To buy new electrician tools.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika tiene 35 años, casada y madre de 2 hijos, aún pequeños y juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado, por lo que tiene que alternar este trabajo con sus labores domesticas, es así que su actividad empieza ofreciendo su mercadería a sus amigos y demás vecinos de su barrio. Ella tiene varios clientes, que saben y conocen la calidad de prendas que ofrece y no dudan en comprarle. Disfruta mucho lo hace, y mas cuando deja el producto a crédito, por luego el pago sería más de lo que costó inicialmente.  Sin embargo, algunas veces perdió cuando alguno de sus clientes nunca le llegó a pagar. Por ahora tiene el propósito de continuar vendiendo sus prendas y aumentar sus rentas, ya que su gran anhelo es comprarse un puesto en el mercado donde pueda vender mucho más. Este es su onceavo crédito con MFP, por lo que seguirá siendo puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Asimismo en su grupo solidario es una compañera muy responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más prendas de vestir de exclusivos modelos, aquellos que tiene mayor demanda en el mercado.
texts.en:
Erika is 35 years old. She is married and is the mother of two children, who are still small. They live together in their own house.

For more than 3 years, she has sold clothing and shoes. Because she has to alternate this work with her household chores, she began this activity by offering her merchandise to her friends and other neighbors in her area. She has various customers, who know and recognize the quality of the goods that she offers and don't hesitate to buy from her. She very much enjoys what she does, even more when she sells on credit, because then the payment will be more than what it cost initially. Nevertheless, sometimes she loses when one of her customers never finishes paying her. For now, she intends to continue to sell her goods and increase her income, since her great wish is to buy a stall in the market where she could sell much more.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP, so she will continue being punctual with her payments. At the same time, she is a very responsible member of her community bank. With the loan that she is applying for, she will buy more clothing of exclusive styles, which have high demand in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Mrs. Hing H., 25 years old, has been growing rice crops since 1999, earning a formal income to support her family’s daily living expenses. She has a life partner in her husband, Doeuk, 24, who depends on the river and lakes where he always fishes to make a living. Married for two years, they have a lovely young child whom they plan to send to the primary school next year. Hing needs a loan to purchase a plot of her neighbor’s land upon which she  will grow crops for extra proceeds.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of her neighbor’s land.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann A. is from the village of Medina , Misamis oriental. She is 34 years old. Mary Ann is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling copras (coconut) in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mary Ann from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Doña Lorenza  tiene 44 años. Tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos mayor de edad. Ella vive sola con sus hijos, trabajando en sociedad con el mayor de ellos.
Se dedican a la compra y venta de artículos para el hogar, prendas para damas y caballeros, electrodomésticos varios, calzados deportivos y artículos varios de acuerdo a los pedidos que vayan recibiendo. 
Trabajan en esta actividad desde el año 2006, realizando sus ventas en zona del área metropolitana. 
 La Sra. Lorenza necesita de este crédito para la adquisición de artículos para la temporada de invierno, como edredones, frazadas, estufas y otros, pues la demanda de los mismos aumento y ella desea cumplir siempre con su clientela.
Su anhelo es poder concluir la construcción de su modesta vivienda ubicada en el barrio Calle`i de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo.
texts.en:
Lorenza, 44, has two children, one of whom is an adult. She lives alone with her children and works partnered with her oldest. They buy and sell articles for the home, women and men’s clothing, assorted home appliances, athletic shoes and various other articles depending on orders they receive. They have been in this line of work since 2006 and they make their sales in the metropolitan area. Lorenza needs funds to buy seasonal winter items like comforters, blankets, hot plates and others because demand for these items has increased and she always strives to meet customer demand. Her dream is to finish building her modest dwelling which is located in San Lorenzo’s Calle I neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hot plates, comforters, hypo-allergenic blankets, winter clothes for women and men.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Natividad es viuda y tuvo 8 hijos, actualmente vive soL., Natividad realiza diferentes negocios, tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, y en su puerta venD. caramelos, frutas para lo cual cuenta con un triciclo, su negocio esta ubicado cerca D. un colegio. Además Natividad viaja a las diferentes ferias D. L. región en donD. venD. pescado y ropa.
Natividad solicita un préstamo que será invertido en L. compra D. pescado y ropa.
Su sueño D. Natividad es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Natividad is a member of the Amor Divino community bank. She is a widow and has 8 children. She lives alone. Natividad operates various businesses. She has a store in her house where she sells general merchandise and candy. She has a pedal cycle that she uses for a fruit vending business. She often sells her merchandise at a local school. On top of all that, Natividad travels out to various market fairs in the region where she sells fish and clothing. Natividad is applying for a loan that she will use to buy fish and clothing. Her greatest hope is that she can one day make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Merlinda Jutba Group

texts.en:
Merlinda J. is from the village of Boundary Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Merlinda is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tundan 2.

Merlinda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlinda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food, such as rice cake "puto", babanacue, etc. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling breads to the local community. Merlinda is just starting this business.

In 2010, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Merlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: K. Djimido

texts.en: Djimido A. is 26 years old and lives in Lomé, Togo, where he works as a welder. His garage is located in the Akodessewa region of Lomé, and is called "Fafa Neva". Djimido has been in business since 2005. This is his first loan from Kiva partner, WAGES. He has requested 150,000 XOF in order to purchase gas and other supplies he uses to do his vehicle repairs.

loans.use: To purchase gas and supplies

loans.name: Kalomp Group

texts.en:
Meet with the members of the “Kalomp” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 600,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Kadiatu D. is the leader of this group. The forty-seven-year-old is married to a lecturer and they have three children.

Kadiatu is a businesswoman who sells palm-oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil) and rice, and has had many years of experience in business. With the help of this loan, she will buy bags of rice and gallons of palm-oil to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and gallons of palm-oil to add to her stock

loans.name: Surayya

texts.ru:
Surayya S. 52 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey, doch starshaya kotoroy 21 qod ona zakonchila universitet i vishla zamuj, doch 19 let ona uchitsya v universitete i zanimayetsya tancami, i sin 17 let kotoriy uchitsya v shkole i xochet stat doktorom v budushem. Surayya i eyo semya jivut v Fuzuli regione.

Surayya uje 6 let zanimayetsya etim biznesom prodaji odejdi. Etomu biznessu eyo nauchila podruqa, Seychas Surayya nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit odejdu dlya osenneqo sezona dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Surayya S. is fifty-two years old, married and has three children. They live in Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. Her oldest daughter is twenty-one years old; one year ago she finished college and got married. Her second daughter is nineteen, she's going to college and enjoys dancing. Her son is seventeen; he goes to school and aspires to become a doctor in the future. For six years Surayya has sold clothes, a trade she learned from a friend. Surayya is asking for a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy fall clothes for resale and expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en: Maryjane S. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old and is married with two infant children. Maryjane owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Maryjane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maryjane is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Remigia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES D. SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito D. Saylla en la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Remigia;  La socia tiene 58 años D. edad;  ella es casada  y tiene 4 hijos, La socia se dedica a la venta D. chicharrones desD. el año 2000, ella elabora este plato típico a base D. carne D. ovino, ella prepara los chicharrones acompañados con papas doradas y ensalada D. cebollas con hierba buena. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. carne D. ovino para la venta semanal D. chicharrones.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Remigia is a member of the Los Rosales D. Saylla Communal Bank.  This bank is situated in the Saylla district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Remigia, age 58, is married and has four children.  She has been selling “chicharrones” (fried pork rinds) since the year 2000.  She makes this typical dish from pork.  She makes the chicarrones accompanied with golden potatoes and a salad of onion and herbs.

She is requesting the loan to buy pork for her weekly sale of chicharrones.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means, and she pledges to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy pork for her weekly sale of chicharroes

loans.name: Digno

texts.es: El señor Digno tiene 62 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijas menores de edad. Su esposa es ama de casa, Digno se dedica a la venta de mariscos la cual distribuye de manera ambulante, pese que en su casa su esposa también le ayuda. El ya tiene 10 años de tener este negocio, pues surgió ante la necesidad de mantener a su familia, ya que para ese tiempo cuando inicio una cooperativa pesquera y así salía a vender sus diferentes productos.  Es por ello que decidió hacerse de un negocio para tener más ingresos y brindar más tiempo a su familia. El señor desea invertir este crédito en la compra de camarones, chuletas, pescados, punches entre otros. Su sueño siempre ha sido brindar más comodidades a su familia, establecer un negocio más grande y poder realizar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Mr. Digno is 62 years old, married, and has two young children. His wife is a homemaker and Digno sells seafood as a street vendor, though his wife also helps him from home. This business, which he has had for ten years, arose out of of the necessity to support his family.  Ten years ago, he started a fishing cooperative and then went out to sell his different products.  He decided to establish this business in order to bring in more income and to have more time with his family. Digno would like to invest this loan in the purchase of shrimp, filets, fish, crabs, and other seafood.  His dream has always been to offer his family greater comforts, to establish a larger business, and to be able to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, filets, fish, crabs, and other seafood

loans.name: Sadat

texts.en:
28-year-old Waiswa Sadat says his six-year ascendancy in his clothes, handbags, belts and shoes sales business all boils down to his incredible will power, diligence and an unwavering sense of determination.  

His first business source of livelihood was shoe hawking. It was after much soul searching and second thought that he decided he wanted to venture into a different business.  Shoe hawking is a business he found himself involved in after he got cash from selling a plot of land. He still runs it, though at a minimal level. 

About his marital status - Sadat says he is single, but with two kids.  About $31 is what totals up as weekly profits in his business transactions. He is requesting this loan to purchase more new clothes, handbags, belts and shoes for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of new clothes, handbags, belts and shoes for resale

loans.name: El Jardin (Flat) Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama El Jardín está localizado en la comunidad de Marcelino Rodríguez, Axochiapan, en el estado de Morelos, México, está conformado por 7 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, las integrantes del grupo son la señora Bibiana Hernández Hernández va a comprar con su préstamo refrescos, tortillas, pan, mayonesa, chiles, jamón, carnes, queso, etc. Par elaborar sus alimentos, la señora Florentina Hernández Hernández va a comprar refrescos, dulces, pan, jamón, maíz, verduras, tortillas, para preparar su comida para sus antojitos mexicanos, la señora Marcela M. P. va a comprar azúcar, aceite, detergente, sopas, refrescos, etc. Para surtir su negocio, la señora María Félix Martínez F. va a comprar algunas sabanas y colchas para surtir sus pedidos, la señora Gregoria Hernández G. va a comprar puercos vivos para matanza y vender la carne por kilo, la señora Paula Díaz M. va a comprar abono, esfoyares para la siembra, la señora Nora Díaz Mejía va a comprar telas, hilos, sierres, puntas, estambres para empezar con su negocio de taller de costura. La señora Nora Díaz Mejía es integrante del grupo El Jardín, ella tiene 37 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada su esposo es campesino, tienen 3 hijos Alejandro tiene 16 años estudia el 3er. Semestre del CECYTE, Fernanda tiene 14 años estudia el 3er. Año de secundaria y Rafael tiene 6 años estudia la primaria, ella tiene su taller de costura y solicito su préstamo para comprar telas, encajes, puntas, estambres, bies, hilos, pintura textil y va a comprar el uniforme de física de su hijo para el desfile del 20 de noviembre, ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años en la costura cuando tenía 17 años aprendió por medio de las brigadas que van enseñando en los pueblos cursos de costura y hace 10 años fueron del CECATEM a dar cursos de corte y pintura ella y sus hermanas asistieron a ese curso todas sus hermanas saben corte, su máquina de coser de motor se la compro su esposo y después poco a poquito compro las pinturas y las telas su negocio está en su casa en Marcelino Rodríguez, Axochiapan. Su negocio es importante porque puede ayudar un poco con los gastos de la casa y no le deja toda la carga a su esposo,  lo que más le gusta del negocio es cuando ve terminado su trabajo y lo ve bonito se siente estimulada a seguir haciendo las prendas y sabe que aunque es mujer puede valerse por sí misma, se siente orgullosa cuando sus hijos le dicen que le quedo bonito y que a su hija le nace la inquietud de ayudarle tiene sus servilletas que su hija va haciendo y ahorita que esta mas grande le quedan más bonitas, ella está orgullosa con su negocio porque lo que gana la saca de apuros el guardadito que puede hacer la saca de apuros, sus clientes son sus comadres, vecinas y conocidos y compañeros de sus hijos que les hace los vestidos para los bailables de la escuela como ropa de manta, sacos, pantalones, faldas de Adelita, blusas con bordados. Ahorita tiene aproximadamente como 10 clientes son pocos porque le va a ayudar a su mama en el puesto de antojitos Mexicanos hacen dobladitas, sopes y gorditas en las mañanas y los fines de semana en el mes de octubre, noviembre y diciembre es cuando hay más clientes en el puesto de su mama. su negocio enfrenta la competencia que hay más personas que se dedican a la costura pero para todos sale el sol siempre y cuando estemos trabajando y echándole ganas, con las ganancias compra algunas pinturas que se le van terminando, hilos, para alguna emergencia del hogar para doctor o para gastos de la escuela. Ella está planeando ampliar su negocio sacando unos trabajos de pintura textil con dibujos de navidad y ofreciéndolos por temporada de navidad como cojines, servilletas, cortinas, manteles. Marcelino Rodríguez es un pueblo que se formo con la gente que llegaba a trabajar a la Hacienda y se quedaba ya establecida, en esta hacienda era territorio de comercio de los antepasados hay restos de vasijas y piezas antiguas. Este negocio si le ha ayudado a su familia en lo económico en lo recreativo se entretiene realizando la pintura, las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda son abrir una puerta que dé a la calle y remodelar un cuartito que hay para su taller de costura y pintura, sus sueños son agrandar el negocio y tener una maquina industrial, las mejoras que desea lograr para el futuro de sus hijos son ayudarles a sostenerse en sus estudios para que tengan una profesión. La señora Nora se siente feliz y comprometida con este préstamo que le proporcionan por qué se va a surtir de sus materiales para la costura y la pintura y elaborar sus cojines, servilletas y cortinas decorados con dibujos de navidad y del niño Jesús de la Virgen María y de San José. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “que estamos  agradecidas con los apoyos que recibimos y que tengan la confianza en nosotros para crecer juntos”
texts.en:
This group is called El Jardín (The Garden) and is located in the community of Marcelino Rodríguez, Axochiapan in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It consists of seven female members who know each other and are neighbors. The members are Bibiana Hernández Hernández, who is planning to use her loan to purchase refreshments, tortillas, bread, mayonnaise, peppers, ham, meats, cheese, and other items to make her meals. Florentina Hernández Hernández plans to purchase refreshments, candies, bread, ham, corn, vegetables and tortillas to prepare her Mexican cuisine. Marcela M. P. plans to purchase sugar, oil, detergent, soups, refreshments and other items to stock her business. María Félix Martínez F. plans to purchase some sheets and bedspreads to fulfill her orders. Gregoria Hernández G. plans to purchase live pigs to butcher and sell meat by the kilo. Paula Díaz M. plans to purchase fertilizer for her crops. Nora Díaz Mejía plans to purchase fabrics, thread, zippers, yarn and other items for her seamstress business.
Nora is 37 years old and is a high school graduate. She is married and her husband comes from the country. They have three children: Alejandro is 16 years old and is in his third semester of college; Fernanda is 14 years old and is a junior in high school; and Rafael is 6 years old and in primary school. She has a sewing shop and is requesting the loan to purchase sewing supplies, and she also plans to buy a uniform for her son so he can march in the Nov. 20th parade. She started her business 20 years ago when she was 17 years old. She learned the craft from taking sewing courses in her village, and 10 years ago she and her sisters went to the local vocational school to take painting lessons. Now all her sisters also know how to paint. Her husband bought her a sewing machine and little by little she bought some paints and fabrics. She runs her business out of her home in Marcelino Rodríguez, Axochiapan. Her business is important because it allows her to help a little with household expenses and doesn't put everything on her husband. What she enjoys most about her work is when she finishes a job and it comes out beautiful, and she feels stimulated to keep making her garments. She knows that although she is a woman she can stand on her own, and she feels proud when her children tell her she does beautiful work. Her daughter has always been interested in helping her, and started making handkerchiefs. Now she keeps making them bigger and prettier. Nora's customers are her friends, neighbors, acquaintances and friends of her daughter, for whom she makes dresses for the school dances. Currently she has about 10 customers. It's a small amount because she is helping her mother at her food stand making Mexican cuisine in the mornings and on the weekends during the months of October, November and December, which is the busiest time of year for her mother's business. Nora's business has competition since there are a lot of people who make a living in sewing, but there is always a way to make money. With her profits she plans to buy some paintings, thread, and save some in case there is an emergency and her family needs a doctor or cover school expenses. She is planning to expand her business, taking out some textile painting jobs with Christmas themes as well as offering Christmas-themed cushions, handkerchiefs, curtains and table cloths. Marcelino Rodríguez is a village that was formed by plantation workers, and their pottery and antiques still remain. Nora's business has helped her family financially and she is able to paint in her spare time. Her biggest desire is to make improvements to her home by building a door opening up to the street and remodeling a room for her sewing and painting shop. Her dreams are to expand her business and have an industrial sewing machine. She wishes to be able to help provide for her children's education so they can become professionals. Nora feels happy and committed to this loan because she plans to stock up on sewing and painting supplies in order to make cushions, handkerchiefs and curtains with pictures of Christmas, Baby Jesus and the Virgin Mary.
The members of this group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad that "we are grateful for the support we are receiving and have confidence we will grow together."

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, lace, thread, textile paint and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
A home is undoubtedly important to everyone, including Evelyn R.. A desire for a house to call her own is something Evelyn is working hard to satisfy. Finishing only high school, Evelyn is ever determined to break people's low expectations of her. She is a CCT* community partner and is married to Oscar.  They live in Pasay City, Philippines.

Evelyn's home serves both as an abode of rest and a venue for business, because at her home she has set up a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. She sells a wide range of products to neighborhood people, including items from rice and noodles to detergent powder and soap bars. With this, Evelyn earns a net average of Php 3,000 per month.

To help her grow her business, Evelyn would like to apply for a Php 29,000 loan. Adding more products to her store is a priority for her if she wants to improve her business, and the money from the loan would certainly be used to purchase these additional products. She looks forward to making the store grow and eventually expand.

At present, Evelyn finds it hard to follow up with customers who do not pay their debts on time. But just like any other hardworking entrepreneur, Evelyn sees to it that no challenge will  ever wear her out. She dreams of having enough money to build their own house which they can truly call their home.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: purchase additional products for retail shop

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa R. is from the village of Naasag, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Marisa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marisa owns & operates a business providing pedicure & manicure services to local community members. Marisa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marisa is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for pedicures & manicures like nail polish. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for pedicures & manicures

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn O. is from the town of Sikatuna.  She is 33 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 4 children ages 13, 9, 8 and 2.  To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling mobile phone credit loads in the local community.  Jocelyn also started selling more products like sugar and coffee.  She hopes to acquire more products to sell.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing clothes

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de six femmes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux  dans le quartier Hèrèmakono Centre de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Deux d’entre elles font la restauration et les autres les commerces de Boissons non alcoolisées, de brochettes de viande, de céréales, des condiments alimentaires, etc.… 
Dans le souci d’avoir un fonds de commerce pour élargir leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour la deuxième fois dont le précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce  prêt Kadiatou S., compte acheter, une grande quantité de viande et des pains pour la préparation des brochettes, 7 cassiers de boisson BRAMALI et 10 paquets de boisons NBB. 
Elle s’approvisionne en viande auprès des bouchers au marché et en boissons au niveau des grossistes pour ensuite les revendre à la gare routière, en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composé généralement d’étranger de passage.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé dans les frais de santé et le reste réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA is comprised of six married women averaging 40 years of age and six children. The women live in nuclear families with their children and husbands in the Hèrèmakono Centre district of the city of BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship and community.  Two of them have restaurants, and the others do business in softdrinks, meat kebabs, grains, condiments, etc....  

Concerned about having the capital for expanding their businesses, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso a second time. The past loans have all been properly repaid.  

With this loan, Ms. Kadiatou S. intends to buy: a large quantity of meat and bread for making kebabs; 7 cases of the beverage BRAMAL; and 10 packs of the beverage NBB.  

The group members get their supplies of meat from the butchers at the market and their supplies of beverages from wholesale merchants. Then they resell their goods, accepting cash in retail sales, to a customer base composed generally of traveling foreigners at the bus station.  

Ms. Kadiatou S. plans on making a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be go toward healthcare costs. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for making kebabs

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has been living in Sahiwal for many years with her family in a 2-room brick house. Sahiwal is a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture and cattle farming. She is 37 years of age and has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Only one of her children is able to attend school and get an education. Her husband’s name is M. R. and he operates a wheat and rice-selling business. He uses his four-wheeled cart to sell to different areas of the community. 
 
Naseem herself is a seamstress. In order to help her husband financially, she sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very good in her work and receives regular orders every month. She is also a very good housewife and carries out her household responsibilities effectively. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will replace the old wheels of his cart with new wheels and continue operating his business.  Naseem is confident that an investment in her husband’s business will be a good step towards its growth and he will be able to provide better living conditions to the family as a result.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To replace the old wheels of their four-wheeled cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expansion and finishes to the exterior of his house

loans.name: Houssein

texts.ar: حسين في عمر 31 سنة اعزب يعمل في بيع الفحم له في عمله 5 سنوات يحب عمله يريد من خلال تطور العمل الى تأمين نفسه حتى يتمكن من بناء عائلة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء كمية كبيرة من الفحم للمحل يلقى صعوبة بعدم توفر السيولة لتطوير العمل له زبائن من الجيران والمحيط
texts.en: Houssein is 31 years old and unmarried. He works in the selling of coal and has been doing this for five years. He loves his business and through its development he hopes to attain financial security for himself so that he may settle down and start his own family. With this loan he wants to purchase a large amount of coal for his store. He faces difficulty due to the lack of support available for business development. His customers are his neighbours and people living locally.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of coal for his store

loans.name: Merly Pugoy Group

texts.en:
Merla is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban. She is 53 years old and is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default. 

Merla is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a business producing and selling food in her community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

On February 18, 2011 Merla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to do business. 

Merla is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: C4904 Amahoro Group

texts.en:
Elisabeth is 30 years old and she is single. She is the representative of a group called "Amahoro" in the local language. Elisabeth is the first person on the right in the picture. She owns a small shop that sells beans, sorghum and other goods. She has three years of experience. She employs eight persons in her business as helpers so that her business runs well.

Elisabeth and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more products like rice, cassava, breads, beans and so on.  With the profits, she will build a comfortable house. She also needs a refrigerator which will allow her to create a new business of selling cold soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase more products like rice, cassava, breads and beans to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 35 years old.  She has 5 children who are between the ages of 2 and 14.  She sells children and adult second-hand clothing at the market.  She has been selling clothes for 7 years and this business has helped her meet her and her family's needs.   It has also enabled her to build a small family house.  Gloria is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Зайнидинова Сайёра жительница района Вахдат. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Её муж занимается строительными работами по найму. Сама Сайёра уже 4 года как занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Целью кредита является закуп скота.
texts.en: Sayora Z. lives in Vahdat. She is 26 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a day laborer working in construction.  Sayora has been working in animal husbandry for four years.  She raises cattle for later sale. She is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Bo

texts.en: Bo, age 47, is married and lives with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She makes a living as a tailor, earning an income of $1.50 per day to help cover her family's expenses. Her husband is a farmer and earns about $3 per day. Their family's standard of living has improved since Bo and her husband opened their businesses. She is applying for a loan of $700 to buy a tuk-tuk (or motorized vehicle) for her husband to use to transport tourists to nearby temples. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorized vehicle to carry tourists to local temples.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 41-year-old gentleman; he and his wife Sarah have three children aged fourteen, eight, and four. He is a second-hand clothes dealer who has been in the business for six years, making a profit of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend; this will be his first loan. He plans to buy a bale of children's clothes because the demand is high. With the anticipated profit he plans to stock up and sell new clothes. 

In the future he hopes to be selling clothes in bales; he is a very hard working man.

loans.use: to buy a bale of childen clothes because they are bought quickly

loans.name: Tomas Rigoberto

texts.es:
El señor Tomas de 44 años de edad, es originario de La Ciudad de León, es soltero , de oficio sastre, se dedica a la confección de todo tipo de ropa. El inicio atraves de sus padres pues ellos eran sastres también , cuando el tenia 14 años de edad inicio como sastre , apoyando a su padre en el taller de costura , hace doce años es el quien se hace cargo de este negocio . Hoy en día la mayoría de sus clientes son los colegios, empresas privadas.
Solicito el préstamo para compra materia prima como telas al por mayor. Con esta inversión espera satisfacer la demanda que tiene. En sus planes futuros quiere darle una mejor presentación a su taller de costura, comprar mas maquinas de cocer y poner otro taller de costura.
texts.en:
Tomas, 44, is from the city of León.  He’s single and his occupation is Tailor.  He makes all kinds of clothes.  He stared as a tailor through his parents who were also tailors, when he was 14 years old helping his father in his shop.  He took over the shop twelve years ago.  Today, most of his customers are schools and private firms.

He asked for the loan to buy raw materials, like fabric, at wholesale.  With this investment he hopes to meet his customer demand.  In his future plans is improving his shop’s appearance, buying more sewing machines and setting up another tailor shop.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y su hermana, no tienen hijos y todos trabajan en la familia, él se dedica a la venta de sandia y a la agricultura, el negocio de sandia inicio por el apoyo de su hermana, no tiene un horario establecido para atender sus labores.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas y sandia para vender, está iniciando los cuidados de los cultivos por lo que necesita tener abono y fertilizantes, la compra le permitirá contar con los recursos necesarios, además de surtir el negocio de la sandia.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuertemente para comprarse su propia casa, dándole lo mejor a su familia y ofrecerles una mayor estabilidad.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and his sister.  They do not have children and everyone in the family works.  He works selling watermelons and in agriculture.  The watermelon business started with the help of his sister and doesn’t have a set work schedule.  

He is currently requesting the loan to buy agricultural additives and watermelons to sell.  He is beginning the care of the crops and thus needs to have manure and fertilizers.  The purchase of these will give him to have the necessary resources, as well as to stock the watermelon business.

His goal is to work hard to buy his own home, giving the best to his family and offering them greater stability.

loans.use: to invest in manure and fertilizers and also in watermelons to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells sugarcane, plantains and plastics at Takoradi in the western region of Ghana, which she has done for 7 years. Ekua anticipates expanding her business, and a loan will serve as additional income which will be added to her initial capital to  purchase more sugarcane to sell. Her business plan for the next few years to come is to build a shop where she can display varieties of fruits to sell.  

She is married and has four children. She has been through junior high school. Ekua’s husband is a driver. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

loans.use: to  purchase more sugarcane to sell.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita has two children and one of them is attending school. Pacita is widowed and 63 years old, but she can still work hard. 

She doesn't want to laze at home that is why she opened up a sari-sari (variety) store in front of her house. After doing her home chores, she manages her store and makes lists of groceries needed. This occupies her daily schedule. From this activity, she generates income from every retail item she sells. She has been engaged in this business for almost one year, and she now earns PHP 300 a day. She uses it for the family's daily consumption and for her child's education and allowance.

Pacita would like to keep improving her business. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads, soap and shampoo to sell in her sari-sari store. With these grocery items, she will increase the volume of sales from her business. 

Pacita hopes to see her small store grow into a bigger one.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads, soap, and shampoo to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mario Ruben

texts.es:
Mario Ruben tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero vive con los padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo Recinto San Jacinto Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales.

Mario se dedica al cultivo de maíz, cacao, plátano, naranja y crianza de animales. Compra el productos en mayoria y vende sus productos en el mercado de Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos, semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, urea y otro tipo de abonos y líquidos para evitar la plaga en los cultivos para mantener los productos en buenas condiciones y compra de comida para los animales que tiene para la crianza para lo posterior venderlos en un mejor precio. 

El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad del producto y sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es poderse comprar una finca para poder sembrar un poco más para obtener mayores 
utilidades para el bienestar de la familia.

Se caracteriza por ser un hombre tranquilo, honrado y muy responsable, puntual en los pagos, le gusta salir a pasear  y le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Mario Ruben is 30 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolivar.

The communal bank San Jacinto is located in the San José del Tambo parish, San Jacinto region, belonging to the Chillanes canton. The members of this bank devote themselves to agriculture, mainly growing corn, cocoa, bananas and oranges, and practicing animal husbandry.

Mario devotes himself to growing corn, cocoa, bananas and oranges, and to animal husbandry. The producer buys his supplies wholesale and sells his products at the Chillanes market.

He is seeking the loan for the purchase of compost, seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea and other types of fertilizers and liquids to prevent infestations and diseases in the crops and keep the products in good condition, and to buy feed for the animals that he raises in order to sell them later at a better price.

The loan will provide him support in meeting his financial needs and improving the quality of the product and his agricultural activities. He faces challenges such as falling prices for the products he sells, as well as the middlemen. His dream is to be able to buy a farm so he may plant a little more in order to make better profits for the well-being of his family.

He characterizes himself as an easygoing man, honorable and very responsible, prompt with his payments. He likes to go out and enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase compost, seeds, supplies, fertilizers, urea and other types of fertilizers and liquids and to buy feed for the animals

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita D. 43 años D. edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. Mochumí que pertenece al departamento D. Lambayeque.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Anita desD. hace 3 años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales D. corral (ovejas y cerdos), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles  para la compra D. alimento balanceado y realizar algunos arreglos D. su corral para sus animales, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta D. sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad D. vida.  Anita es una persona que con esfuerzo, empeño y trabajo ha sabido sacar adelante a su familia, brindándoles otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Anita is 43 years old.  She lives with her family in her own home, which does not have electricity or running water.  It is located in the rural area of the Mochumí district, which is part of the Lambayeque department.  This area focuses on agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

For the last three years, Anita has been working raising and selling farmyard animals (sheep and pigs).  Her farmyard is located right behind her house, and is a suitable size and condition.  She feeds them with a balanced diet and natural grass, so that her animals will reach an optimum size for sale in the different area markets, and she will get good earnings to cover her family's expenses.

She has requested a loan of 2,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of balanced animal feed, and to make several repairs to her animals' farmyard.  With the earnings she will get from the sale of her animals, she will be able to cover her loan, as well as have a better quality of life.

Anita is a person who has known how to mover her family ahead with effort, determination, and hard work, providing them with further opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed and make some repairs to her animals' farmyard.

loans.name: Ricardo Salomon

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo tiene 46 años y es soltero. Sus padres son los pioneros en la fabricación de arpas y guitarras  la ciudad. Fue así que desde pequeño tuvo conocimiento en el rubro mediante la ayuda de sus padres, ya que ellos le inculcaron como hacer esos hermosos instrumentos.
Hace aproximadamente 10 años abrió su propio local de ventas. En adelante quiere seguir ampliando su stock para así poder tener mayor clientela y también ganancias. Comenta que gracias a su trabajo y dedicación logra generar los ingresos necesarios para la manutención de su familia.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas y clavijos, los cuales son los materiales esenciales para la fabricación de los instrumentos que vende. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 46 years old and single. His parents are pioneers in the manufacture of harps and guitars in the city of Luque, Paraguay. He was instructed  from childhood in the business by his parents, who taught him how to make these beautiful instruments.

Ricardo opened his own retail outlet approximately ten years ago. Looking ahead, he wants to expand his stock in order to attract more customers and increase profits. He says that through his work and dedication he is able to generate the revenue needed to support his family.

The requested loan is intended for the purchase of wood and pins, which are essential materials for the manufacture of these instruments. Ricardo is grateful to Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity provided.  Obtaining a loan will help him a great deal.

loans.use: to buy wood and pegs for musical instruments.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is a widow and has four children. She sells raw rice by moving from one area to another in Elmina, a business which she has run for some time now. In the picture, the container in Adjoa's hand is a measuring cup which she uses to measure the rice. 
Adjoa is going to use her loan to purchase bags of rice to retail. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice to retail.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 67 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 6 children. 
Pacita has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan  of 14,900 to purchase 10 sacks of feeds for her hog fattening business . 
Pacita has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Pacita hopes to have a big piggery.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of feed for her hog fattening business

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
El Sr. Cecilio es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa,  se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos en varias zonas esa ciudad. Gracias a sus servicios varias familias pueden contar con electrodomésticos, como televisores, equipos de sonido, heladeras, etc, pues él se adapta, dentro de lo posible, a la situación de los clientes, en varios casos financiando sus productos.
 Cecilio, en su recorrido diario con la compañía de su esposa, visita periódicamente a sus clientes, que son ya un número importante. 
El solicita el crédito para la compra de heladeras, televisores u otros electrodomésticos.  Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya la oportunidad, por el impulso a su emprendimiento, ya que de esa forma puede ofrecer sus servicios a más personas.
texts.en:
Cecilio’s from the city of Villa Elisa; he sells home appliances in several of the city’s neighborhoods.  Thanks to his services several families are able to have home appliances like television sets, sound systems, refrigerators, etc. because he adapts as much as possible to the customer’s needs and in several cases finances their products.

On his daily journey accompanied by his wife, Cecilio visits his customers periodically since they are now quite a large number.  He’s asking for the loan to buy refrigerators, television sets and other home appliances.  He thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity, the impulse to his enterprise, since he’s able this way to offer his services to more people.

loans.use: to buy refrigerators, television sets and other home appliances.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy, tiene 28 años de edad, tiene una niña de 4 años la misma que está siendo criada  solo por ella; ya que su pareja la abandonó cuando ella quedo embarazada, y no se quiso hacer cargo de ella, entonces fue que su hermano de nuestra clienta le ayudó a poner una venta de barrio para que este sea su medio de ingresos tanto de ella como de la niña que estaba esperando, ya son poco  más de 4 años que tiene este negocio(venta o pulpería de barrio), la misma que al inicio la  puso con la ayuda de su hermano mayor, que es como su padre ya que ella quedó  huérfana desde sus 3 años de edad, y su hermano fue quien se hizo cargo de ella.
Ésta tienda o pulpería se encuentra ubicada un una buena zona donde existe  bastante afluencia de personas, y no hay otra cerca que pueda ser su competencia y la señora Nancy, necesita de un capital de operaciones para poder compra más mercadería y poder surtir su venta para mejorar  la misma,  esto con mucha más razón porque se acercan fechas festivas de fin de año y existe mayor demanda de bebidas en general y por tanto  esto  incrementaran sus ventas.
Es por este motivo  y de acuerdo a su necesidad de nuestra clienta que se le ha dado la oportunidad de que pueda acceder a un credito, el mismo que le ayudará a mejorar su fuente de ingreso y calidad de vida, tanto de ella como de su niña.
texts.en:
Nancy, 28, has a 4-year-old girl who she is raising alone because her partner abandoned her when she became pregnant and did not want to take responsibility for her.  It was then that our client’s brother helped her set up a neighborhood grocery store so that she’d have a source of income for herself and the little girl she was expecting.  It’s now been a little more than four years that she’s had this business (neighborhood grocery store) which she initially opened with help from her older brother who is like a father to her since she was orphaned at the age of three and her brother took over caring for her.

This store or grocery store is located in a good zone where there is a large number of people and no other nearby to be competition for her.   Nancy needs working capital to buy more merchandise to better stock it.  This is even more true now that the end of year festivities are approaching and demand for beverages in general increases and therefore so do sales.

Because of this and according to her need, our client has been given the opportunity to access a loan that will help her improve her source of income and quality of life both for her and for her little girl.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Raghida

texts.en:
Raghida is a 31-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children, who are still attending school. She has been working in producing homemade food for the past seven years. She works upon customer’s demands. As for the heavy costs of life, Raghida joins forces with her husband in order to cover at least the mandatory expenses. 

Today, Raghida is asking to borrow $800 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to pay her children’s educationA. school fees. In the future, she plans to open her own restaurant and hopes to be able to generate good profits in order to better support her family.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational school fees.

loans.name: Joaquin Guillermo

texts.es: El señor Joaquín a sus 45 años de edad es padre de dos hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad, se dedica al transporte de animales como cerdos, vacas y terneros en su propio camión. Esta labor, el señor Joaquín la realiza desde hace 6 años a diferentes clientes fijos que se localizan en un lugar de la ciudad de Medellín llamado Feria de Ganado, en este sitio, se reúnen vendedores y compradores de ganado, a los cuales el señor Joaquín les transporta los animales. El señor Joaquín necesita realizarle a su camión mantenimiento, esto debido a la orina del ganado ha deteriorado el piso de la parte de atrás del vehículo del señor Joaquín. El señor Joaquín sueña con tener otro camión y en este poder generar empleos directos y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Joaquín, who is 45 years old, is the father of two children, who are 18 and 14 years old. His work is transporting animals such as pigs, cows, and calves in his own truck. He has been doing this work for 6 years for various regular customers who are located in the part of the city of Medellin called Feria de Ganado. In this area, buyers and sellers of livestock meet, and Sr. Joaquin transports their animals. Sr. Joaquin needs to do some maintenance on his truck, due to the animal urine that has deteriorated the floor in the back part of the vehicle. Sr. Joaquin dreams of having another truck and in this way generating jobs and offering his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his work vehicle

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es: Luis, necesita comprar nueva mercadería para su negocio, por eso está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para invertirlo en ropa de cama como cubrecamas, almohadas, sábanas, cortinas, con la intención de mejorar y crecer en el negocio, para ofrecer a los clientes diversidad de productos con nuevos colores que le permita mejorar sus ingresos. Él espera que este nuevo préstamo sea como el anterior que le dé la oportunidad de mejorar el negocio y poder mantenerse en el comercio.
texts.en:
Luis needs to buy new merchandise for his business. Because of this, he is asking for another loan to put towards bedding like bedspreads, pillows, sheets, and drapes, with the aim of improving and expanding his business. 

He wants to offer clients a variety of products in new colors, which will allow him to raise his income. He hopes that this new loan will be like the last one, which gave him the opportunity to improve his trade and the ability to stay in business.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, pillows, sheets, and drapes.

loans.name: Eliseo De Jesús

texts.es: Eliseo de Jesús de veintiocho años de edad vive con sus hijos en casa propia. El posee una panadería donde vende todo tipo de pan dulce y pan salado,  es un buen negocio y últimamente ha tenido mucha demanda, pues el pan que vende es muy rico, de buena calidad y a precio accesible, además el servicio es excelente siempre recibe a su clientela con una sonrisa en el rostro; Eliseo es muy carismático y trabajador  siempre está dispuesto a aprovechar sus oportunidades , el piensa que hay que fijar los ojos hacia adelante para estar siempre fijos en el futuro que queremos alcanzar, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, azúcar,  levadura, gas propano, bandejas etc. Eliseo de Jesús tiene la confianza que con su arduo trabajo lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Eliseo de Jesús is 28 years old and lives with his children in their own house. He has a bakery where he sells all types of sweet and savory breads. It is a good business and lately he has had a great deal of demand because his bread is very delicious, high-quality, and accessibly priced.
