His service is also excellent -- he always receives his customers with a smile on his face. Eliseo is very charismatic and hard-working and he is always ready to take advantage of opportunities. He thinks that we must always keep our eyes fixed ahead in order to stay focused on the future we want to achieve. This is why he asked INTEGRAL for a loan to buy flour wholesale, as well as sugar, yeast, propane gas, trays, etc. Eliseo de Jesús is confident that with his hard work, he will succeed at providing his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale, as well as sugar, yeast, propane gas and trays

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa, tiene 42 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa, es madre de 3 hijos, es casada, en el corto tiempo que tiene como socia de Finca ha visto su progreso, su mercadería ha aumentado, las capacitaciones le ayudaron a poder valorarse y a esforzarse para seguir adelante, le gusta porque no solo recibe  crédito sino también le ayudan a que sus negocio crezca.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropas para fin de año.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Sonrisa (Smile) Communal Bank. She is 42 years old and sells clothes. She is the mother of 3 children and married. In the brief time she’s been a member of Finca she has seen progress, and her merchandise has increased. The trainings have helped her to be able to value herself and to work hard in order to get ahead. She enjoys it because she not only gets a loan but they also help her so that her business grows. 

She will invest the loan she’s asking for into the purchase of clothes for the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Harlin Jose

texts.es: Harlin de 31 años de edad, tiene 6 años  de trabajar como docente para el Ministerio de Educacion,  solicita su 2do crédito para levantar dos paredes  que están en mal estado y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones en su hogar y darle mas valor a la  propiedad, segun sus compañeros de trabajo es bien responsable, honesto y muy trabajador, su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia goze de salud, amor y paz que es lo mas importante en la vida como tambien mejorar sus condiciones de vida, tener un trabajo digno bien remunerado y seguir estudiando .
texts.en: Harlin, 31, has been working for the Ministry of Education as a Teacher for six years.  He’s asking for his second loan to erect two walls that are in poor shape so that he can have better living conditions at home and increase his property’s value.  According to his coworkers, he’s quite responsible, honest and very hardworking.  His greatest dream in life is that his family enjoys good health, love and peace which are the most important things in life as well as to improve his living conditions, to have a well-paid, dignified job and to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to erect two walls.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is a married man with six children, five of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 21 years, he has operated a retail shop, selling household products to his neighbors. He also owns livestock and sells milk as another source of income. Katana dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 he wants to pay school fees and purchase textbooks for his child. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to pay school fees and purchase textbooks for his child.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man, aged 34 years, with five children and also looking after his ailing mother.
James lives in a rural area with his family. He deals in cattle trade. He also does agriculture as a side business and started his business in 2006.
He works 7 days in a week and 14 hours per day. He started his business to increase on his family income and to provide better standards of living to his family members. He is acquiring this loan to buy more cows for fattening and his clients are cattle traders from cities.
His hope for the future is to increase on his stock and to educate his children and the challenge he faces is cattle diseases which leads to death of cows which later reduce on the profits he earns. He is grateful for the services lenders offer that enable people to develop as well as developing their communities.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman. She describes herself as God-fearing.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KHS 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing.

loans.name: Santa De Jesus

texts.en:
My name is Santa de Jesus A. and I sell groceries. I have had me business for 5 years and I have the help of my son to attend to customers. I have many clients and I maintain a wide variety of products at reasonable prices. My business generates earnings that help to support my family and my goal is to expand my inventory in order to have a wider variety of products and a larger quantity of those I already carry. With the additional earnings I will remodel my home and help with my childrens\' education.

Mi nombre es Santa de Jesus A. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la atencion de mis clientes, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mantengo una buena variedad de productos y los precios son accesibles, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para poder tener mas variedad de productos y mayor existencia de los mismos, y con las ganancias que genere remodelar mi casa de habitacion y darle un buen estudio a mi hijo.

loans.use:
To purchase cereals, butter, sugar, coffee, rice, confectionaries, sanitary napkins, sodas, toilet paper, batteries, erasers, pencils, churros, toothpaste, pills, vegetables, soap for the body and laundry detergent, sweet bread, spices, salt, water and jams.

Compra de cereal, mantequilla, azucar, cafe, arroz, confites, toallas sanitarias, refrescos, papel higienico, baterias, borradores, lapices, churros, pasta dental, pastillas, vegetales, jabon de baño, jabon para lavar ropa, pan dulce, especias, sal, agua, jarabes.

loans.name: Tulagamua

texts.en: Tulagamua F. is a married woman who has 2 children. She is 43 years of age. She is a member of the Utulaelae Centre. She is currently on her fourth loan. Her first loan was used to establish her banana chip shop.  The second, third and fourth loan were used to set up a cattle farm. Mrs. F. was jobless and had no businesses before she joined SPBD. With the help of SPBD she now owns several businesses. She requests further loans to purchase additional cattle and expand her plantation business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cattle

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.en:
Mr. Eleuterio is married and has 7 children, one of whole died of a cerebral accident. Before, Eleuterio worked as a chauffer for a company, but when the company had to downsize, he was let go. So, he decided to set up his own business selling packagings in order to provide for his family. His sons help out with the business and together they have been able to promote the business that started in 1991. They started with few savings but now the business sells a variety of goods.

Eleuterio is asking for a loan of $475 that will be used to buy merchandise needed to cover the needs of his clients, in order to keep them satisfied. He will repay the loan in 6- 12 months. In your hands you have the ability to help this family. Help Eleuterio and his family - your contribution is greatly appreciated by them.

El señor Eleuterio es casado y tuvo siete hijos, uno de ellos falleció por derrame cerebral. Anteriormente Eleuterio trabajaba de chofer en una empresa, pero por recorte de personal quedo desempleado, así fue como decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes para poder obtener los recursos que necesita su familia, en el negocio recibe la ayuda de uno de sus hijos y juntos han logado sacarlo adelante desde 1991 que iniciaron, empezaron con pocos ahorros y la liquidación de su anterior trabajo, pero ahora han incrementado la variedad de productos que ofrecen.

En estos momentos Eleuterio solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y contar con su preferencia, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a ayudar a Eleuterio y su familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed is only 19 years old, but has already been running his own business for several years. He is married and has 2 children, one whom is newly born. He and his family live away from his parents. He has no regular work and trading is his only source of income. He sells an assortment of men's wear and shoes. He buys goods from the wholesale market in Istaravshan and sells them in markets located in his region. He has been a client of Microinvest for 1.5 years.

He spent his first loan on purchasing a new assortment of summer shoes for his business, which he says gave an immense boost to his business and brought a good profit.

He now hopes to expand even more and for this purpose, has requested a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Mrs. Magdalene F. a 30 year old married woman with two (2) children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She purchases yams, garri, bush meat and river fish from the village market and supplies them to retailers. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $625 to enable her to improve her business. She is a LAPO client and has been in this business since 1998.

loans.use: To buy more yams, garri, bush meat, and river fish

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha M. C. has a general store, which she was able to establish thanks to the help of her sister who lends her the locale. Martha has two children and her husband is also a merchant. Martha decided to start her business because her husband's income was only enough to pay the household expenses and to eat. However, Martha strongly believes that education is the basis of success, and so she opened her general store to pay for her children's education.

Currently, her daughter is in nursing school, a very nice profession. However, the cost of her school and the high school in which her son is studying is very high, so a portion of her income goes directly to these expenses, and the inventory of her store is affected by these expenses.

Thus, Martha is requesting a loan of US $925, to be paid over a 6-month period, to be able to buy more merchandise to sell in her store and to expand the locale so her clients can find everything better organized. With your help you will make it possible for Martha's daughter to become a good nurse and for her son to finish high school. Thank you!

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Martha M. C., tiene una tienda de abarrotes, que logró poner gracias a la ayuda de su hermana que le presta el local. Martha tiene con dos hijos, y su esposo es también es comerciante. La Manera en que Martha decidió iniciar el negocio es porque lo que gana su esposo sólo alcanzaba para pagar los gastos del hogar y para comer. Sin embargo Martha cree fielmente que el estudio es la base de la superación, por lo tanto, ella abrió tu tienda de abarrotes para pagarle los estudios a sus hijos. Actualmente su hija está estudiando enfermería, una profesión muy bonita, sin embargo los gastos de su escuela y de la preparatoria que está estudiando su hijo son muy altos, por lo tanto mucha parte de las ganancias que recibe se van directo a los gastos de los hijos, y el surtido de la tienda se ve afectado en los gastos.

Por lo tanto Martha está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses para poder comprar más mercancía para vender en su tienda. Y ampliar el local para que sus clientes encuentren todo más ordenado. Con tu ayuda lograrás a que la hija de Martha pueda ser una enfermera de bien, y su hijo pueda terminar la preparatoria. ¡Gracias!

loans.use: Expand her locale and buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en: Nani D. is 34 years old and has a 10-year-old child. She sells household goods such as cooking oil, rice, eggs, and kerosene in her small shop. Her husband, Odih, has no regular income. She usually earns $7 per day. She is requesting a loan of $75 so she can improve her stock and earn more income. Nani is a member of MBK and is will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to fill her shop

loans.name: Aminjon

texts.ru:
Aminjon A., who is 31, has a high school education, is married, and has 4 children. Aminjon is in the business of selling children's toys and hair accessories, mirrors, and food products. For this purpose, he has a store that he built inside of his house, located in the village of Novobod, in the Yavan region. Using funds from the loan, he plans to increase the assortment of his inventory. His main customers are children and their parents from his village and the surrounding areas. This loan will help local residents to purchase toys, hair clips, and mirrors for girls along with other goods necessary for their homes. At the same time, they will not need to commute to the center of the region and will be able to purchase the products at a location near their homes. Aminion is planning to pay off the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Азимов Аминджон, возраст – 31 год, образование среднее, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Аминчон занимается продажей детских игрушек, женских детских заколок, зеркалец, женских ободков, а также продуктов питания. Для этого он имеет небольшой магазин, который он построил у себя в доме, находящегося в махале Навобод, Яванского района. На полученный кредит он планирует увеличить ассортимент товара. Основными его покупателятми являются дети кишлака Навобод, а также близлежащих районов, а также их родители. Данный кредит поможет местным жителям приобретать необходимые игрушки для своих детей, заколки и зеркальца для девочек, а также других вещей необходимых для хозяйстива. При этом им не надо будет ездить для этого в центр района или города, они могут будут купить это рядом со своим домом. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Djamila

texts.en: Djamila (her husband is pictured), born in 1971, is the mother of two children. The Mutallimov family lives in Khachmaz town. They started this business 2 years ago and now need a loan of $850 to buy additional medicines.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina A. is 45-year-old wife and mother living in Kanibadam, Tajikistan. She earns a living by selling clothing, shoes, toys, baby carriages, and other goods in a local market.

Tahmina's husband supports her decision to work. Through her dedication, her business is flourishing. Now she hopes to expand her business with a loan of $675 U.S. dollars. Because she has an excellent credit history, she is confident that she will be able to pay back the loan within a year. Tahima promises to invest the money wisely and thanks everyone for trusting and supporting her.

loans.use: To buy more clothing, toys, and other goods for a local store

loans.name: Ni Wayan Wenji

texts.id:
Mekepung is one of Balinese traditional sport where two bulls race as a team against the others. Wayan Wenji is raising bull for Mekepung events. Wenji's bull business is quite successful as her bulls are favored by the local community in their neighborhood at Jembrana.

There are customers who rent for Wenji's bulls for Mekepung event. In a 6 month period Wenji can earn rent money of IDR 500 thousand (around USD 55). Wenji's bulls win Mekepung quite often. Usually once the bulls are old enough to be sold, Wenji can sell them for IDR 10 million (around USD 1,100).

She uses the money to finance her family daily needs and also to buy another bull to be raised as racers.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Tradisi Bali yang sudah lasim didengar ialah kata mekepung.Langsung teringat dengan kerbau.Artinya sepasang kerbau yang kuat lari untuk bisa memenagkan lawan lainnya.Wayan Wenji menjadikan kerbau peliharaannya bibit yang bisa dipakai untuk mekepung.Wenji menjadikan Usaha yang sangat maju.Karena Kerbau penggemukan yang dipelihara sangat banyak diminati oleh masyarakat jembrana.Setiap harinya kebau peliharaannya diberimakan rumput gajah.Juga diberi dedak.pada siang hari biasanya 2 kerbau diajak ketempat kali dibelakang rumahnya.agar tidak kepanasan.Wenji dan suami saling bantu dalam usaha ini.Dalam 6 bulan biasanya,ada saja yang menyewa kerbau ini,untuk dibawa lomba.kerap kali menang dan disewa Rp.500.000.-Biasanya bila sudah besar kerbau ini sudah ada yang mesan dan dibeli dengan Harga Rp,10.000.000. Keuntungan yang diterima biasanya dugunakan untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari dan untuk membeli bibit lagi.untuk kedepannya Wenji ingin bisa memelihara lebih banyak agar bisa mendapat keuntungan yang lebih.

loans.use: To buy bull feed (Membeli pakan)

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Some months ago, we began building a room. However, we've had some expenses and we can't finish it. We're applying for an $800 loan to finish the room because the house is rather small and there's not enough room for the kids.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hace algunos meses empezamos la construcción de un cuarto. Pero hemos tenido algunos gastos y no podemos terminarlo. Solicitamos un préstamo de $ 800.00 dlls. Para la terminación de un cuarto ya que la casa es algo chica y no hay suficiente espacio para los niños.

loans.use: Finish room.

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo A. sells drinks and containers of water. This is a skill that she acquired one year aso, and she has been in this business since the year 2005. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She has been a leader in a lending group for the past one year. She lives at Isheri Olofin, a river area in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is asking for a loan of $525 to buy more drinks and containers of water for sales.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and water for sales.

loans.name: Jhony Alfredo

texts.es:
Jhony is a young man with a desire to get ahead. Sadly, he suffered harvest losses and now he must take on odd jobs in order to improve his economic situation and overcome his misfortune. Anytime someone needs a carpenter, plumber, painter, etc. Jhony is there to fix his neighbors' problems and solve his own financial woes. In order to improve his situation and purchase tools for his work, Jhony is requesting your support and he promises to fulfill his obligation.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Jhony es un joven con muchos deseos de superación, lamentablemente sufrió pérdidas en sus cosechas y ahora le toca asumir trabajos diversos para mejorar su situación económica y superar los momentos de pérdida. Cada vez que alguna persona necesita un carpintero, un gasfitero, un pintor, etc. Jhony está allí solucionando los problemas de sus vecinos y solucionando su propio problema económico. Para reflotar su situación y comprar implementos para seguir brindando sus servicios Jhony pide un apoyo que promete no defraudar.

loans.use: An injection of capital in order to continue to provide services.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia Saimon, a Tanzanian business woman for 3 years, has been selling soft drinks in the Lumo area in Dar-es-Salaam. She purchases the CocaCola and Pepsi soft drinks wholesale, and then sells the soda to her customers.

The profits from the business enable Theresia to feed her four children and pay the children's school fees. She requests a loan of $550 to purchase more soda to sell to increase her profits.

loans.use: Purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Modzinou

texts.fr: Modzinou A. est âgé de 26 ans, marié et mère d’un enfant. Modzinou réside à Danyi, un village situé à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il cultive le jardin des choux qu’elle revend après la récolte. Le revenu généré par son activité étant toujours maigre, Il désire, par cette chance de kiva, accroître la taille de son activité pour une production en quantité plus importante permettant d’avoir un rendement meilleur. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge une partie des besoins de son foyer.
texts.en:
Modzinou A. is 26 years old, married, and the father of one child. Modzinou resides in Danyi, a village located about 170 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He cultivates a garden of cabbages, which he resells after harvesting them. Since the income generated by his work is always meager, he would like to use this opportunity from Kiva to increase the size of his business in terms of more significant production, allowing for a better return. The profits derived from his business will enable him to take on part of his household needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his arable land

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: El señor Ramón P. de León tiene 52 años y está casado con la señora Yolanda Aguilera, juntos tienen un despensa que lograron montar a lo largo de los años, los dos se dedican a trabajar en su negocio, el señor Ramón es el encargado de ir de compras en el mercado o en el Brasil y ella se dedica a la atención de los clientes  que son muchos en el barrio.  Este es su primer préstamo con Fundación Paraguaya, sin embargo está muy contento por la oportunidad de crédito que se le ha otorgado. Con el dinero ella planifica traer otros artículos y así aumentar su stock. Además, el espera tener otros créditos con la institución.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramón P. de León is 52 years old, married to Mrs. Yolanda Aguilera. Together they have a convenience store that they opened years ago. Both work in the business. Ramón is in charge of going shopping in the market or in Brazil and she is in charge of attending to the customers, who are numerous in the neighborhood. This is his first loan with Fundación Paraguaya, and he is very happy for the opportunity for the loan he has received. With the money he plans to bring other items and increase their stock. In addition, he hopes to have other loans in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for the store

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. Sok M., 35, motorcycle taxi driver who makes around $5 per day. Sok is single and lives in Kbal Spean Village, Poi Pet Commune, Banteay Meanchey Province. In order to enlarge his existing business, Sok now asks for a loan of $400 to purchase a new motorcycle instead his old. Sok hope that the loan will be able to generate more income for his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle instead his old

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille F. is 42 years old and married with two children (seven and four years old). She is an active member of Coastal View Center, MFI group of Paglaum MPC and resides at Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Lucille’s husband works as a Security Guard at Cebu City. To supplement her husband’s income, Lucille engages in buying  “Lahoy,” a shark fish. She extracts the liver into a squalene oil, and dries the meat. She sells the squalene oil to the manufacturer of squalene oil and the dried meat to their neighbors or to the market.

Lucille is now on her sixth loan, but she has no record of lapses in terms of loan repayments. We consider her  a member in good standing (MIGS). She applied for a loan amounting to Php 20,000.00. This is mainly for the additional capital for the purchase of “lahoy”. Lucille estimates that this planned investment will have a margin of return of 35% of its total capitalization.

Lucille aspires always that her business will grow, eventually increasing her market and her income as well. That would help her lift her family’s standard of living, and she can support her children to complete their chosen field of education.

loans.use: Purchase of "Lahoy" shark from fisherman's catch

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 37 años, es soltera, vive con sus hijos Cristian de 11 y Luz Rosario de 2 añitos. Es una mujer muy empeñosa, se dedica desde hace 6 años, a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria. Lo que le gusta a Yolanda de su trabajo es la libertad que le brinda, ya que puede decidir en qué horario vender y a qué horas retirarse, sin un jefe del cual depender. Pero la abundancia de clientes que esperan por deleitarse con sus ricos platillos es a veces es muy numeroso, y no puede abastecerse para atenderlos a todos, aún así, Yolanda sabe que esto es señal de que está progresando y es por eso que quiere expandir su negocio. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita Yolanda comprará algunas sillas, utensilios de cocina; como platos cucharas, cucharones, etc., para mejorar la atención en su pequeño puesto.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 37, single, and lives with her children Christian, 11, and Luz Rosario, 2. She is a very hard-working woman, and for the past six years she has made her living as a street vendor selling food. What Yolanda likes about her work is the freedom it allows her, since she can say when she works and when she doesn’t, without having to answer to a boss. But sometimes there are so many customers waiting to enjoy her delicious food that she does not have enough to feed them all. Even so, Yolanda takes this as a sign that she is advancing, which is why she wants to expand her business. This will be her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She plans to use the money to purchase some chairs, along with kitchen implements including plates, spoons, ladles, etc., so she can improve her small stand.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs and utensils for her business

loans.name: Carmen Vilma Sofía

texts.en:
Carmen Vilma is a member of the Yanapanakusun Village Bank. “Yanapanakusun” means “Let’s help ourselves” in Quechua, the first language of many of the group members. She is 43 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. Carmen offers decorations and cakes for parties, weddings and other social occasions. She has had this business for five years, and works mostly on weekends, with the help of her children. She doesn’t have a car of her own, so she has to hire taxis to transport her decorations to each event. 

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy fabric, chairs and cake ingredients. Her goal for the future is to open her own bridal shop using the money from her savings account. She’s currently looking for an appropriate rental space to open her store.

loans.use: Buy fabric, chairs and cake ingredients

loans.name: Mónica Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Mónica pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos” vive en el Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº 1073, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 36 años y es madre de una pequeña niña. Es conviviente su pareja es ingeniero y es quien le apoya en todos los proyectos que emprende. Con el primer prestamo de S/ 300.00 decide invertir en productos de belleza para venderlos a sus vecinos y amigos. Tiene tres ciclos trabajando con el banco.
 
Actualmente cuenta con dos vitrinas de productos de belleza en su domicilio, productos que lo vende a sus amistades, clientes conocidos, vecinos y otros. Este negocio le genera  ganancias mensuales con lo que puede pagar las cuotas mensuales del banco con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/ 1,500 que será pagado en 6  meses comprara una nueva vitrina y perfumes de todas las calidades, pues sus clientes son muy selectivos y exigentes.

Mónica manifiesta su agradecimiento al banco comunal por todo el apoyo que brinda a las mujeres que desean trabajar.
texts.en:
Monica is a member of the communal bank called Los Eucapliptos. She lives in the district of Tarapoto in San Martin. She is 36 years old and has a young daughter. Her husband is an engineer and he supports her with the projects she's involved with. With the first loan, Monica invested in beauty products to sell to friends and neighbors. She's received and paid back 3 loans already with the bank.

Today she has two display cases full of beauty products in her home. She sells to friends, well known customers, neighbors, etc. Her business brings her in monthly income which allows her to make timely payments on the loans. With the new loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase a new display case and various perfumes of high quality, as her clients are quite demanding.

Monica is very grateful to the bank for the support they provide for working women.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new display case for her beauty products, as well as various high quality perfumes as her customers are very demanding.

loans.name: Ni Made Susana Dewi

texts.id: Sejak awal bergabung dengan DINARI, Ni Made Susana Dewi memang sudah memiliki usaha beternak babi di rumahnya. Karena dengan usaha ini Made Susana mampu menambah penghasilan keluarganya sehingga tidak hanya mengandalkan penghasilan suaminya yang seorang petani. Setelah melunasi pinjaman pertama dengan DINARI, Made Susana mampu memperoleh keuntungan bersih Rp.200.000,- per bulannya. Keuntungan ini sangat membantu untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari keluarganya. Selanjutnya Made Susana melanjutkan kerjasama dengan DINARI untuk melakukan pinjaman periode ke II dengan besar pinjaman Rp.6000.000,- jangka waktu 6 bulan serta pelunasan akan dilaksanakan pada akhir periode pinjaman. Pinjaman ini rencananya akan digunakan untuk membeli bibit babi sebanyak 8 ekor dengan harga per ekornya Rp.350.000,-. Nantinya bibit-bibit babi ini ada yang akan dijual per 3 bulan pemeliharaan saja untuk dijadikan daging babi guling. Dan sisa uang pinjaman tentunya untuk membeli pakan babi selama pemeliharaan. Dengan semakin besar pinjaman yang diterima diharapkan keuntungan yang didapat akan meningkat pada waktu panen berikutnya.
texts.en:
Since she started with DINARI, Ni Made Susana Dewi already raised pigs in her home. Since with this Made Susana was able to add to family income,so that it not only depended on husband's income as a tenant farmer.After completing the first loan DINARI, Made Susana was able to have a nett profit of Rp.200.000,- /mo (translator's note: 1US $ fluctuates beteween Rp 10,000-13,000). This profit very much helps daily family needs.Further Made Susana continues working together with DINARI for a second loan for Rp.6000,000,- for a period of 6 months, with full payment at the end of loan period.This loan is needed tobuy 8 piglets at Rp.350,000,-/piglet. These piglets would be raised and sold after 3 months to be then sold as 'babi guling' ( balinese baby roast pig specialty). The rest would be used to buy feed during raising. With higher received loans, it was hoped that profit would increased at the next harvest.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and it's feeds

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.
Maria es casada, tiene 37 años y 5 hijos. Maria M. tiene un taller de confección a medida en su casa. Además Maria los fines de semana prepara comida que vende en su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas y para techar su casa.
Maria esta ahorrando para mejorar su casa.
El sueño de Maria es ayudar a sus 3 últimos hijos a que sean profesionales y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Love and Truth Communal Bank. Maria is married, is 37 years of age and has 5 children. Maria M. has a dressmaking workshop in her house. In addition, on the weekends Maria prepares food that she sells in her house. Maria needs a loan of 1750 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of fabric and to roof her house. Maria is saving to make home improvements. Maria's dream is to help her last 3 children so that they can become professionals and to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and to roof her house.

loans.name: Julia Yamileth

texts.es:
Pulpería S. es el nombre de la pulpería cuya propietaria es la señora Julia S. en el municipio de Chichigalpa donde atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el anochecer. 

La pulpería ha sido muy surtida por ella desde que la inició y hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos y así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de pronta inversión para mejorar.
texts.en:
“Pulpería S.” (S.'s Grocery) is the name of a small grocery store in Chichigalpa owned by Julia S.. Julia keeps the store open every day from the very early morning until nightfall.

Since opening the store, Julia has kept it very well-stocked. She is currently seeking the support of a loan from CEPRODEL to purchase more merchandise and in that way develop her business, which needs the help of a capital investment to improve.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Virgilita

texts.en:
Virgilita L. is a rice farmer. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She has been into farming for 18 years already. In addition to rice, she has pigs. She thinks that hog-raising is a profitable business. She dreams that someday she will see all her children become professionals in their fields.

She is requesting a loan of Php 13,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will help her family increase the yield of their farm.


CEVI is reaching out to farmers like Virgilita to sustain and grow their livelihood. CEVI provides not just credit, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 45 years old and a married mother of two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business selling home products. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to tourists and members of the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Erlinda joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines, committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Djènèba

texts.fr:
Madame Djénéba C. a 50 ans, veuve et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame avec sa coépouse  et leurs  enfants dans le quartier Kôkô de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso ).  
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller  à l’école, elle s’est très vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa maman. Après plusieurs activités, elle a opté pour l’achat et la vente des calebasses, domaine dans lequel elles est très appréciée et sollicitée pour la qualité de ses articles.  
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Madame a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 2005.  Après  4 prêts  solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous remboursés correctement, elle est à son  premier prêt  individuel.
Djénéba compte utiliser ce prêt pour se constituer des stocks de calebasses. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants auprès des producteurs et effectue ses ventes en gros à Abidjan (capitale de  la  Côte  d’Ivoire)  et en détail dans les différents quartiers de Koutiala à une clientèle  composée de revendeurs, de femmes et hommes et les ventes sont réalisées au comptant et quelques fois à crédit.  
Avec ce prêt, Madame Djénéba compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel  de 150 000 FCFA  qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts du prêt, la prise  en charge des besoins de sa famille  et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Djénéba C., age 50, is a widow and the mother of four children. She lives in a polygamous family with her co-wife and their children in the Kôkô district of Koutiala prefecture (Region of Sikasso). Not having had the chance to go to school, she soon became interested in earning an income at her mother's side. After several kinds of work, Djénéba opted for buying and selling calabash bowls, a domain in which she is highly valued and in great demand for the quality of her goods. To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, Djénéba turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in 2005. After four solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, she is now on her first individual loan. She intends to use this loan to replenish her stock of calabash bowls. Supplies are procured from producers in the surrounding villages. Sales are made wholesale in Abidjan (capital of Côte d’Ivoire) and retail in the different districts of Koutiala. Her customers are composed of retailers, women, and men. Transactions are in cash and sometimes on credit. With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that she will use to make loan interest payments, to support her family, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calabash bowls

loans.name: Genevive

texts.en: Genevive T. is from the town of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old, married, and has one infant child. Genevive owns and operates a meat-vending business. Every month she schedules to butcher a pig and sell its meat to her customers in their community. In 2009, Genevive joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Ana Virgen Noble Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Ana Virgen Noble está conformado por La señora Manuela Sánchez tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. El negocio al que se dedica es a la elaboración de tortillas, las cuales elabora en su casa de habitación.  Ella ya tiene 30 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ella solicita el crédito con el propósito de comprar insumos al por mayor, ya que de esta manera los precios son menores. Su deseo principal siempre ha sido mantener estable el negocio, que le permita mejorar siempre el nivel de vida de ella y de sus hijos. Su amiga La señora Yesenia del Socorro Sánchez, tiene 30 años y se dedica también a la elaboración de tortilla artesanal, esta actividad la realiza con otros miembros de su familia que le ayudan a elaborar. Ella posee tres hijos los cuales son menores de edad. Ella es casada, por lo tanto para el ingreso del hogar su esposo también aporta, ya que trabaja como ayudante de albañilería. La señora solicito este crédito con el propósito de incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar los insumos al por mayor ya que compra a un precio más favorable. La ultima integrante es La señora Marcia C. se dedica a la elaboración de nacatamales en su casa de habitación. Tiene 28 años y actualmente es casada. y Tiene 3 hijos. Ella solicito el préstamo con el objetivo de comprar insumos. Este ingreso permite contribuir con los gastos familiares, ya que su esposo también aporta para los gastos del hogar. Ella tiene el sueño de brindar un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos del que ella alguna vez tuvo, a través de su trabajo arduo.
texts.en:
The Ana Virgen Noble Solidarity Group is made up of Manuela Sánchez, who is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children. She makes tortillas in her home and has been doing this for 30 years. She is asking for a loan with the intention of buying wholesale ingredients, since the prices are lower buying them this way. Her biggest dream has always been for her business to remain stable so that she is able to always improve her quality of life and that of her children.

Her friend, Yesenia del Socorro Sánchez, is 30 years old and also makes artisanal tortillas. She does this with other members of her family who help her to make them. She has three young children. She is married, so her husband also contributes to the household income since he is an assistant bricklayer. Yesenia is asking for this loan with the intention of increasing her working capital and buying wholesale ingredients so that she can buy them at a more affordable price.

The last member is Marcia C.. She makes nacatamales in her home. She is 28 years old and is currently married with 3 children. She is asking for this loan to purchase ingredients. This income, in addition to her husband’s income, helps contribute to household expenses. Marcia’s dream is to provide her children with a better quality of life, which she once obtained through hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maya

texts.en: Maya is a 26-year-old married woman. She has been working as a home-based hairdresser since 2008; she has clients from the neighboring villages. Today, Maya is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to buy additional tools and equipment to expand her job.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and equipment

loans.name: Grentina

texts.en:
Grentina is a member of the Semtema in  kihesa Iringa,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 14,9 years.she also cares for other 1 dependents.

 Grentina started her own business selling tomatoes,salts 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn mothly profit approximearly 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

 This is Grentina first loan from BRAC_Tanznaia.she requested the amount of 300,000Tsh in order to buy more commodities.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan  Grentina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes,tomatoes,salts

loans.name: Nyame Bekyre Group

texts.en:
Matilda is 28 years old trader; she is divorcee and mother with four children. Her children are currently in the school. She trades in tubers of yam, maize,cassava etc. on top of table in the local market where she lives. She says through this business, she has endeavored to support her children in school. She requests for the loan to enable her buy increased stock of yam, cereals like maize, vegetables etc. to grow up her business to scale up the business progress. She hopes to increase her savings to support the child education to give him future and hope.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Bekyre’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: She wants the loan to buy increased stock of tubers of yam, cassava and maize etc.

loans.name: Duch

texts.en: Duch R. is 24 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the busy local market for more than four years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or buys them from her wholesale supplier or from other fishermen. She is married to Horm Ty, 34, who works at fishing in and around the lakes of his community. Currently, the fishing is temporarily interrupted because the fishing equipment is broken. Because of this, Duch R. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing tools.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing tools

loans.name: Sinforosa

texts.es:
La socia Sinforosa, es natural de distrito de Anta, e la provincia de Anta y departamento del Cusco, ubicado a 1 hora y 10 minutos de la provincia de Cusco.

Vive en la comunidad campesina de Inquilpata, nuestra socia tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, ella alterna sus labores con el comercio minorista, ella compra y vende granos, todo tipo de maíz, lentejas, habas, frijoles, la socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su pequeña tiendita y surtir sus granos, ella trabaja muchos años en esto y conoce el negocio muy bien.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.en:
Makhsuda is an enterprising woman with a strong desire to improve the quality of life of her family. She is married and is the loving mother of two children.

Makhsuda has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning her craft in her mother's office. With a lot of effort, she was able to open her own shop in her home. She has been successful because her customers recognize the high quality of her products. Because of this, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow.

Today she is requesting a loan of 4,800 Somoni to purchase the fabrics required for sewing national dresses. You can help improve the quality of life for her family. Makhsuda and her son are especially grateful for your generosity and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. Additionally, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fabrics required for sewing national dresses.

loans.name: Isatu's Group

texts.en: Isatu’s Group is made up of Isatu K., Marie K., and Gelikatu K., a group of women who sell fish around town. Isatu, the leader, has been in business for 5 years. At 40 years old, she has two children attending school and is married to a construction worker. This is the first loan sought by this group, and with the 1.5 million LE requested from Kiva lenders and SMT, they hope to expand their businesses, add new inventory, and generate more income for themselves and their families.

loans.use: Expand inventory of dried and fresh fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy curtains to sell

loans.name: Ketti Milagritos

texts.es:
R. V. KETTI MILAGRITOS

Trabajo desde hace tres años como microempresaria haciendo toda clase de tejidos a palitos y máquina. Estudié en un CEO algunos cursos cortos como computación e informática, corte confección, tejido porque después de la separación de mi pareja tuve que afrontar sola los gastos de mi hijo de siete años, de mi madre y míos.
Era indispensable contar con una máquina tejedora lo cual no contaba con el capital para adquirirlo, al ver mi cuñado el empeño de mis trabajos que hacía en el taller donde estudiaba me regaló la herramienta (máquina tejedora) para emprender en este negocio, así empecé haciendo ropomcitos para bebés, colchitas, ajuares, gorritos ofreciéndoles a mis amigas las confecciones, les gustaron mis trabajos que después solicitaron más pedidos. Es una distracción tejer porque lo hago los fines de semana además me da tiempo para trabajar en la librería de mi hermana. Las ganancias de estas ventas me permiten solventar los gastos de alimentación, educación, y servicios básicos de mi hogar; como también pude adquirir una licuadora, televisor. Necesito del préstamo para invertir en conos de hijos de varios tonos, botones, elástico, cintas de colores, y algunos repuestos para mi máquina; las prendas lo venderé en esta campaña de navidad donde hay más demanda.
texts.en:
R. V. Ketti Milagritos For three years I have worked as a small businesswoman making all types of knitting by hand and by machine. I took some short courses like computer science, sewing and cutting, and weaving at a CEO (Occupational Education Center). After separating from my life partner I had to face the expenses alone for my seven year old son, my mother, and myself. It was indispensable to have a knitting machine, but I did not have the money to get one. When my brother-in-law saw the effort that I put into the work I made in the shop where I studied, he gave me the tool (knitting machine) to undertake this business. That is how I started making baby clothes, quilts, layettes, and hats. I offered them to my friends, they liked my work, and later they ordered more. Knitting is a distraction because I do it on the week ends. Also, it gives me time to work in my sister’s bookstore. The earnings from these sales allow me to pay for food, education, and the basic service expenses of my home. I was also able to get a blender and television. I need the loan to buy cones of various colors of thread, buttons, elastic, colored ribbons, and some replacement parts for my machine. I will sell the items during this Christmas season when there is more demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for knitting with wool and thread

loans.name: Nyongle

texts.en:
Nyongle V. is currently in the business of selling beer and local alcohol and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and bags of charcoal to sell. Nyongle is 29 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more crates of beer and bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: Kamala A. was born in 1976. She is married and has two children. Aliyev's family lives in the Fuzuli region. She has been in this business for two years. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy necessary things for her cafe.

loans.use: to buy necessary things for her cafe.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa de 40 años de edad es soltera, trabaja para el MINSA desde hace 16 años como enfermera brindando cuidos a personas que llegan enfermas al centro de Salud del Coral,  tiene una hija y una prima a su cargo, quienes le ayudan a cuidar la casa.  Esta solicitando su 3er credito para construir una habitacion de concreto ya que actualmente la que tiene es de de tabla y se encuentra en mal estado, y quiere aprovechar antes que llegue el invierno para construirla.  Ella se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old, single, and has worked for MINSA for 16 years as a nurse, offering care to people who arrive sick at the Coral Health Center. She has a daughter and a cousin in her care and they help her around the house. She is requesting her 3rd loan to add a room to her concrete house. What she currently has is made of old boards and is in bad condition. She wants to take advantage of the season and accomplish the construction before winter comes. She is characterized as responsible and hard working, with a great desire to forge ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUILD A ROOM ONTO HER HOUSE

loans.name: Katia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Katia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Trigales.
Katia es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Katia vende cosméticos por catálogos, de 3 distintas líneas, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayoría de las ventas son al crédito.
Katia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos que están en oferta.
Katia sueña con educar a sus hijos y mejorar como persona.
texts.en:
Katia is an associate of the Los Trigales (wheat fields) Communal Bank. Katia lives in a shared home. She is 30 years old and has 3 children. Katia sells cosmetics from e different lines of catalogues, products that she offers friends and family. The majority of her sales are on credit. Katia needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of products on promotion. Katia dreams of educating her children and improving as a person.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics currently on promotion for resale.

loans.name: Edit

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo, comarca  rodeo grande la señora Edit A. A. vende abarrotería en general, el crédito solicitado será empleado para comprar mas mercadería y aumentar su inventario, mejorando de esta forma las ventas.
Su negocio empezó cuando doña Edit empezó a vender granos básicos y algunas bebidas, luego de algunos años este crecieron y actualmente es una de las tiendas más populares de la comunidad.
Ella tiene 10 años de tener este negocio en su casa de habitación en donde trabaja de 6 am a 8 pm de la noche espera mejorar su condición económica como lo ha hecho con los créditos que Ceprodel le ha financiado, puesto que ha aumentado su cantidad de productos y ofrece de esta manera una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edit sells general groceries in the municipality of Somotillo, in the Rodeo Grande region. She will use the money from this loan to buy additional merchandise to increase her inventory and sales. Her business started when she began selling basic grains and a few drinks. Within a few years, the business grew and it’s now one of the more popular stores in the community. She has had this business in her home for ten years, where she works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm. She hopes to increase her income with the help of this loan through CEPRODEL. She will increase her inventory and be able to provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: Anna M. est âgée de 64 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous majeurs mais à la charge de 2 qui lui sont confiés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KOUDOSS depuis juillet 2006 et a eu 7 fois de suite à bénéficier de crédit. Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes, elle est également détentrice d'un mercerie. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la gestion de la famille et de participer à l'amélioration de des conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Anna M. is 64 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are adults; she is, however, responsible for two children who have been entrusted to her. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (credit association) in DAROU-KOUDOSS since July 2006 and has benefited from seven consecutive loans. She has a small business selling vegetables and she also owns a haberdashery. Her aim is to support her husband in the management of their family and to contribute to the improvement of the family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
El Cliente es dueño de una carpintería, es casado, cuenta con  más de 15 años en el ramo, realiza todo tipo de trabajo en maderas, como sillas, mesas, muebles todo tipo, trabajos muy finos y de buena calidad con gran cantidad de clientes. El Cliente cuenta con casa propia en el barrio San Francisco,  donde vive con su señora, quien es ama de casa.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos para su  taller, como maderas, clavos, cementos para madera, algunas herramientas, para de esta forma mejorar la calidad de sus productos y por ende incrementar sus ingresos. Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por los buenos servicios que le ha brindado a su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Pastor F. owns a carpenter's shop, is married, and has more than 15 years in the business. He does all kinds of woodworking, such as chairs, tables, and all kinds of furniture. He does very fine, highly quality work for a large number of customers. He has his own house in the San Francisco neighborhood, where he lives with his wife, who is a housewife. F. is requesting the loan to purchase supplies for his workshop, such as wood, nails, wood glue, and some tools, in order to improve the quality of his products and thus increase his income. He thanks the Fundacion Paraguaya for the good services it has offered his enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies such as wood, nails, glue, and some tools

loans.name: Kin

texts.en:
Mrs. Kin T. (pictured above), 51, and her husband, Mr. Buntho Thean, also 51, live on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1983 and have four children: two sons- one of them is a construction worker and another one stays at home and two daughters- one weaves silk at home and another one works for a restaurant.    

Kin has been a silk weaver for almost twenty years. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes them to sell at Phnom Penh market. Her husband drives a motor taxi. She is requesting her first loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Cruz Piedad

texts.es:
Cruz A. de 63 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral (lugar muy humilde, las casas del sector están rodeadas de un estero donde pasan los barcos con cargamento pesado) de Guayaquil. Su esposo vende carbón, ellos viven solos porque ya todos los hijos se casaron. 

Ella empezó hace 12 años con una tienda pequeña, pero poco a poco al tener suficientes ingresos decidió invertir en más productos y comprar papelería para su negocio. 

Po esa buena decisión ahora ella tiene una tienda muy surtida vende víveres y también papelería, en ocasiones cuando tiene tiempo ella cose ropa para sus clientes ya que le encanta hacer eso. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y cosméticos para surtir más su tienda.  Ella espera en el futuro seguir con el negocio y mantenerse con salud.
texts.en:
Cruz A. is 63 years old and lives in a periurban area along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil. This modest area is surrounded by a creek through which heavy cargo ships pass. Her husband sells charcoal. Cruz and her husband live alone because all of their children are married.

She started her small shop 12 years ago. Over time she gradually earned sufficient income. Cruz decided to invest in more products and acquired stationery for her business. This turned out to be a good idea because she now has a store that is well-stocked with provisions as well as stationery. On occasion, when she has the time, she will sew clothes for her customers because she enjoys doing that.

With this loan Cruz will buy notebooks, pens, and cosmetics to increase the inventory in her store. She hopes in the future to continue with her business and stay healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, pens, and cosmetics

loans.name: Batirhan

texts.en:
Batirhan S., 52, is married and the father of two children. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent) in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. They have been living together in their current home for 12 years.

Batirhan operates a clothing trading business at a local market called Tirlik. He has been operating his business since 1998 with his wife's help. In his business, his wife sells the products. In addition, Batirhan has been operating a taxi service since 2001 with his own car.

With the profits from his businesses, he built a house for his family in 2002. Batirhan has been planning to build a store with the profit from both businesses in the future.

He is a very hardworking person and focused on the future. Batirhan says, “I would like to successfully operate my business in order to provide a good education for my children."

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing from Taikeshken, a Chinese border town, to resell them to his many customers.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Derlie

texts.en:
Derlie D. is from the village of Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Derlie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Derlie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Derlie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Derlie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Derlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Derlie is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Derlie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 30 years old, married, with 1 child who is two years old.  Alfred is commonly known in the business of selling cows and he has been in this business since 2008.  Alfred works every day and he is proud of his business.

Alfred is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase many cows for sale.  With these additional cows, Alfred will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business of selling cows.  Alfred will also start saving for a better future and for his child's education.

loans.use: Additional cows for sale

loans.name: Sotero Rocha

texts.es: Sotero Rocha tiene 49 años, hace más de 10 años que tiene el negocio de destace y venta de carne Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, pues siempre le ha gustado luchar y sacar adelante a su hijo que está a cargo. El ofrece sus productos a los transeúntes. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos, por lo que trata de mantenerse de la mejor manera posible, ofreciendo un buen trato a sus clientes y dándoles productos de calidad. El desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que sus ventas puedan incrementarse y perciba mayores ganancias. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Sotero Rocha is 49-years-old. For more than 10 years he's had a meat butchering and sales business. He's always enjoyed fighting to get ahead for his son, who he raises. He offers his products to passersby. This business is his only source of income, so he maintains it in the best way possible, offering good service to his customers and giving them quality products. He wants to expand his business with the purchase of more products so that his sales will increase and he'll make more income. The loan is for the purchase of primary materials.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa I. is from the village of Jampason, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 68 years old. Felipa is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felipa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling both food & daily use products and also retailing rice in kilo in the local community. Felipa has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Felipa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felipa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Felipa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Teresa S. R., tiene la edad de 36 años es casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil, ellos son una familia muy humilde, que cuenta son los ingresos de su esposo para sobrellevar los gastos mensuales, ella es nutricionista y con su esfuerzo propio y el de su esposo han comprado productos que tienen una buena demanda entre la población, y le generan ingresos extras a su familia, ellos tienen 5 hijos varones que estudian y algunos trabajan y apoyan económicamente a sus padres.

Es para su negocio, que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de productos de nutrición, debido a que es mercadería de precios elevados, pero su clientela tiene un nivel económico alto y goza de bastante aceptación entre ese mercado, espera que una mayor inversión le traerá mejores ingresos que favorecerá al bienestar económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa S. R. is 36 years old and married. Her husband works as a mason. They are a very humble family who depend on her husband's income to cover their monthly expenses. She is a nutritionist, and with her own effort and that of her husband, she has been able to buy products that are in great demand among the population, and these generate extra income for the family. They have 5 sons who are in school, with some of them working and economically helping their parents. Maria Teresa is requesting a loan for her business, to buy a larger inventory of nutrition products, since this is an expensive type of merchandise. However, her customers have a high income level, and she is well-liked within this market. She hopes that a larger investment will bring her more income, which will improve her family's economic well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying nutrition products to sell

loans.name: Elom A.

texts.en:
Since 2002, Madame Aziagbe has been a seamstress near her home in Lome, Togo. She purchases pagnes, a traditional wax-printed cloth, and basin, a more expensive, high quality cloth used for dresses here in Togo, and then uses them to create clothing for her clients. 

She is requesting a loan of 300,000 XOF in order to purchase more fabric. She plans to divide the loan evenly between purchasing pagnes and purchasing basin. 

Madame Elom A. is 33 years old. She is married and she and her husband have one child.

loans.use: To purchase basin and pagnes, traditionally used fabrics in Togo

loans.name: Benkadi V Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI V sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 2 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames à N’Gala, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités agricoles. 
Les spéculations cultivées par ces femmes du groupe BENKADI V sont entre autres le petit mil, l’arachide, le maïs, le pois de terre et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, WARABA D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,2 hectare  d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser après la campagne, un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA environ.
texts.en:
The members of the BENKADI V group are married women, on average 32 years old with 2 children, and they live in polygamous families in N’Gala, one of the villages of the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microlending institution in order to better organize their agricultural activities. The crops they cultivate include millet, groundnut, corn, blackeye pea and beans. This is the group's second loan, the first one has been repaid properly. With this new loan, WARABA D. plan to buy fertilizer and small tools, as well as hire help to maintain about 1.2 hectares of groundnut and beans. Their harvest is sold in the cities of Dioïla and Massigui, to both men and women. They hope to make an average profit of approximately 40 000 CFA.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide and small tools

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita F. is from the village of San Juan, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old. Pacita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Pacita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pacita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Pacita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Guimoxa Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en L. casa D. Petra Enedina C., una integrante del grupo Guimoxa, que está ubicado en el Estado D. VeraC. en México. Se ve al grupo D. señoras alrededor D. L. mercancía D. doña Petra en L. foto. ElL. se dedica a  L. venta D. cosméticos que inicio hace 5 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercancía y cubrir sus pedidos. Sus clientes  L. consideran una  persona muy trabajadora. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta pues va a reinvertir en su negocio. Tiene 42 años, estudio hasta el 7mo. Semestre D. economía, es casada y tiene en total 1 hijo varón. Quiere este crédito para comprar mercancía para surtir sus pedidos. Espera lograr mejorar su vida económicamente y L. D. su hijo con su autoempleo.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Petra Enedina C’s house.  She is a member of the Guimoxa group located in the Mexican state of VeraC..  In the photo we can see the group of women surrounding Petra’s merchandise.

She has sold cosmetics for 5 years and is asking for funds to buy more merchandise in order to fill her pending orders.  Her customers consider her to be a very hard working person.  She is happy at the time of requesting the loan because she will be able to reinvest in her business.

She is 42 years old and finished the 7th semester majoring in Economics.  She is married and has one son.

She wants this loan to buy merchandise to fill her orders.  She hopes to improve her life and her son’s life economically through her self-employment.
.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to fill her orders.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar Q.  is 48-year-old married man with three children. He raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them. The biggest problem Eldar faces is that pests have affected his crops, and he does not have enough money to deal with the problem. He has been working in agriculture for eight years. He is requesting this loan in order to use it for his crops, thus thwarting losses. Agriculture is his family’s source of income. For this reason, Eldar applied for 1000 AZN. He already has successful loan history with AqroInvest and KIVA.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 28 year old married woman living with her husband and two young children. She has been working as a baker for over ten years. She specializes in preparing special Lebanese bread knowing as “saj”. Her freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of her village and neighboring towns. With her business income, she helps her husband with the household.

Today, she is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a flour machine. Her bakery is an important source of income for her family. Lebanon has many pastry shops and bakeries and it is easy to buy fresh goods in one’s village or neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase flour machine

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia J. lives in Proper, Brgy. Mahawak, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  General Store and Food Vending ("Halo-Halo Shaved ice dessert) businesses. Her common-law husband Roland Marijuan is 47 years old and works as a dental technician to earn his living.  She has one child who is 13 years old.

 Ignacia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ignacia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future education of her child and for family needs.
