Ignacia J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
S. Fred is 40 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luweero region of Uganda.  He is married and has 3 children.  Two of his children are currently in school.  Fred has a business of cattle rearing, which he has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2.000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more cattle.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fred hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Fred hopes to establish a big farm.

loans.use: more cattle

loans.name: Corsecion

texts.en:
Corsecion A. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Corsecion owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, toothpaste & snack foods. She has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Corsecion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Corsecion is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like beverages & detergents. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like beverages & detergents

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 40 años, es un hombre muy amable y sencillo, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Mayra de 17 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Desde muy joven Juan se dedicó al cultivo del café, achiote y plátano, ya que esta es la actividad que ha realizado en su familia desde hace mucha generaciones, sus productos los vende a los compradores, que llegan hasta sus chacras, quienes posteriormente llevan el producto a vender a la ciudad de Lima. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus sembríos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para poder incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesto a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy respetuoso con el resto de sus socias. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Juan. 40, is a very kind, unassuming man living in his own house with his beloved daughter Mayra, 17, who is the motivating force behind all his efforts.  From a very young age Juan has farmed coffee, achiote and banana since this was the activity his family has been engaged in for many generations.  He sells his production to buyers that come to his fields and who later take the product to sell in the city of Lima.

What he enjoys most about the work is cultivating the land, something he does with much dedication.  He’s been in this line of work for 17 years and considers the most difficult part to be fumigating the crops.  In time, he’d like to buy more farmland to increase production.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He knows that he must repay on time and is willing to do so.  He is very respectful towards his fellow group members in the communal bank.

He will use the 500 new sol loan to buy more manure and fertilizers for his land.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Alexandra Teresa

texts.es:
Alexandra de 24 años, siempre le ha gustado el comercio y empezó a trabajar desde muy temprana edad ya que es madre soltera para poder financiar sus gastos y el de sus hijos. 

Ella vende joyería y bisutería a diferentes personas conocidos y amigos del sector donde vive. Vende pulseras, anillos, cadenas etc. No tiene horario fijo para sus ventas ya que es comerciante informal. Tiene muchas aspiraciones en su negocio por eso quiere continuar para darle una buena vida a su hijo. 

Quiere tener en un futuro un negocio establecido con venta de joyería pero por ahora para llegar a ese objetivo quiere comprar con el préstamo joyas, zapatos y ropa para tener un ingreso adicional y así darle una buena vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Alexandra is 24 years old.  She has always liked selling and she started working at a very early age since she is a single mother and she had to cover her own expenses and those of her child.

Alexandra sells jewelry and costume jewelry to acquaintances and friends in her area.  She sells bracelets, rings, chains, etc.  She doesn't work regular hours since she is an informal saleswoman.  She has many aspirations for her business and would like to continue in her business so that she can provide her child with a good life.

In the future, Alexandra would like to have an established jewelry business but, for now, in order to achieve this goal, she would like to use her loan to buy jewelry, shoes and clothes so that she can make additional income and provide a good life for her child.

loans.use: Jewelry and costume jewelry

loans.name: Nassoro

texts.en:
Nassoro is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a retail business for the past year, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. Nassoro faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to sell by wholesale in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita, 41 years old, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 3 children aged 14, 20, and 24. To make a living, Enecita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Enecita works hard to ensure healthy crops and a productive rice farm.

Enecita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enecita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Enecita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For Tourist Guide equipment.

loans.name: Frederic

texts.fr:
Client de 31 ans célibataire sans enfant, a l'obtention de son Bac, n'ayant pas des moyens pour aller continuer des etudes universitaires , il se lance dans le commerce.
En 1998, il ouvre une boucherie ou il vend de la viande de bœuf,des cartons  de cuisses de poulets,les ailes de poulet, les cotis de porcs , du poisson de mer, ses ventes sont de 15.000fr a 30.000 fr par jour.

A l'obtention de son prêt, il compte renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en ajoutant, 5 cartons de viande bœuf,2 cartons de queue de bœuf,2 cartons de  cuisses de poulet, un cartons d'ailes de poulet et deux cartons de poisson de mer comme la morue et le poisson capitaine.
A l'avenir il veut être un grand homme d'affaire, ouvrir une chambre froide et faire vente en gros des cartons de vivres frais.
texts.en:
Mr. Frederic K. N. is a single 31-year-old entrepreneur with no children. Upon receipt of his high school diploma, not having the means to continue his studies at a university level, he went into business.

In 1998, he opened a butcher's shop where he sells beef, cartons of chicken thighs, chicken wings, pork chops and saltwater fish. His sales range from 15,000 to 30,000 CFA francs daily.

Upon receiving his loan, he plans to increase his available merchandise, adding 5 cartons of beef, 2 cartons of oxtail, 2 cartons of chicken thighs, a carton of chicken wings and 2 cartons of saltwater fish like cod and emperor fish.

In the future, he wants to be a serious businessman, open a cold storage room and sell cartons of fresh food wholesale.

loans.use: To buy cartons of beef, pork chops, boiling fowl, cartons of chicken thighs

loans.name: Glory's Group

texts.en:
Glory J. is from the village of Luzon, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 47 years old. Glory is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Glory is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Glory operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling "longganisa" (pork sausages) and "tocino" (cured pork). Glory has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2011, Glory joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase ingredients to make more products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI: 

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Ministry of Education School in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1961 by the government of Sierra Leone in order to provide quality education to the children of the district.  The school is staffed with 20 teachers and has an enrollment of 400 pupils. 

The teachers of this school have requested a loan of SLL 13,700,000 for the entire group.  This is their first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders.   With the help of this loan, these teachers are in a stronger position to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries will not let them do.

Peter V. is the leader of the group. He is 55 years old. He was born in a village called Buninba. Peter is married and has 4 children – 2 in secondary school and 2 in college. Peter has been a teacher for 7 years. He will use his share of the loan to pay college fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay college fees for his children

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 55 years old, married to Esther Chelagat, and has seven children aged 32, 28, 25, 20, 17, 15 and seven years old. He makes bricks in Chepterit and has been in operation for a period of three years getting a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

He has taken out his first loan from KADET Ltd. of 20,000 KES and intends to use it to purchase firewood and pay wages to the labourers he hires when preaparing the bricks. The profits will be used to educate his children. 

He hopes to have a happy family which is well cared for.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and pay employees

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: El sr. Tomas es un cliente nuevo, con buena referencia crediticia, se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de todo tipo y además de la elaboración de puertas y otros. El sr. Tomas es un cliente muy trabajador con mucha experiencia, hace 33 años que inicio su actividad y oficio, como carpintero, razón por la cual llegó a equipar su taller con todos los equipos necesarios como: tupy, escoplo, torno, circular (parqueteadora), todo esto con la ayuda de su familia, que siempre esta siempre a su lado apoyándolo. El dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de madera para la fabricacion de muebles, el Sr. Tomas vive en  la zona sagrado corazón de Jesús, desde mucho tiempo, es bueno también señalar que el Sr. Tomas, es  la primera vez que trabaja con una institución financiera, razón por la cual esta entusiasmado en trabajar con " emprender"  y espera sacar montos mas altos con el transcurrir del tiempo, es una persona muy responsable agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Tomas is a new client with good credit references.  He manufactures furniture of all sorts and also makes doors and other items.  Tomas is a very hard working, experienced client.  He started working as a Carpenter 33 years ago and has managed to equip his shop with all the necessary equipment: chisels, lathe, saws, Tupi combination saws, etc.  All of this with help from his family who is always by his side supporting him.

He will use the loan to buy lumber to make furniture.

Tomas has lived in the Sagrado Corazón de Jesús zone for a long time.  It’s worth highlighting that this is the first time Tomas has worked with a financial institution so he is very excited about working with Emprender and hopes to take out larger loans as time goes by.  He is a responsible person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy cedar to make furniture.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a single man who owns a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is electricity bills.

For the past three years, he has operated a printing business. He also does lamination, mobile phone charging, and sales of mobile phone accessories. His potential customers are the neighbouring college students and other people in the community. He dreams of becoming a distributor of stationery in the future.

With this loan of Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase stationery for his printing business. He decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase printing stationery for his business.

loans.name: Migyera Development Group A

texts.en:
32-year-old Moses is an industrious and arduous timber sales businessman. His operating base is in Kihihi. The happily married father of four has six years experience in this business. That experience has built in him a persevering spirit which has been abetted by his hard work and determination. 

Moses also does some small-scale farming. He says he is casting his mind to the future, anticipating better prospects for his business. Weekly the timber sales trade generates shillings 150,000 as sales profit. With this loan, he says he is going purchase more timber to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more timber to resell.

loans.name: Delphia

texts.en:
Delphia works at a homeless shelter running a program designed to house both the homeless and those at risk of becoming homeless. Her passion for economic empowerment within the homeless community sparked a desire to launch a program that provides income opportunities to the homeless through the sale and distribution of biweekly and bimonthly newspapers.  The vendors are able to purchase the newspaper from the program for less than half the sales price and keep the remaining portion as income.
 
Delphia chose to open this business because of her experience working with the homeless and at-risk population and her passion for poverty reduction.  Although her business is home-based for now and relies on volunteers, she believes the business will give the homeless an entrepreneurial mindset and have many positive impacts for the homeless population in the city.

With this loan from ACCION USA, Delphia will be able to print more newspapers for her flourishing business.


Additional Information About This Loan 

This loan has been made as a part of Kiva Detroit and in partnership with Michigan Corps.  Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations and field partners in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. Michigan Corps is the first community organization to work with Kiva in Detroit, and conducts outreach through small business networks, churches, community foundations, and across many personal and social media networks. Learn more at kiva.org/detroit

loans.use: to pay for newspaper printing

loans.name: Azizeh

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 51-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and one child. 

She has owned a clothes and shoes shop since 2008. She always presents the new trends and collections to her customers in order to satisfy their demands. She is well known in this type of business due to her extended experience in this field. 

She has already had her first Kiva loan and has been a very good client with prompt repayments. Today, she is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store's inventory. She notes that the diversity of her merchandise selection will help her attract more clients and therefore increase her sales. In the future, she is planning to add women's bags and accessories to her shop.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es:
Motivada por generar ingresos adicionales para contribuir a los gastos de su hogar, desde hace algunos años, Ana Celia decidió crear su propio negocio, una miscelanea en la que ofrece diversidad de productos. Esta emprendedora valora el hecho de trabajar cerca de su casa y dedicarle tiempo a sus dos hijos, aunque reconoce que no ha sido fácil por los momentos de violencia por los que ha a travesado el barrio donde está ubicado el negocio en Medellín, sabe que la dedicación es lo que le ha permitido seguir adelante. 

En el futuro, Ana Celia espera ampliar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunos productos y así ampliar su oferta.
texts.en:
Motivated to make additional income to contribute to her household expenses some years ago, Ana Celia decided to set up her own business, a general store in which she sells a range of different products.  This entrepreneur values the fact that she works not far from her home and is able to devote time to her two children although she recognizes that it has not been easy because of the violent times that the Medellín neighborhood in which her business is located has experienced.  She knows that her commitment is what has enabled her to get ahead.

In the future, Ana Celia hopes to expand her business in order to improve her income and offer a better quality of life to her family.  She currently needs a loan to buy some products and thereby expand her offerings.

loans.use: to buy products such as stationery, clothes and personal care products

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is 36 years old and is married, with seven children between twenty and two years old. She and her husband hope to give them a good education to the university level. She sells fruits and vegetables by the roadside at a residential area in Nairobi. Caren has been running this business for thirteen years now. She says that the business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints.

She is using her loan of kes 20,000 to build a shelter where she will run her business.  Currently, she displays the vegetables in the open air.
In the future, she hopes to expand her business to wholesale. She describes herself as a very ambitious lady.

loans.use: to build a shelter where she will run her business

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep is 52 years of age, married, and lives with his wife and son in Ho Chi Minh City. He runs a general store to earn income to support his family. He sells basic items such as candy, cigarettes, shampoo, insecticide, and beverages. He has been in the business for more than seven years. 

Hiep is requesting a loan to invest in his business by buying a greater quantity and variety of basic goods to sell in his general store. He hopes that this will enable him to better serve his current customers, attract new customers, and increase the turnover of his business. Hiep hopes his business runs smoothly and will help his family to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy products such as candy, shampoo, insecticide, and beverages to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Micaela es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos, 1 de los cuales está estudiando, se dedica a la panadería, a la elaboración de panes de toda clase, inicio como operario y hasta el momento lleva 30 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la tejeduría.

Decide hacer un préstamo para invertirlo en capital de trabajo y comprar más insumos para lograr una mayor producción de pan: harina, huevos, leche, azúcar, saborizantes, manteca, levadura. En el futuro quiere ver su negocio grande y productivo.
texts.en:
Señora Micaela is married and is 48 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to attend school.  She has six children, one of whom is in school.  She works in a bakery, baking products of every kind.  She started as an operator, and has had 30 years of experience so far.  She has the support of her husband who works doing weaving.

She decided to take out a loan to invest in working capital, and to buy more supplies to be able to achieve improved bread production: flour, eggs, milk, sugar, flavoring, butter, and yeast.

In the future, she wants to see her business be large and productive.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients.

loans.name: Carmen Jacqueline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Productivo se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 16 y 12 años, el mayor estudia en universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga se dedica al comercio pues tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí también vende artículos de bazar y productos Avon, Lebel y Saysons (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00, nos cuenta que allí mismo vende sus otros productos, sus hijos le ayudan en su labor cuando están desocupados. Los productos  para su tienda los recibe en su casa. Tiene cuatro  años que tiene este negocio y a pesar de que tiene poco tiempo la tiene bien surtida para que sus clientes encuentren de todo en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y cosméticos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios  y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The "Productivo" Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, which is well-known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts with are renowned on a national and international level.  This is where the famous sombreros made from toquilla straw come from.

This is where Señora Carmen lives.  She is 41 years old, and is married with three children aged 18,16, and 12.  The eldest attends university, and the younger two are in school.  Her husband is a driver.

Our friend works in retail, as she has a food store in her home.  She also sells stationery items and products from Avon, Lebel and Saysons (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She works every day from 7 a.m. through to 9 p.m.  She tells us that she is also selling her other products at the same time.  Her children help her with her work, when they are free.  She keeps the products for her store at home.  She has been working in this business for four years, and in spite of her limited time, she keeps it well-stocked so that her customers can find everything they want in one place.

She will use this loan to stock up her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and cosmetics.  She has been in the Communal Bank since its beginning, and likes it because she has made more friends in the group.

Her goals are to continue progressing with her business, and that her store grows on a daily basis.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and cosmetics.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 25 años es una mujer joven, pero muy dedicada. Ella vive en concubinato con Williams, su esposo, con quien tiene 2 hijos: Jeferson y Yesenia, a quienes cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Carita. Desde muy joven le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra; como también a asumir nuevas responsabilidades. Es por eso que aproximadamente 7 años, comenzó a sembrar. En todo este tiempo logró obtener un terreno agrícola que le proporciona 5 bolsas de producción. Sus principales cultivos constan de arveja, papa y habas, los cuales cuida, fertiliza y limpia la maleza constantemente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tener la compañía de su esposo, pues le ayuda en sus labores. Su principal dificultad es poder costear los gastos de la educación de su hija, porque tiene que trasladarla constantemente a la ciudad. Por ello en el futuro desea comprar más terrenos agrícolas que le proporcionen mayor cantidad de productos, también comprarse una casa en la ciudad para poder brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde agradece por la confianza depositada. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Karina, tiene sembrado papa de la variedad “única”, por ello de recibir su apoyo. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales, además de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja para su próxima siembra, después de la cosecha.
texts.en:
25-year old Karina is young but very dedicated. She lives with her partner Williams with whom she has two children, Jeferson and Yesenia. They live in their own home in the small village of Carita. Even as a young child Karina was taught how to work the land and also how to take on new responsibilities. At the age of 7 years, she began planting seeds. Since then she has managed to obtain productive farming land.

Karina grows mainly peas, potatoes, and beans which she cares for, fertilizes and keeps free of weeds. The part of her job that she most enjoys is working alongside her husband as he helps her in the fields. The most difficult part is affording the educational expenses of her daughter as she constantly has to take her into town. In the future Karina wishes to buy more agricultural land that can yield a greater quantity of produce. She also wants to buy a house in town so that she can provide her children with a good education.

Karina belongs to the Progreso Carita Community Bank. This is her third loan with MFP whom she thanks for the trust they have placed in her. She promises to pay back the money promptly. She is sowing the Unica potato variety and will use the loan money to buy organic fertilizer and two sacks of peas for the next sowing season after this year's harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and two sacks of peas

loans.name: Jazmin Group

texts.es: la nueva integrante del grupo es la señora Paula va a comprar con su préstamo cazuelas, ollas y jarros de barro, las otras integrantes siguen en su negocio de alfareria. La señora Paula tiene 40 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 1 hijo varón de 15 años de edad, el estudia en bachilleres, ella vende cazuelas, ollas y jarros de barro, ella solicito su préstamo para mejorar el negocio va a comprar cazuelas ollas y jarros de diferentes tamaños y modelos para tener mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes, ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años es un oficio que sus papas le enseñaron a trabajar en la alfarería y la mayoría en su pueblo se dedican a la alfarería, ella inicio con poquito y fue creciendo poco a poco con su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo, ella sale a vender ofrece sus productos en las ferias y en los tianguis, ella se siente orgulloso de su negocio a crecido,  ella vende muy bien el barro por los productos que se ven bonitos, ella utiliza las ganancias en los gastos de la casa y para la  escuela de su hijo, ella está planeando ampliar su negocio comprar más productos de diferentes modelos y tamaños y lo piensa lograr con los prestamos, ella está feliz con este préstamo tiene la oportunidad de crecer su negocio. Sus sueños y esperanza son que su hijo siga estudiando y que su negocio crezca. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad  “gracias por ayudarnos, estamos contentas con su apoyo y vamos a echarle ganas para salir adelante con los negocios y las familias”.
texts.en:
The new group member is Paula.  She will use her loan to buy clay tureens, pots and jugs.  The other members continue with their pottery business.  

Paula is 40 years old, married and has a 15-year-old son going to high school.  She sells clay pots, tureens and jugs.  She requested the loan to improve her business.  She will buy pots, tureens and jugs of different sizes and styles to have available for her customers.  She started her business twenty years ago; her parents taught her how to work in pottery.  Most of the town is involved in pottery.  She started out with just a little and gradually grew with her work and with help from her husband and son.  She goes out to sell at the markets and street fairs and she’s proud of the work she does.  Her business has grown.

Her pottery sells well because her products look pretty.  She uses profits to cover household expenses and for her son’s school.  She’s planning to expand the business buying more products of various styles and sizes and she plans to accomplish this with the loans.  She’s happy with this loan because she gets the opportunity to grow with her business.  Her dreams and hopes are that her son continues in school and that the business grows.

The group members would like to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: “Thank you for supporting us.  We are happy with your support and we are going to work very hard to get ahead with our businesses and with our families.”

loans.use: to buy clay pots, tureens and jugs.

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en:
Myagmar is 56 years old and lives with her husband and 4 kids in a house in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. 3 of her kids work separately and the youngest one studies at a Movie and Arts college. She runs a grocery shop. Her shop has a good location and has many customers. I need support to be a distributor of a large grocery organization: a deposit needs to be placed. 
She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I am a very commited person and I will do everything I can to support my family". She is requesting 1,500,000 to purchase grocery products.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold is married with one child. He is 44 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. To earn a living, Arnold has a motorcab business. He has had this business for six years. Each month, he earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). He has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle business. Arnold has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Arnold hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle, to operate his motorcycle business

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is 33 years old and lives in Ijevan city. He is married and has two sons. For several years Sargis worked as a crane driver, after which he worked as head of security at one of the Ijevan companies. 

Since 1993, Sargis and his mother have established their own business, which is fruit and vegetable trading at the Ijevan food market. Sargis buys fruits and vegetables from the neighboring villages and resells them in Ijevan city. Thanks to profit from his business, Sargis has built a shop for his trading and has bought new furniture for their apartment. 

This is his second loan from Kiva and he is looking forward to continuing the growth of his business. Sargis is seeking a loan of 550,000 Armenian drams to buy fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a mother of three children, aged between 15 and 20 years, with the last two still attending schooling. She has been in farming for 5 years with her farm products of milk, eggs and maize being sold to the local market. Her family fully relies on farming for their daily upkeep.

Rhoda has requested for a loan of 61,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She is optimistic that her dairy business will make better returns to meet her family's needs, like the education of her children. She also wants to buy a cereals grinding machine to process her maize into flour and to retail as a finished product. She says animal diseases remain a farmer's major challenge in the area.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and poultry birds.

loans.name: Bimboje

texts.en: Bimboje is 40 years old, married and has nine children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is a fisherman who uses his income to help support their family. They live in a house that has electricity and piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the last 10 years, Bimboje has earned a living by selling the fish that her husband catches. Her goal for the future is to expand her business. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 50,000 to buy more equipment, cooking oil and salt. She joined Yehu to access loans that would allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more equipment, cooking oil and salt for her business.

loans.name: Jovana

texts.es: Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga, tiene 35 años, ella se dedica a la venta de llantas usadas, es madre de 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 3 años, FINCA le ayudó a poder ahorrar, y a ser mas responsable, poco a poco pudo aumentar su capital, ella esta muy feliz y agradece todas las enseñanzas que le inculcan, como invertir también le enseñaron y gracias a esas enseñanzas ahora puede tener un buen negocio, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de llantas, y mayor meta es poder comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the Communal Bank “Amauta Huamanga”. She is 35 years old and sells used tires. Yovana is the mother of two children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. FINCA helped her to save and be more responsible. Little by little, she was able to increase her capital. Yovana is very pleased and appreciative of all the training she has received, such as how to invest. Thanks to the lessons she has learned, she now has a good business.

Yovana is currently requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of tires. Her greatest goal is to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy tires to sell.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee una venta de carteras de todo tipo, color y tamaño  todo al gusto del cliente, últimamente ha tenido más demanda, gracias a la calidad de su trabajo, además ocupa materiales de primera calidad y las vende a un buen precio; José Luis tiene un gran don y es un hombre totalmente dedicado a su trabajo, siempre está adelante de la competencia, tiene muchas metas y piensa que solo el hombre inteligente que sabe arriesgar y aprovechar las pocas o muchas oportunidades que se le presentan es el hombre que alcanza el verdadero éxito, está dispuesto a alcanzarlo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar polietileno, hilo grueso, lana, adornos entre otros. José Luis tiene la confianza que de esta forma logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose Luis, 46, lives with his wife and their children. He owns a business selling purses of all types, colors and sizes, depending on the customer's taste. Lately his demand has increased, thanks to the quality of his work, the good materials that he uses, and his affordable prices. Jose Luis has a great gift and is a man totally dedicated to his work. He is always ahead of the competition, has a lot of goals, and thinks that only an intelligent man who takes risks and takes advantage of whatever opportunities present themselves will be truly successful. He wants to achieve this, and so he asks INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy polyethylene, thick thread, yarn, decorations and other things. Jose Luis is confident that this will help him give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy polyethylene, thick thread, yarn and decorations.

loans.name: San Antonio De Higuerón Afuera (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En un sitio llamado Higuerón en la ciudad de Portoviejo  cada quince días se reúnen el un socio y las catorce socias  del Grupo De  Crédito San Antonio de Higuerón Afuera. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, prestación de servicios entre otras actividades. Ellos al conocer de los beneficios que brinda la institución decidieron unirse  hace ya 2 ciclos para  poder acceder a los créditos que brinda La  Fundación Espoir.

La señora María Eudocia es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le ha gustado la seriedad y puntualidad que hay en la institución para tratar a los clientes. Ella tiene 63 años de edad, hace varios años su compañero de toda la vida falleció, pero de esta  relación tiene 6 hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos  viven con ella.

Ella para salir adelante se dedica a la cría de chanchos y de pollos, para lo cual tiene una pequeña granja en su casa,  compra por cajas los pollos cuando están pequeños y luego los cría por espacio de tres meses,  los vende en pie o por libras a los vecinos o entrega a comerciantes que llevan a los mercados locales. Ella en las tardes también se dedica a la venta de bocadillos, como empanada, jugos y gaseosas, aprovecha que en las afueras de su  casa hay un acacha de vóley y allí se reúnen todas las tardes los vecinos de la localidad.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimento y medicinas para los pollos.

Su sueño es tener una granja  más grande y salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
At the site called “Higuerón” in the city of Portoviejo, fourteen women and one man who make up the Communal Bank “San Antonio de Higuerón Afuera” meet every fifteen days. They engage in a variety of business activities such as general retail, providing services, and other trades. The members have discovered the benefits of the organization since they made the decision to join. They have already participated in two loan cycles with Fundación ESPOIR.

Sra. María Eudocia is a founding member of the Communal Bank. She likes the seriousness and punctuality that the organization has demonstrated when dealing with their clients. María Eudocia is 63 years old and has been widowed for several years since her life companion passed away. She has six grown children, one of whom lives with her.

To earn a living, María Eudocia raises pigs and chickens from a small farm established in her home. She buys chickens by the crate when the animals are small and raises them for a three-month period before selling them individually or by the pound to neighbors and merchants from the local markets. In the afternoons, María Eudocia also makes snacks such as empanadas, juices, and soft drinks. She takes advantage of the outskirts of town where there is a volleyball court. All of her neighbors from the town gather there in the evenings.

This loan will be used to buy feed and medicines for her chickens. María Eudocia dreams of having a larger farm and good health for herself and her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her chickens.

loans.name: Mana Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Karla mujer de 40 años de edad, soltera, con un hijo de 15 años, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 4 años, su hija le ayuda a despachar. Tiene 5 años de ser cliente de la institución, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, jabones, galletas, chiverías, gaseosas, etc. Susana mujer de 42 años de edad su negocio es la venta de químicos, frijoles crudos, frijoles cocidos, leña y Gladys mujer de 46 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de frescos y ropa.
texts.en: This group is made up of three associates, and one of them is Karla. She is 40 years old, single, and has one son who is 15 years old. She has run a grocery store from her home for 4 years and her daughter helps her manage her business. She has been a client of this financial institution for 5 years and she needs this loan to purchase basic necessities like rice, beans, oil, sugar, soaps, cookies, snacks, soda etc. Susana is 42 years old and she sells chemicals, raw beans, cooked beans, firewood, and Gladys is 46 years old and she runs a business selling refreshments and clothes.

loans.use: purchase basic necessities like rice, beans, oil, sugar, soaps, cookies, snacks and sodas.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel V. has 20 years of experience making and selling sandals. He inherited his shop from his father and still remembers being a young boy working in the shop. Over time he had a family of his own and separated himself somewhat from his father. During that time, Daniel started working in masonry with the help of his wife and children. Unfortunately, Daniel’s father passed away, and he is responsible for managing both businesses. Mr. V. reports that he has been able to earn enough to feed, clothe, and educate his family, but he has grander visions for growing his two businesses. This hard-working entrepreneur opens up shop every day a 8am and closes at 8pm. 

Daniel needs this loan so that he can purchase material for sandal-making like leather and thread. He is a 38-year old married man from Guayaquil, Ecuador, and he has three beautiful children. Daniel’s wife mainly takes care of the children and household duties like laundry and cleaning, but she does a fair share of the work at “Sandalias Daniel.” Daniel’s goal is to become a large distributor of sandals in Ecuador by consistently growing his venture and creating word of mouth about his great products.

loans.use: Daniel needs this loan so that he can purchase material for sandal-making like leather and thread

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: I am a single man. aged 21. I dropped out of school due to lack of school fees. I will use the money to expand my business and be able to pay for college  fees.

loans.use: I will use the money to expand my business.

loans.name: Sailah

texts.en: Sailah lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all members of her family. Her husband is jobless because he is sick. They have a son who has a bicycle shop and he also sells bicycle kits. His mother took her 4th cycle group loan so that he could buy more kits for his shop to make good business for his family. Now his mother wants to take anther loan so that he can buy extra materials to expand his business. Now he is very happy and he would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy extra materials

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia is 44 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Three of them work in Argentina and only son, who is 13 yeas old, lives with Lucia and her husband. Her husband is 49 years old and is employed in a textile business. Lucia worked for several years in the same textile business as her husband, but after a reduction in personnel, Lucia was left without a job and she received a severance payment.

Since she is a very entrepreneurial kind of person, she immediately invested her severance pay in her own business, based in her home. Lucia has a small grocery store in her house, where she sells all kinds of basic goods, such as sugar, bread, corn, dairy products, mate herb (used to make a type of tea), etc. The business is going very well for Lucia. With a previous loan she added on to her house so that she would have more physical space for storage. Demand for her products is high, thanks to her good location—there is no competition in the neighborhood.

Lucia needs to increase her stock of merchandise in order to keep up with demand. In order to do this, she is requesting a loan of $300.00, which she will use to buy mate herb, sugar, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, wine, and breads.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia; tiene 44 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, tres D. los cuales trabajan en la Argentina y solo su hijo menor D. 13 años vive con ellos. Su esposo tiene 49 años y es empleado D. una empresa textil. Lucia trabajó varios años en la misma empresa textil que su marido, pero luego D. una reducción D. personal, Lucia quedo sin trabajo y cobró una indemnización por su despido. Como ella es una persona activa y emprendedora, inmediatamente invirtió el dinero cobrado por la indemnización y montó su propio negocio en su casa. Lucia posee una despensa en su casa, done venD. todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad, como azúcar, pan, maíz, lácteos, yerba mate, etc. A Lucia le va muy bien con su negocio, con un préstamo obtenido anteriormente ha ampliado su casa para poder contar con un mayor espacio físico para el almacén; la demanda D. sus productos es muy alta gracias a su buena ubicación, pues no tiene competencia en la zona. Hoy Lucia se ve en la necesidad D. ampliar el surtido D. su mercadería, para poder abastecer su demanda, para ello solicita un préstamo D. $300 que lo utilizará para comprar yerba mate, azúcar, gaseosas, productos enlatados, aceite, vino y panificados.

loans.use: To buy mate herb, sugar, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, wine, and breads

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Mrs. Regina O. travels from Benin to other states in Nigeria to buy traveling bags and boxes for sale. She is 48 years old and is married to Mr. O., and they have seven (7) children. She has been with LAPO for the past 5 years. She hails from Benin City and has been in this business since 1998.

loans.use: To buy more bags and boxes

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. is a 28 year old mother of three children. Alice and her husband live in Rongo, Kenya. She has received and successfully repaid two microfinance loans from KMET. She began her tailoring business in the year 2002. She specializes in both men's and women's clothing. She currently offers training to 4 teenage school drop-outs in dressmaking. To cope with demand she has employed an additional tailor.

The central location of her shop and her many years of doing good business within the community has gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base. She has combined the additional money from K-MET with hard work and perseverance thus building a successful income-generating business. Alice is proud of her accomplishments and that she is now able to contribute to paying household expenses. She requires US $800 to further expand her business, increase the variety of clothes-making materials and purchase tailoring supplies to keep up with the growing demand.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John S. is a carpenter who specializeds in making furniture. He is not married and has no children. John is losing his costumers due to the fact that he is still using his old methods of manufacturing, which are slower. He wants to change with the times and go into the mechanical method.

He is asking for $1,200 to buy a cutting machine, tools, electrical sprayers and other equipment to enable him to stay in business.

loans.use: Buy a cutting machine, tools, electrical sprayers

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva A. tries to think about the future. 5 years ago she saw the necessity of having extra income, with what her husband was making they wouldn’t be able to cover their children’s school expenses. So 5 years ago she began to sell jewelry to neighbors and friends. Little by little she became known in the neighborhood, thanks to recommendation that she received from her customers. Eva provides excellent customer service.

Nevertheless today she doesn’t have sufficient stock to be able to offer new items to her customers so Eva is asking for a US $200 loan in order to buy new merchandise and therefore provide better customer service and product to her customers. Eva is going to repay the loan in 6 months. And she hopes with your help she will be able to obtain sales of this merchandise in order to be able to gain customers from other neighborhoods to expand her clientele base.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Eva A. trata de pensar en el futuro. Puesto que hace 5 años que vio la necesidad de tener unos ingresos extras. Puesto que con lo que gana su esposo no les iba a alcanzar para cubrir todos los gastos de sus hijos en la escuela. Fue por eso que hace 5 años comenzó a vender productos de joyería entre sus vecinas y amigas. Fue así como poco a poco se fue dando a conocer entre los de su colonia, gracias a las recomendaciones que obtiene de sus clientes. Puesto que el servicio que ofrece Eva es de mucha atención.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con suficiente surtido para poder ofrecerle novedades a sus clientes es por eso que Eva está solicitando un crédito de US $200 para poder comprar nueva mercancía y así brindarles una mejor atención y surtido para sus clientes. Eva está dispuesta a pagar este dinero en un plazo de 6 meses. Y espera con tu ayuda poder obtener ventas de estas mercancías para asó poder obtener clientes de otras colonias para ampliar su mercado.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in order to have a good supply of product.

loans.name: Wakimese E Group

texts.en:
The leader for this small group is Kuruthum N.. She is currently in the business of wholesale and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Kuruthum is 32 years old and is single. She has 4 children ranging in age from one to seven years.

Kuruthum is joined in her small group by Phiona N., Rashida N., Madina N., and Miriam N.. Phiona N. has a business in a market stall and wants to purchase more raw foods. Rashida N. is currently operating a retail shop and wants to increase her stock. Madina N. operates a poultry business and wants to buy poultry feed. Miriam Naluwooza is an herbalist and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Kikabala East A Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Edith B..  She is currently in the business of clothing sales and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Edith is 45 years old and is married.  She has 9 children ranging from age 16 to 30 and her children go to school.  Each week, Edith makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to venture into another business.  Edith is joined in her small group by Sida B., Madina N., Annet B., and Florence K..  Sida B. has a business running a restaurant and wants to add furniture.  Madina N. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to boost business.  Annet B. operates a business selling produce and wants to add to her business.  Florence K. is currently in the business of trading produce and is requesting a loan to add capital.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Stage Hera Kende Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Solomon has been in the business of buying second-hand clothing in bulk and retailing the same. He is married with 4 children who are all school-going. He buys the clothes in bulk from Nairobi and transports them to Kisumu for retailing. He has been in this business for over 5 years now. One of his primary motivations for choosing this business is because of the readily available market due to the high poverty levels in Kisumu town.

He buys his stock every 2 weeks and sells the clothing not only in Kisumu Town but also in neighboring markets on the outskirts of Kisumu. He goes to these markets on their specific market days.

The post-election violence in Kisumu Town affected him negatively as it meant he couldn’t sell his clothes for quite sometime. There was, however, an opportunity for him as well in this situation since most people now can’t afford to buy new clothes and have to rely on second-hand clothes for survival. He hopes to take advantage of this opportunity by taking a refinanced loan to enable him to carry on with his earlier business. His business had been making profits before the violence enabling him to frequently restock his business and pay his loan as well. His loan repayments have been on schedule and so have been the group repayments.

He has been the secretary for his group and has done a good job particularly in ensuring that the group has its loan balances kept intact. The group has also been cohesive and with good repayment rates before the post-election violence. They see the refinancing as an opportunity to get back to their normal business state as soon as possible.

In addition to being cohesive, the group has had good repayment rates in earlier loans and have been having timely meeting on their rescheduled meeting days. Solomon, in addition to his secretarial duties, has played a huge role in energizing the group through constant faith-based encouragements during the violence period.

Disclaimer: Kiva is working with OI-WEDCO to refinance businesses disrupted by Kenya's post-election violence. The group above has received loans from OI-WEDCO in the past and is now working to rebuild their businesses and to get back on their feet. Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To reconstruct and expand businesses after post-election violence

loans.name: Martina's Group

texts.en:
Martina is twenty-five years old and a buddimg entrepreneur. She runs a beauty salon that is well-known by people of Bonito community of Santo Domingo, her hometown. Martina is planning to use her loan buy a new line of hair care and hair treatment products to resell in her business. The entrepreneur explains that services offered at her beauty salon are still limited, but she plans on adding new ones in the future. She even thinks about hiring one or two girls to help her attend to the customers when business substantially grows.

Martina will receive the funds together with the following entrepreneurs: Juana Mercedes A. D., a beauty salon owner Rosa Yvelisse F. R., to supply a clothing store María Altagracia D. L. S. F., to buy shirts and shoes Inocencia C. M., for a small clothing shop. Picture: from left to right: Juana, Martina, Rosa, María, Inocencia

loans.use: Purchase of products for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Sumaq Warmikuna Group

texts.es:
The communal bank “Sumaq Warmikuna”, which means “Beautiful Women” in the Incan dialect of quechua, is a newly-started institution with 14 members. The members are from the Asoc. Villa Militar, which is located 15 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

The members conduct a variety of types of businesses such as the sale of cereals, groceries, sweets, cosmetics, clothing and beverages. They market their goods in their neighborhoods, as well as on foot throughout the city of Ayacucho.

The members need different loan amounts, some need 300 Peruvian soles, others 600 soles, making the total loan 6,900 from the bank.

The loans will be invested into the purchase of sugar, rice, oil, milk, noodles, wheat, quinoa, beans, cookies, candies and sodas.

Their dreams incluD. expanding their businesses, building their homes and providing a good education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal “Sumaq Warmikuna” que significa “Mujeres Hermosas” en quechua, es un Banco que recién inicia con 14 socias. Las socias son D. la Asoc. Villa Militar que se ubica a 15 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, abarrotes, golosinas, cosméticos, ropas, bebidas. Sus ventas lo realizan en su barrio y también en la ciudad D. Ayacucho D. manera ambulatoria.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 6,900 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra azúcar, arroz, aceite, leche, fideo, trigo, cebada, quinua, haba, galletas, caramelos y gaseosas

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Their loan will be invested into the purchase of sugar, rice, oil, milk, noodles, wheat, quinoa, beans, cookies, candies and sodas.

loans.name: Vitolia

texts.en: 43 year old Vitoria S. L. is married, with four children.  She has built four years of experience selL. BBQ foods to passerby traffic for three days a week. From this business, she earns a weekly net cash flow of 620 Tala (~258 USD).  SPBD loans are Vitoria’s only access to capital because she has not qualified for loans from traditional banks. She is requesting a loan to purchase lamb flaps, chicken, sausages, soya sauce, tomato sauce, onions and rice. She will also use part of the loan to  renovate her house and pay for her children's school fees. She has received four previous loans with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase food items for business

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is widowed, is 46, and has 3 children. She has a little business specializing in events organization. Her services incluD. food-making, local lay-out, cooking pies, and renting a place to hold the event. She now has 4 rented places for receptions. She has employees to help her out in her various activities. She also travels to the province to organize events and family reunions.

Magdalena belongs to the Kusirikuy ("Be happy" in Quechua) Village Bank. She needs a 1600 soles loan to buy flour, butter, milk, creams, and fritters.

She dreams about expanding her business, setting up new machines, and having a car to carry her products. She also would like to have a store.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, milk, creams, and fritters

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.en:
The Las Margaritas group is comprised of 13 women and one man who live in the La Ramada area of Santa Cruz de la Sierra in tropical eastern Bolivia. Three of the group members (Juan Carlos, Rossy and Esperanza) are siblings. 

The group members are involved in different businesses, mostly in sales: Marcelina, Lucia, Magda and Isabel sell cosmetics, Kelly has a bakery, Fabiola and Esperanza sell clothing, Rosa sells artifacts, Paola sells toys, Juan Carlos is in construction, Gloria has an Internet café, Vanessa is a stylist, and Roxana sells crafts. The members have different levels of experience in their lines of work. Most of them have had their businesses from one to three years, although Susana has been selling her merchandise for 12 years. 

The group is taking out this loan with the hope of growing their respective businesses, and most of them will use the money to buy more merchandise to sell. 

Most of the members have had previous experience with loans at other Bolivian microfinance institutions, such as Pro Mujer and Crecer.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
La Sr. D. tiene 69 años de edad, es casado, tiene 1hijos que esta estudiando en la facultad.

El Sr. D. es propietario de un despensa en su casa propia, inició como taxi carga en el mercado de Limpio, luego consiguió un puesto en el mercado de Limpio despues de unos años ahorro y decidió abrir su negocio en su propia casa.

Despues de varios años de trabajo decidio quedarse en su casa ,para poder pagar la facultad de su hijo para que pueda tener un futuro mejor y no pasar todas las penurias que paso

Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas en general, como gaseosas, cervezas, vinos y otros.
texts.en:
Mr. D. is 69 years old. He is married and has one son who is in college.

Mr. D. is the proprietor of a grocery store which he runs out of his home. He started working as a taxi in the Limpio market and then obtained a stall in the market. After several years, he saved money and decided to open his business in his own home.

After many years he decided to keep his business in his home so he could pay his son's tuition so that his son will have a better future and not have to go through all the hardships that he has gone through.

He is asking for this loan to purchase beverages such as soft drinks, beer, wines and others.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages such as beer, wine and soft drinks.

loans.name: Tith

texts.en: Mrs. Tith M. is a villager in Phneas Village in the Takeo Province. Mrs. Tith M. is 27 years old and is the mother of a three year old child. She and her husband, Mr. Hem Sien, own a piece of land on which they cultivate rice. The field is infertile and is providing a small crop. In order to alleviate this problem, Mrs. Tith M. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to increase crop yield. Her husband is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda L. is married to Edgardo, a tricycle operator . The couple is blessed with three children: Mark Christian, 7; Ana Angel,  4; and John Patrick, 1. The family lives in a small village located along the mountainside and is far from the town proper of Ilagan, Isabela. Most of the villagers cultivate corn and rice to support themselves. 

Hilda sells generic medicines in their neighborhood because there is no clinic in the area and drug stores are far away.  She sells medicines for common problems such as stomachache, toothache, dizziness, headache, diarrhea,  muscle pain, flu, cough, and fever.  She has been in this business for six years.

Hilda is requesting a loan of Php7, 000 to expand her business.  She plans to purchase additional medicines that are needed by her customers.  

She also intends to use some of her loan to repair her husband’s motorcycle so he can continue his work and generate additional income for their daily needs.  They also want to save money for the education of their children.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Hugo Alberto

texts.es:
Hugo Alberto y su esposa tienen dos hijos y están en edad escolar, ellos viven al poniente de la ciudad, este fraccionamiento es uno de los más poblados y por lo tanto la inseguridad se hace presente.
Una de las más urgentes necesidades de la familia es proteger su patrimonio. Para ello hay que construir una barda e instalar un portón.
Solicita un préstamo para poder llevar acabo su proyecto y mantener la tranquilidad de su hogar, pues cada vez que salen es una preocupación y no saben si encontrarán todo igual.
En el momento de la visita no se encontraba el Sr. Hugo, estaba trabajando; por tal motivo sale su esposa y su hija.
texts.en:
Hugo Alberto and his wife have two school-age children and live in the west end of the city, one of the most densely populated and therefore unsafe areas. One of the most important concerns for his family is the protection of their assets. To do so they must build a fence and a gate. Hugo Alberto is asking for a loan to undertake this project and maintain the peace of his home, as every time they leave they worry that they will not find things as they left them. At the time of the visit to take the photograph Mr. Hugo was at work, so his wife and daughter came out instead.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a fence and gate

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Grace D. from Tukuyu. She is single. Grace has been running a "genge" business since 2005. The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

Grace works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Grace currently earns about 300 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to purchase sugar, rice beans, cooking oil,chili, and and other items for her business. In the future, she plans to increase the variety and quantity of her inventory. Grace thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase  sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil, chili and and other items

loans.name: Jacinto Bernabe

texts.es: Jacinto Bernabé A. M. tiene 33 años, está casado, y tiene una hija de 8 años. La actividad económica a la que Don Jacinto se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general, como faldas, camisas, y pantalones entre otros. Hace cuatro años que tiene este negocio, y la ubicación es de manera ambulante por lo que también labora en una tienda donde venden ropa. Don Jacinto inició en esta actividad económica con el objetivo de tener otra fuente de ingresos,  y su propósito es establecer un lugar fijo donde pueda ofertar sus productos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para el crecimiento económico y la disponibilidad de mercadería donde se oferte variedad para los distintos gustos de sus clientes. Últimamente, su deseo es localizar un lugar en donde pueda encontrar la ropa que el vende a un menor precio y de esta manera, da más cómodos sus productos. Con respeto al futuro, los sueños de Don Jacinto son lograr que su familia salga adelante en la situación que atraviesan.
texts.en:
Jacinto Bernabé A. M. is 33 years old, married, and has one daughter who is eight years old. Jacinto’s economic activity involves the sale of general merchandise, such as skirts, shirts, and pants, among other items. He has had the business for four years, and he sells on foot and also works at a clothing store. Jacinto started his enterprise with the objective of having another source of income, and is goal is to establish a fixed location from which to offer his products. The loan financing would be destined as working capital, for economic growth, and to be able to meet the different needs of his customers by having more variety in his merchandise. Ultimately, his wish is buy the clothing he sells at a lower price that would allow him greater profits. With respect to the future, Jacinto’s dream is to help his family get ahead and past the situation they are in.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Хушназаров Сухроб 1977 года рождения, женат имеет 3 детей. Жена домохозяйка, сам он недалеко от дома продает горюче-смазочный материалы: бензин, керосин, моторные масла. Кредит получает впервые, обратился в нашу организацию по совету друзей. Сухробу понравились условия кредитования, и решил получить кредит. 
	Хочет получить займ в сумме 10000 сроком на год.
texts.en:
Suhrob H. was born in 1977, he is married and has 3 children. His wife is a homemaker and he sells fuel: gasoline, kerosene and motor oil not far from home. This is Suhrob’s first loan, he turned to our organization on the advice of friends. Suhrob liked the credit terms and he decided to receive credit. He would like to take out a loan of 10,000 somoni for a one year period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fuel

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo Máximino C. tiene la edad de 61 años, su estado civil es soltera. Don Rodrigo tiene 2 hijos. Don Rodrigo tiene 2 hijos. La actividad económica es la venta de refrescos. Hace más de siete años que se dedica a este dedica a este negocio. Don Rodrigo inicio trabajando a temprana edad buscando otra alternativa de ingresos. Los propósitos de Don Rodrigo son de mantener activo su negocio y también mejorar la calida de sus refrescos. El financiamiento que Don Rodrigo solicita es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita comprar maíz, posol, cacao y tiste. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 5.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Rodrigo Máximino C. is 61 years old and single. He has two children. He earns income by selling soft drinks, work which he has done for more than 7 years. Rodrigo began working at an early age seeking alternatives for earning money. He intends to keep his business active while at the same time improving the quality of his beverages. The money that Rodrigo is requesting will go towards capital that will allow him to buy corn, posol (another type of corn often used in soft drinks), cocoa, and tiste (a drink made from corn and cocoa). He is requesting $250.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase ingredients and beverages

loans.name: J. Humberto

texts.es:
El señor J. Humberto S. esta solicitando un préstamo para poder construir un techo de madera al frente de la casa. No cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicionales a su trabaja. Su esposa la señora Blanca Leticia Tamez, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada al frente de la vivienda, para el es importante que este en buenas condiciones el lugar donde su esposa trabaja ya que es un ingreso mas a la familia.
En la foto aparece la señora Blanca Leticia ya que el señor J. Humberto se encontraba en su trabajo portal motivo ella fue quien nos atendió.
texts.en:
Mr. J. Humberto S. is requesting a loan to be able to build a wooden roof at the front of his house. He does not have the money needed to buy the materials since he is planning to make the improvements himself on a schedule in addition to his regular work. His wife, Mrs. Blanca Leticia Tamez, has a small business selling used clothing in the front of the house. For him it is important that the area where his wife works be in good condition since this is an additional income for the family. The photo shows Mrs. Blanca Leticia as Mr. J. Humberto was at his job so that she met with us.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wood roof at the front of his house

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 31-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Youssef has been working as a car painter since 2000. He requested a loan of 3000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and paint for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work. Youssef is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and paint

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 60-year-old Mariam M. from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 42 and 46. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Mariam has been running an Irish potatoes business since 1999, purchasing and selling Irish potatoes. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and currently earns about $50 a month. Mariam is requesting a loan in order to cultivate Irish potatoes. In the future, she plans to farm potatoes in larger quantities. She thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To cultivate Irish potatoes

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel S. D. G. is 52 years old and married to Eladio Jimenez, who is 58 years old. He works in the municipality. They have two older children, one of which works in Itaipu and the other son is working in Spain.

Three years ago she began selling silver jewelry after a friend told her about the business. With much effort, she was able to form a clientele, and then applied for a loan with the Foundation to acquire more jewelry so she can fill her day to day orders.

loans.use: Purchase silver jewelry.

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en:
Ifeoma O. is 30 years old and married with two children.  She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Ifeoma sells second-hand clothes and hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. 

Ifeoma says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group 1

texts.en:
Ana Robertina C. Bonillo, who appears in the middle in the photo, is the coordinator of her 5-member loan group.

Ana lives in the Guaricanos sector of Santo Domingo Norte. She is a single mother and lives with her three boys, ages 18, 15, and 14. All three attend school. The oldest just graduated from high school and plans to begin college in the fall, where he will study graphic design. For the last three years, Ana has sold general beauty products and underwear around her town, but it has not been a stable income for her, due to lack of resources.

Ana plans to use this Kiva loan to invest in a good amount of merchandise for her business. Specifically, she plans to purchase hair products, underwear, and hair accessories, which are the products with greatest demand. She will also buy small quantities of some other hair products as an experiment and see if there is demand for them.

Her goals for this loan are to be able to establish her business, and to have a permanent location for the business so that she will not have to go walking around her town selling her products any longer. She dreams that all of her children graduate from college and that she will eventually own her own hair salon and have two or three employees.

loans.use: Hair products, underwear, and hair accessories

loans.name: Jeny

texts.es: Jeny tiene 28 años, es madre de un hijo de 10 años y vive con su esposo, quien trabaja en una maderera. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos, productos de belleza, ropa y carteras, artículos que los exhibe en un pequeño mostrador en su casa. A Jeny le gusta mucho este negocio porque se mantiene ocupada, además le es rentable porque ya tiene clientes regulares que le hace pedidos constantemente y le pagan al contado, aunque también vende al crédito, pero son la minoría de sus clientes. Gracias a este trabajo y junto a las ganancias de su esposo están logrando solventar sus necesidades y los estudios de su pequeño hijo, quien en retribución al esfuerzo de sus padres, es un buen estudiante. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP y lo que más le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que son bien organizados y responsables.
